The eggplant caviar was delicious and the lamb  tagine was AMAZING! Highly recommend this place if you’re looking for a break from Vietnamese food and want a filling and delicious dinner!

Thank you from Luke and Laura :)

Very cozy restaurant with an amazing atmosphere and cuisine!
And I really appreciate the Chef’s attention to my Birthday :)
Thanks a lot for this tasty experience☺️
Fantastic service and atmosphere but the star of the show is definitely the food! Thank you for squeezing us in! (I would book in as once) Just amazing!
The shop is cutely decorated.

Thanks to Baldi for giving us such good advice, we feel like a passionate cook, the food is delicious. The products are fresh and cooked to order. We had a wonderful evening.
I highly recommend

The space of the restaurant is super cute. The food is quality, especially the pizza.
The restaurant is located in a small street so it is quiet, quite chill and airy.
The owners are extremely cute.
Very cozy restaurant with a great host and delicious Moroccan food! Highly recommended.

Great Food, Great Atmosphere, Great Service.

Listen to the Chef’s advice, Great Knowledge, Great Place.

Great everything.

Found this gem on Google and were delighted to get Moroccan food in Danang!  We walked from our Canvas Hotel and found this very delightful restaurant with indoor and outdoor seating. The owner/chef came outside to tell us specifics about the menu and his personal recommendations. EVERYTHING was delectable and well-presented and oh so fresh.  Large portions to share with others at the table.  Please try Bladi out!
Great food and a very comfy place with nice staff :)!

The most enjoyable food experience in Danang. The food and service was excellent, seeing us go back again and taking our friends, who also thoroughly enjoyed it. Sam is a wonderful friendly Chef and host. It is most definitely well worth the visit.

Thanks again Sam and team.

Everything about this place is wonderful. Sam, the owner, and his wife are so warm and welcoming, and this is reflected in everything about the restaurant. The decor is lovely and the food is absolutely incredible. Each dish was more delicious than the last, presented beautifully. 10/10, should be a must for anyone who is in Da Nang.

Also, easily broken leg accessible 😊
Sorry Chef but I got intoxicated with your Tartare de boeuf (raw meat). 2 days in bed 😔

My favorite restaurant during my stay in da nang. Came here twice and everything I ordered was  delicious and high quality. Lamb shank was very good and the oriental burger was one of the best burgers I've ever had. The owner clearly takes pride in the food and service. Highly recommend coming here.

Bladi restaurant. Nothing much to say... Except that it's excellent.. Everything into the menu is Tasty and delicious.! The quality is Fan-Tas-Tic, lot of choices! I highly recommend this place: the  lamb tajine, tabouleh, brandade, salmon, chicken tajine, bread.. everything is  yummy and absolutly Delicious! Colorful food and deco 😍👍

Read about this place online as we were in need of an afternoon snack, we shared the karan hummus and the zaalouk eggplant caviar and washed it down with the Moroccan mint tea, I cannot speak highly enough of the food. Was very authentic and absolutely delicious. The owner is very friendly and attentive. We do hope we have time to come back here for a proper dinner! Thank you!!

Simply the Best. Seriously, the Best!

I would have given him more stars but max was only 5. You love the atmosphere there, the love that he puts into the food and the passion he brings to the customers when talking about his menu. And yeah, #GordonRamsay was one of his first Stations on his Food Journey.

I am difficult to please, but the moment we sat down,  we knew...this is the non-plus ultra experience.

I have found my favorite place in Da Nang again 😁
This is a restaurant where you can enjoy Moroccan cuisine, and the owner is a very gentle and friendly person. When I asked them about the dishes, they explained them thoroughly and in a fun way, so it was a really fun time✨

I highly recommend this restaurant. The atmosphere is warm and we were perfectly welcomed! The food was excellent, the service perfect, we really enjoyed ourselves! The price was largely profitable for the quantity and especially the quality of the products. Thank you!
I have never eaten such a delicacy in my life. The nicest staff in the world. Clean, modern. I can recommend it to everyone.
Just like home
So tasty...Sam is wonderful chef and person to talk with. Try Harira there and enjoy. I tried also the Salmon it was yummy.
Bad service. Came in the middle of the day. The stuff just refused to serve us without the reason.

Should you be in the mood for something else than Vietnamese food, and want to try well-prepared, delicious dishes, this is a place for you. This Moroccan restaurant offers a whole food experience with the friendly, helpful service, the dishes, the wine and the whole atmosphere. Frankly, you should just listen to the staff and pick one of their recommendations.
Authentic Moroccan food, the owner/chef is super cool too! Highly recommend :-)

If/when you're in Danang, you must go and have dinner here at Bladi !
Excellent food and service in a great location.

In one word: excellent. Every dish was perfection. The deep and layered flavors at Bladi are hard to describe. You will just have to go taste it for yourself. Listen to the recommendations of the staff for food and (if you drink alcohol) wine.

I had a wonderful experience today. I ordered the tagine kefta and it was absolutely delicious. The meat was tender and flavorful, and the sauce was rich and hearty. The spices used in the dish were perfectly balanced, making for a truly enjoyable meal. The service was also excellent, with the waitstaff being attentive and friendly. I highly recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for a taste of authentic Moroccan cuisine.

This restaurant offered the best service we have experienced in Vietnam so far. The owner is very attentive. He even remembered our order after coming here once. The food is extremely good and the atmosphere / decor is lovely. Would definitely recommend!
Lovely atmosphere, great service and the pizza is to die for. A bit pricey but that is totally OK considering the quality of the food.
Out of this world experience. Top quality food. The chef takes your order and brings the food himself. For 2 meals, 1 dessert and 4 glasses of wine we paid a little over 1.3 million vnd.

As Moroccans, we're quite attached to our cuisine, and we miss it when we spend several months traveling abroad. We had an excellent dinner at Baldi; it was a great joy to be able to eat as well as we do back home! Chef Sam makes every guest feel at home; he and his wife are very welcoming!
The quality is exceptional.
If you're ever in Da Nang, I 1000% recommend going there!

I have been traveling in Asia for two months, and today I went to Bladi! This Moroccan restaurant took me back to my childhood country thanks to its delicious dishes and Moroccan hospitality. I found all the flavors of the bled (Morocco), it was very tasty!! Chef Sam and his wife are incredibly kind. As a Moroccan, I validate and recommend Bladi restaurant. The prices are very reasonable for the quality of the meals. I recommend and encourage you to go there!!
First time here  Food was so good as it's prepared when ordered. The Morrocan bread was baked inhouse

Friendly owner and delicious food.
You can enjoy Moroccan cuisine in Da Nang.
The salad is generous in portions and healthy.
The lamb is small and lightly seasoned.
The soup looks like rice in soybean paste.
Hidden gem! Glad we went there during our short stay in Danang. We will be back!!
Authentic

There were 6 of us and we went without a reservation! However, Sam was really nice and managed to arrange a table in less than 10 minutes! The food was so good that we finished every dish completely, not a single drop left! Best Moroccan food I have ever had! If you are in Danang, don't miss it but remember to make a reservation as the restaurant is "very small" in Sam's own words!

i believe the kind soul make the kindest food and that what i found when i eat at bladi restaurant by chef sameer

highly recommended morrocan restaurant, he serve Halal food.
its tasty - but the size is quite small for the price (medium pizza is a lot smaler than 26cm in diameter)

I agree that every restaurant owner has the right to run their business as they want to, but for me it's completely not understandable that a restaurant doesn't want their menus to be visible for customers to find it. Same as my right as a customer to reward such places with bad review. How else can a customer know what they offer on the menu and if to come for a meal? Unless they simply don't care, which is of course just fine. Even after I asked for the menu, no one even replied. For me, simply a bad customer service.
Loved the food and service - highly recommend the lamb shank (and what Samir recommends!)
Pricey with average food. Morrocan pizza was a letdown.
Small and charming restaurant with big delicious dishes, the chef is friendly and welcoming. I went in a day time, but I believe in the evening it gets even more authentic look.

I want to share our first try here and it was ……. ?
>>>>>>>> EXCELLENT<<<<<<<<<<
My favorite is the pineapple taboule looove it !!
It will won’t be our the last time. Authentic atmosphere nice owner
My wife and i had one of the best meals we have ever had in Danang, thank you, lovely little place

Excellent, to all travelers from Asia who want to rediscover the taste of the country, go there with your eyes closed! The quality and the taste are there ☺️ it is a brother and his wife who run the restaurant, between the harira, the chicken with olives and the welcome you will not be disappointed. Thanks again for the exchanges 👌🏽 (and it is halal obviously)
Great mint tea very authentic taste. The burger and pizza was good too. A very friendly owner who give his best. Very nice
Not bad.  Should add local Vietnamese food but halal version
Great pizza! Above all, a super friendly chef who cooks with love, which you can really feel during your visit!
We had a great time, there is nothing better than than true Mediterranean hospitality. Thank you very much for the outstanding food, great service and the good vibes you offer us.
The food is brilliant 👏 👌 and the owner is super friendly 😀

This is a hidden gem in DaNang.
Bladi serves delicious Morrocan food cooked with love in a charming little house near My Khe beach (5min walk).

The menu offers options for all kinds of diets, which makes this an excellent choice for a family-style food sharing experience. Definitely come with an appetite.

Everything we ordered was yummy. The chicken tagine was superb. The briswat was an  excellent recommemdation for a starter.  Loved the eggplant caviar dip. We devoured their hearty tomatoe-based soup (forgot the name), but it was a cross between a thick minestrone and chilli. It was a warm hug in a bowl. Don't forget to reward yourself after cleaning off your plates with an order of Morrocan mint tea that comes in a large traditional tea pot.  A great way to sweeten your tooth, freshen your palette and soothe your now stuffed belly.

Be sure to book in advance! Reservations is a must. When you taste the food you'll see why.
Truly amazing food in a cozy, intimate space. Samir is a gem of a chef and host. You can't go wrong with anything on the menu, but make reservations in advance, it is a small restaurant.

We had an extremly nice evening, with some amazing food. Really enjoyed the marrocan cuisine here. Especially the Hummus, Lentiö soup and the salmon dish.

We would recommend this - Girlfriend also approved this ;)

Exotic morrocan style cuisine
Was so happy to find a hidden gem
You can go there with your eyes closed and don't hesitate to follow the chef's recommendations. The setting, the food, the hospitality—everything is there for a great time.

An incredible evening! Truly excellent food, with attentive service.
The manager/chef is very kind and always attentive.
Thanks again!

It's a really nice restaurant with cute decor.
We came here as a group of 5 adults and 3 babies. My friends were told there would be a wait on their lamb, which was fine, but there was a wait on everything. …

While staying in Vietnam for a few weeks, we were looking for a restaurant that offered a change from the local cuisine. We stumbled upon Bledi, a charming restaurant serving Moroccan specialties, and it was a delight! I don't regret it; we …

One of the best Moroccan restaurants in Da Nang! I had briwates, Tajine with kefta and Moroccan soup, very delicious and it made me travel to Morocco! Go there with your eyes closed and the staff is very friendly and always smiling! Very nice atmosphere and very calm! This restaurant deserves 5 stars from me!

Bladi is one of those very special places that I would recommend to anyone who is in Danang. The food is just outstanding - cooked with so much love too! Pretty sure I’ve tried every dish on the menu so here are my favourites - the briwat, …
OMG! was amazing pizza, briwat & lamb. The first time I try Moroccan food and I really love it. Thanks for made it, thanks for polite, kindness and friendly services, this is a very good experience.
Delicious pizza and burger, crispy crust. The lamb is soft and absorbs the spices, so ordering handmade bread to eat with it will be more delicious 🌼 …

My family of 4 went, afraid that my parents would not like the food, the owner enthusiastically advised me on the most suitable dish for my taste. The food was delicious, the pizza was the best compared to any pizza place I have ever eaten, my parents also praised it a lot. You should try it everyone!
Amazing foods 😍 …

We ate here and there, and the food was inedible. I've rarely eaten Moroccan food this bad. A friend of mine dared to leave a 3/5 review of the restaurant. He immediately received threats from the owner on Facebook, and his review was deleted from Google.

We realize that it's unacceptable for this restaurant to receive such a high rating, given the quality of the food.

Very happy to see a diversity of restaurant perspectives in Da Nang. Without places like this, the city would be bland.

First time trying Moroccan food and let me say it blew away my expectations.  We asked the chef, Sam, for his recommendations and every dish was a magical experience. You can tell he put so much flavor, love and quality to his food.  Price was very reasonable.  If you're in Da Nang, I highly recommend try it here.  You'll definitely regret it.

A genuinely unexpected surprise...I was looking for a good pizza restaurant to try and saw Bladi online. THANK YOU SAM for a memorable night ,service and great food.
This restaurant is a must whenever u visit Danang...it will be a regular for us without doubt.
Cheers

Great place to stay in Da Nang! The food is excellent and the decor is really nice!

If you want to eat something special here, this restaurant is a good choice. The restaurant recommended by Chef of La Maison 1888 (Inter-continental Danang)

We ate pizza here today and had a very nice dinner. The pizza was incredibly delicious, and the recommended wine paired it perfectly. The owner of the restaurant was very attentive and knows how to look after his guests professionally.
Furthermore, the restaurant is truly beautifully designed and invites you to linger.
We would love to come back.
An amazing intimate experience, I would highly recommend!

Lovely dinner in a very welcoming and well-kept restaurant!
The owner and chef cooks French/Moroccan dishes, and everything we tried was delicious! The pizza was also excellent (incredibly so!)!! Highly recommended for anyone looking for a quiet evening and great food that's truly unique!

Lovely experience! We ordered the Fish Brandade, a taste totally different to what we are used to and we really enjoyed it. The Traditional Soup was delicious. The BlaDi Salad was nice but nothing special. The owner came a few times to chat with us. It’s nice to see the cooks involved outside the kitchen. Absolutely amazing experience. The taste of the food was new for us, and we just bloody love it! 😍 I would highly recommend the Fish Brandade from El Jadida. A new favourite in our list!
The owner is fabulous, always smiling, asking if everything is okay and explaining the origin of the food. Staff is great.
We would love to come back! Do not wait to come here!

We chose the restaurant based on Google ratings and were not mistaken. We ordered soup and a burger. Very tasty. The owner of this place is from Morocco, he cooked with love, it is obvious that the person likes what he does. In general, I recommend it!

We only leave reviews when a restaurant is exceptional and the staff here were attentive, funny and humble.

The owner is exactly what you hope for when you dine.

We shared a pizza and it’s the best pizza We’ve ever had, even in Italy!

A very nice small restaurant with the best fresh juices and salads. The food is outstanding and the pizzas are one of the best I ever had.

Amazing place run by Moroccan French guy Sam and his wife. Great authentic Morrocan food, good portions, affordable prices, great hospitality.

Wow! Each plate was better than the previous one. One can taste the fine ingredients and love in each dish. The first time we went we had the best pizza I've ever eaten! The second night we had the lamb.... oh my, such a treat. The Chef Sam and his lovely wife make you feel at home. I wish I lived closer and this would be a regular place for me. Much love you two! You're in for a treat when you choose Bladi for your meal.
The chef and his wife were great hosts...  tell hummus had a nice touch.  ... the lamb was super
Not a tourist trap! Owners deliver above expectation. Will be back when in Danang next. Looking forward to try more dishes on menu.
Beautiful tasty, fragrant food... Will be back
Wonderful service and food. Great experience and Moroccan vibes. Well worth a visit! We enjoyed every bite.

One of the best restaurants in Da Nang!
A great surprise for this menu whose tasty dishes are hard to find in other restaurants. A big thanks to Sam and his wife for their kindness, their professionalism and for these dishes that we loved!
We can't wait to be back!

In addition to all the Vietnamese food, it is certainly nice to be able to go to such a good Moroccan restaurant. The food was great! The people are very friendly and the appearance of the restaurant made it complete. The food is certainly not expensive for such a kitchen. Really cozy and highly recommended. In addition, you can get a starter and main course for around 450,000, including drinks :)

An oasis of peace in the middle of Da Nang. Great chef and host, friendly service. Deliciously fresh, nice atmosphere, good menu. Intimate atmosphere, peace and quality. Highly recommended!! Went back again for lunch, this time on the roof terrace. Delicious. Enjoyed it immensely.
The food is not very good, the view is okay
The food is very delicious, I think it suits the taste of most Vietnamese people. The minus point is that there is a lot of food hehe, the two of us ordered 2 dishes and couldn't finish them.

Great location, food, staff, and concept.
Bladi has an exotic yet charming menu designed for sharing  packed full of soulful dishes that were clearly made with passion.  My friends and I arrived hangry  but left full and very very happy. 5 stars
Nice delicious food for a change. Tried various food, all very tasty, even the pizza. However the detox drink was a letdown.

The two people who run this restaurant clearly have a lot of passion for and take so much pride in what they are doing, the atmosphere is romantic and beautiful, the service is charming and enthusiastic, and every bite of the food is perfect. Vegetarian options (eg pineapple tabbouleh) and meat options (salmon dishes, slow cooked lamb tagine) are all some of the best dishes available in Da Nang. Very much worth every dong.
really great food, and our every need was catered for. if you are thinking 'should I?' about the lamb and fig tagine, you should..

It was a hot summer day. I went to Da Nang with Mr. Cao on the weekend 😆
Tired of Vietnamese and Korean food, Mr. Cao found a Moroccan restaurant
It was surprisingly delicious. The restaurant was not very big but very quiet
The lady was very nice and took photos for us secretly ✋🏻 …

Amazing restaurant!! Nice and fresh food.
Cozy and little hard to find but it is worth it!
Try the bestilla 🤤🤤 …
It was raining heavily, they actually gave us shelter for dinner. Everything was very tasty and homemade. I strongly recommend it.
Excellent Morocan food! Moroccan native owner look after hus customers attentively! Highly recommend for a tasty meal! Really enjoyed food quality!

Cozy and cute restaurant just outside An Thuong.
The menu is quite small though as there are not too many main courses to share except pizza.
All the dishes were exquisite but perhaps the pizza is not as Middle Eastern as it should be.
Overall a good time.
530.000d for 3 courses meal for 2 and non- alcoholic drinks.

Small restaurant with Moroccan style.
New flavors and many new experiences with Moroccan cuisine.

Small and cozy space, suitable for families (families with small children), groups of friends and couples.
There are tables on the second floor, balcony and garden for those who want a airy space.
The owners are super cute and the restaurant menu is also rich from appetizers, main dishes, snacks and desserts.
Highly recommend everyone. 😉😉
the food is amazing with nice service! all of food is not salty, really healthy

Fantastic! Moroccan soup was flavorful and hearty. My VN wife didn't like the new (to her)  flavors much though. The 4 cheese pizza was really good. It rivaled 4Ps and Limoncello. The hamburger was really great and definitely non-traditional. The burger was so tender and the toppings were tasty and unusual. Fries were good too. Top-notch place.  Three hungry people. Three dishes to share. We were very full and took some pizza home.
The restaurant is small and neat. The food is delicious and beautiful, the price is reasonable. The owner is a foreigner who is quite cute. Will come back if I have a chance to go to Da Nang kkk

Absolute gem!
Pizzas were, as my friend said, “Best I’ve tried in VN”
Personally recommend the Moroccan one
The owner was sweet
Gonna give visit next time we’re in Danang:)

We found this cosy little restaurant just by chance and OMG, we are blown away by the perfect food compositions, the nice ambiente and the friendly, attentive service. We had the pineapple tabouleh, which is a burst of flavors and the Oriental Wagyu Cheese Burger, mouthwatering really! I really hope they‘ll will open another restaurant in Saigon in the future…Da Nang is unfortunately too far away for this to become our weekly dining spot. If you are in Da Nang, don’t miss out on this GEM 💎
Very delicious. Thank you.
The food is really first class and some of the best i ever eaten in Vietnam.

Delicious and unique food, full of filling. Hot and crispy homemade bread, tender braised lamb ribs, delicious lemon tart
Funny shop owner
Small shop, cozy decoration
The best Moroccan food in Da Nang. Thank you very much Bladiiiiiiiiiiii!!!!!

Bladi is a hidden gem in Danang food landscape. If you are into Moroccan food or you are willing to have your first taste of this delicious cuisine, then you have a reservation to make as soon as possible. The restaurant is small but nicely decorated and with a nice relaxed atmosphere. All the food is genuine and freshly prepared without compromises (you may need to book in advance some special dishes that require long preparation hours). The Harira soup I had was absolutely delicious with all the flavors spot on. The chef was very honest in advising only one dish as the portion was very fulfilling and satisfying. I will definitely come back with friends and family to share with them more dishes.
Very nice place and great food.
The best burger and Caesar salad in the city. High level of service and friendly staff.

The Pizza and Burger at the Restaurant are very delicious, delivered to your door, and the price is very reasonable (cheap, I must say) for a quality pizza.
The restaurant owner is very enthusiastic, a place that I have to visit many times in Da Nang 😍😍😍 …

Here Bahn mi are quite thick. I took two and that was enough quite a lot. It's tasty and I can recommend. The stuff doesn't smile that much, but this is not why I'm there, so don't see any point to complain about that.
always crowded, delicious and crispy bread
Bread is fine but not too rich
It's only open in the evening. We bought some delicious banh mi here and headed to Dragon Bridge. In addition to the regular banh mi, they also have stick banh mi, which is very cheap but delicious.

When talking about Da Nang bread, many people will immediately think of Ba Lan bread on Trung Nu Vuong street. This is one of the oldest and famous bread shops, crowded every morning with both locals and tourists. The bread here has a crispy, hot crust, full inside with sausage, pate, cold cuts, herbs and special sauce. When eating, you can clearly feel the harmony between the fatty, salty, sweet and aromatic flavors of the ingredients, creating an unforgettable flavor. 

The price of a loaf of bread is about 20,000 - 25,000 VND, in terms of quality, it is completely worth it. The staff works quickly, even though there are many customers, you rarely have to wait too long. The bread is always kept hot, the pate is fragrant, the sausage is thickly sliced, eating one loaf is enough to fill you up for the whole day. 

The only downside is that during peak hours, you have to wait in line for quite a long time, and the pate can be a bit fatty for some people's taste. However, overall, Ba Lan bread is still worth trying when visiting Da Nang.
The shop sells affordable sandwiches, lots of sausage, sandwiches suitable for the taste of people in the central region.
Delicious bread
always
The cakes are delicious and crowded, but they don't start selling until 3pm 😍
A little overhyped to me. Was recommended by a local so I was hoping to get some good banh mi

If you want to sell at a high price, first of all, respect the customer, come in and buy, don't be a criminal and talk like that - send the middle-aged woman to sell. The bread is not good, especially without sauce and very salty, I don't rate the food much but what I feel dissatisfied with is the sales attitude :))). Honestly, no matter how high the price is, if you don't have a good service attitude, customers will decrease in the future.
The food is fine, but the owner of the restaurant seems to have a bad attitude and doesn't seem to need customers.

Sorry to say that I was recommended and praised by a friend and saw comments on Google that were also good so I came to try it, unexpectedly the bread was so boring, with a few slices of ham, a little pate, a few slices of soft meat with vegetables and pickles. It was dry, had no special taste, no different from the sandwiches bought on the sidewalk, even worse in flavor. Real experience and correct review based on personal feelings having eaten bread in many places 🤓

The bread was okay, but the attitude of the owner who was paying the bill was very arrogant, grimacing, and unpleasant. I came to buy and pay, not to beg. So I cannot accept such behavior. I asked him if I wanted to transfer money, he took a pen and typed loudly on the QR code and then looked away. I bought it to take home so I asked for the packaging, he said he would eat it right away, why would he ask for the packaging. He said he frowned while talking, to the point that his wife told me to sympathize with him because that was his temperament. Da Nang has no shortage of places that sell delicious bread, because I find the food here to my liking and it is close to home, so I often stop by to buy. But with this attitude, I will never go there again.

I arrived as soon as they opened at 3pm, but there was already a line of customers.
I ordered a special and a classic.
The waiter asked me if I wanted chili sauce.
I ordered the classic without the chili sauce and enjoyed it.
Very tasty, popular place, always crowded, inexpensive
The bread is delicious, everyone. The owner is very friendly. Looking at her hands, she is very professional 👍👍👍
Delicious banh mi in Da Nang you should try. Locals eat it a lot.
Great
Delicious sausage, 25k/loaf, crowded
Good restaurant
The sandwich was excellent; however, the servers always seem to be in a bad mood.
This should be the best Banh Mi in the world.. super fresh meat and pate
A bakery with typical Da Nang flavor. The pate sold separately is also very delicious.
Bad service attitude, especially the boss collecting money :))) Da Nang has no shortage of delicious banh mi places, will never come back even though I've been eating them since I was a child

The bread was okay, a little too sweet for my taste. The shop prepared the food and returned the bread to the customer very quickly. The thing that made me never want to come back to the shop was the attitude of the owner who collected the money. I have never met a Da Nang person with such a bad personality, disdain for customers and can be said to be a bit rude. The most annoying thing was when he asked for the total price for me to transfer money, he tapped the pen on the QR code and silently looked away. I had to take out my calculator to calculate the total price and then transfer that amount myself. I have never encountered that kind of business in my life. If you tourists want to eat delicious Da Nang bread like this, you can visit Ba Lan on Phan Chau Trinh street. Or Mr. Ti's bread is also delicious. Don't support shops like this.
ok

The bread is delicious even when cold, the bread is no longer crispy. Extremely fast service
46k bread for one, buy the special kind but it's not good, the filling is very thin and salty

Absolutely delicious

Fast service.
eat ok

Seeing that this restaurant seems to be the most popular in Danang, I was curious to try it. The price is a bit high but not good compared to its reputation. But I don't like the staff's attitude here. Especially the cashier, very uneducated and disrespectful to customers. I came to buy and asked for some notes and no one answered, so when I repeated them, the cashier there shouted at me, "SAY IT ONCE, THERE'S NO DEFECTS HERE". I feel like people are giving alms, not me buying them. Lost all interest in eating. Will never go back to that attitude.
Extremely rude attitude, complete disrespect towards customers. The food caused me stomach pain afterwards. I strongly recommend avoiding this place at all costs. Terrible experience.

I came to buy and waited for 10-15 minutes but ended up selling to people who came later. Service attitude is very disrespectful to customers. Especially the person collecting the money, very impolite. It's best not to come here if you don't want to waste time and experience discomfort

I’ve only eaten at a few, but my favorite Banh Mi spot so far. It’s well put together and the Cha Lua slices are the thickest I’ve seen anywhere in VN. Will continue to try other spots but will definitely return. Great value for 25k.
The shop is too dirty, the bread is not special but the price is very high, the owner and staff buy with faces like they are going to a funeral
The bread is delicious, everyone. The owner is very friendly. Looking at his hand spreading pate on the bread is very professional 👍👍👍

Famous banh mi store, banh mi is delivered very quickly and it is very good, not the best I had in Vietnam but still very nice. Price for the special banh mi is 35.000 Dong which is pretty much what you could expect. Takeout only

The baguettes here are really delicious! The bread is crispy and filling. The combination of pate, ham, and meat goes especially well together. The sauce is savory and fragrant, so you can't stop thinking about it once you take a bite. Since it is a famous store that has been in business for a long time, there are always a lot of customers, but orders come out quickly. However, the restaurant is small and there are no seats, so if you want to eat comfortably, it is better to take out. If you are looking for delicious baguettes in Da Nang, this is a must-visit place!
The beef I ordered had a spicy taste. It was really delicious and the business was very good. It is a delicacy recommended by locals in Da Nang.

I ordered the special, which cost 35,000 VND (about 210 JPY). It was a banh mi filled with cucumber, thin scallions, seasoned minced meat, ham, sliced onions, etc., all of which are commonly found in Thai cuisine.
It's about a 7-8 minute walk from Long Bridge, so I recommend stopping by to buy some to kill time when you're watching the flames on Long Bridge and Grab fares are skyrocketing, and then eating it on one of the benches around the bridge.
The bread was freshly baked and delicious.
Banh Mi shop by the roadside. Taste quite nice, the bread was fresh and its mouthful of ingredients. Worth a try!
Best Banh Mi I had in Da Nang! I orderd Banh Mi Dac Biet and it was a feast. the chili sauce is adding the flavor! And the price is also reasonable.
Satisfied with the taste of bread here
Hot, crispy, delicious bread.
The salt and pepper bread is a bit salty for my taste.

You can fully enjoy the Vietnamese atmosphere.
It was so cheap there that I didn't feel like eating it after returning home.

Review_text: Delicious meatloaf

The banh mi was delicious.

The bread isn't so good that there's no other place to sell it. I bought it and threw it away, otherwise I'd get sick and die
Disgusting
Good bread, okay

Every night it's crowded and there are people coming to buy it all the time. But I think the food is just normal, nothing special, there are 2 spring onions and onions so after eating it, it leaves quite a smell. This place is for take-out only, there is no place to sit down

Oh my, the best banh mi in all of Vietnam, I guess? I’ve tried the super popular Banh Mi 25 (Hanoi), Banh Mi Mama, and Banh Mi Phuong, but none come close to this one. The sauce, the meat—everything is just perfect!

This banh mi shop is very popular with locals.
I bought one large and one small and tried them.
Locals take them away, but it seemed like a shop, so when I tried to eat it, they brought me a chair from inside.
It was packed with meat, the sauce was light, and the crispy bread was warmed up for me.
I think it was ok

Reading the review, I realized that the shop has a grudge against customers who cut the bread in half 😂 all the people in Da Nang are nice except for the old lady who sells at this shop. I bought a loaf of beef sausage bread and planned to split it in half with my friend to try the taste of the sausage. If it was ok, I would buy it as a gift. I gave her the loaf of bread and asked her to cut it for me, but she stared at me without answering or reacting. I thought the old lady couldn't hear me clearly so I said it again. Then she glanced at me and turned her face away. Luckily, a little employee ran over to help me or else I would have been stiff :)))))
It was delicious. It might be even better when it's a little warm after it's made.

2024-11-29
Take out Vietnamese baguettes for dinner before going to the airport. Just ask the Grab driver to stop by the roadside. …

Good value for money. A special banh mi (full topping) for only 35.000 VND (1.4 USD). Plenty of cold cut and aromatic herbs. I think they should lessen the amount of cold cut and add a litte bit more pâté, the banh mi felt a bit dry.
It was quite crowded but the staffs offered real quick services.

I enjoyed Banh Mi so much in Hoi An that I went to Da Nang and looked for it. I heard a lot of locals order takeout. My husband and I both eat it well, but I don't know what it really tastes like. It's cheap, but it doesn't really suit our …
I like bánh mì here because it’s authentic Vietnamese style. Ba Lan doesn’t change the recipe of the bánh mi to foreigners’ taste. They keep the taste authentic.
Famous bread in Danang. Satisfying all audiences
This place was good. I had a Vietnamese sandwich (3.5/5 and the bo ne (4.5/5). The coffee was typical. I had much better elsewhere. I would return here mainly for the Bo ne mainly if not only.

This place is somehow famous among locals and people from other provinces so I came to try. I bought two Banh mi Ba Lan for 50k VND and personally, I didn't find it good enough to deserve its fame. On the other hand, the atmosphere is terrible and I can see how awkward the staff are when working and they don't seem very friendly.

A local banh mi place recommended by a taxi driver.

I ordered takeout at 6 PM and returned to my hotel after a busy day of work, …

This is probably the most famous Banh Mi restaurant in Da Nang. When I ate there about five years ago, it had a relatively simple flavor: thick-sliced ham, salt, pepper, and chili sauce. Compared to then, this time the flavors of the pate …

It seems to be a local favorite. There were a lot of people getting takeout. The green onions inside the banh mi. Some people may like that or not. The beef seems like a processed sausage, so I think that's also a bit of a love-hate thing. I'll try it sometime if I'm hungry in the evening. One special is 35,000 won.
Good and inexpensive banh mi. Definitely must try when in danang

Bread for over 20 years, still delicious, price increases every year, currently 25 branches
Pate and the cake is beyond reproach 👍 …

small take-out store

Disco bahn mi, I had the special! Absolutely fantastic, the sandwich was nice and warm!

The bread is cold, too much green onion, cilantro, and thai basil - pretty much all I could taste were these herbs. Not my thing, overpriced for the quality offered. There are a lot of other stores with better banh mi. Not sure why people are so hyped over this particular one.
Banh Mi Ba Lan at 62 Tran Nu Vuong is super super delicious, the crispy bread eaten with the salt and pepper sausage is so delicious!! The meat sandwich is ok but I don't like the baguette very much
The owner is very rude and doesn't like Chinese people. Chinese friends should not give money there. It's much better to find other small shops with local young people.

I went there because it was a local banh mi. I ordered the most expensive special, 35,000 won. There was a lot of meat. "Chili?" I asked, and they made it right away. When I got back to my room to eat, there was no cilantro. I'm not sure if it was originally absent or if they didn't add it because I'm a foreigner. The spiciness was similar to a no-brand chili mayo. The taste was okay. I walked there on a hot day, and it was delicious, but I'm not sure if I'd go back. If it's nearby, I'd try it at least once. The only downside is that the man collecting the money smokes right next to me while he's making the sandwiches.
Everyone says this place is famous. But really, I found the food to be very ordinary. The bread was dry and hard - the pate wasn't delicious either.
The best banh mi cha in da nang

Waay below average.
Taste bad.

For the same price in any other place you will get a decent meat instead of jelly like substance.

The bread is okay, I don't think it's special.
The egg pate sticky rice is delicious, the price is a bit high in my opinion. It reminds me of the Hanoi sticky rice on the roadside, 10k for one piece, it's filling and delicious.
The lemonade is especially delicious, I think the shop can reduce the sweetness to create a healthy feeling. I like the Kim Quoc tea better, it has the taste of tea and lemongrass, much less sweet than the lemonade.

The shop space is clean, the staff is quick!

name of the 30,000 beef sandwich is so soul-stirring but it's not delicious

Bread has pate, butter, rolls, jam, .... The crust is hot and crispy, the filling is quite plump but a bit bland. The owner and staff are fine, not too welcoming but not unpleasant either. Cake prices range from 10-35k.

Delicious bread. Should try it when coming to Da Nang.
Recommend try it.

The ham here is surprisingly delicious, 25k/loaf

those who don't know how to eat fresh chili can ask the uncle to put "chili sauce"

The thing is, I never want to scandalize anyone, but I have never seen a shop owner as rude as this shop owner. If I give you more money, I won't dare visit next time.
Tonight I stopped by the store to buy a loaf of bread and saw an uncle sitting at the counter with a crazy Trinh Thuong Cuong look on his face. I said: Uncle, give me a loaf of bread. He didn't even look at me so I thought maybe I should wait my turn to order cake. When it was my turn, I ordered a loaf of bread, but when my friend put the loaf of bread in a paper bag, I asked him to cut the loaf of bread in half. That's all he cursed: D Why didn't I say it first? It was a waste of time because his shop also had 2 people behind me. Mom, cutting a loaf of bread takes less than 2 seconds, it's no big deal to curse customers like that. I also looked at him with disdain because of his uncultured words. He also tried to look back at me and kept saying D M, why don't you say it over and over again. I told my child to wait for his turn and then speak because talking to him would be impolite to previous customers. He didn't listen and just kept cursing 🤣 with this tone, he's probably not from Da Nang but he came from somewhere else to start a business. I'm okay but I just feel sorry for the people who work here who must hear harsh words every day.
You should re-learn your education and then be your own boss🤣. I hope everyone will consider it fairly and come to this bakery. People like him probably don't have the heart to make clean food. I see that Phan Chau Trinh street is also full of very delicious, cheap and polite bread shops. Thank you for listening to your buyers' concerns.

If you want to taste the original Bánh mì Que, which is a small and thin bread stick with pate and chilli paste, then this is the best place.

They also serve the most famous bánh mì vietnam. Always crowded with people here but they are super efficient. Most try place in Da Nang.
terrible service attitude

Bread here is different from the Hoi An style, so don’t expect juicy sauced bread. This version is dryer with only chilly and salt pepper as the main seasoning because all ingredients are seasoned already. I like this because you can feel the original taste of all ingredients to the fullest.

The people don’t speak English but they have a short menu in English that is on the glass of the stall for you to know the price and ingredients. I got the special one for 35k, it’s full of stuffing and very tasty. I love it.

Open after 3pm

24.7.6.
It's similar to Ho Chi Minh's Banh Mi Huan Hoa.

This time, the shop mainly sells big loaves of bread or what? But I only like bmq but I can't buy it after going twice

30k per loaf, the food is delicious but the boss's face is as cold as the piece of money he's holding :)))
If you come to Da Nang and like it, please come and try it!

bought it before eating it, didn't know if it was good or bad
but the arrogant attitude, looking down on tourists is not pleasant. I am a tourist, passing by and stopping to buy, from the owner to the staff all look down on customers. I just opened my mouth to order 3 loaves without having time to tell them anything, then jumped into the customer's throat, didn't care what kind the customer ordered, made it myself and charged 25k (while I was planning to order 35k loaves to see how it was). Then this staff pushed it to another staff, no one wanted to make the bread. When the owner counted the bill, when she heard that my voice was not from Da Nang, she spoke in a very unpleasant tone, and threw the change on the table. While waiting for the bread, a Da Nang woman came, the owner's tone was completely different "yours is..., please give me the change" and handed it to me. I was completely different, while I also bought and paid, but it seemed like they didn't like tourists here. I will never come again. I haven't eaten the bread yet but I'm already angry.
Extremely disrespectful to customers, from owners to employees. Sell without customers

여기서 반미 별로. 사장님하고 직원은 손님을 무시해요. 안 사는 게 좋아.

I saw on various websites that Banh mi BaLan is the most delicious banh mi in Da Nang, so I went there to try it. It cost 350,000 VND per piece, and I was disappointed, probably because I had high expectations when I took a bite. It was a normal banh mi.

I went there because it had good reviews, but I was a little disappointed considering the reputation. There are plenty of other delicious banh mi places, so is it really worth waiting in line to buy something?
But before it might have been better. The day I went to buy the sausage, I had eaten it in Hoi An and it was very delicious.
horrible service, bad attitude, the bread was cold, no place to sit

This was among the best I had in Vietnam! I had the Banh Mi Que very good pâté, and the house special Banh Mi Ba Lan… highly recommended. Can’t sit there just take away yet is very good and will keep in the going again list !
The small bread 🥖 is super delicious and a little spicy. It costs 10,000 Vietnamese NTD, which is only 14 Taiwan dollars. One is not enough, you can eat several in a row.
Very good Bang Mi
I ordered delivery. I was happy that it had lots of ingredients and I thought it would be delicious, but it had no flavor. I regret not asking for hot sauce or having it served separately.

The banh mi here is not very saucy but it’s still quite tasty. The ingredients are very fresh. Worth trying and coming back!

Pay attention to their opening hours though. I came here the first time at 2pm with hungry stomach to find they open in the evening.

My sister bought bread here and received the most impolite treatment ever. The simple reason was because she had to cut the bread in half. The man (I don't know if it was the owner) used harsh words to insult my sister and forced all the customers waiting to buy his bread to hear the two words (fuck) repeatedly. I felt like the saliva and all the vulgarity in his mouth had overflowed into all the toppings that the shop was using to put on the bread for the customers. As a businessman and in the field of customer care. I always honor, respect and treat my customers as gods. So I strongly condemn his uncivilized behavior, especially directly with customers, who bring income and success to the business. I share it here for the shop owner to see, for everyone to see, and for him to see, then reflect and change his mindset to overcome and help the shop become more successful. I know everyone has times when they are impulsive, impatient and can't control their emotions, but the way he showed it was so obvious and disrespectful to others, everyone standing there felt uncomfortable and offended. Customers, income sources, the success or failure of the restaurant are treated like that, I myself am confused about where his heart is in doing his job. It is worrying to think about the food he is making. Will never come back.
okay
The bread was delicious. But the man who collected the money was arrogant.
Well-balanced with quality ham (thit nguoi) and sauces. Deserving of its reputation.
It's really delicious here. Be sure to try the special! Be sure to ask for something spicy! It's a shame I didn't take a picture.

Visited in December 2023
Feeling hungry after dinner, I decided to grab takeout to eat at the hotel. They had an English menu, and ordering was a breeze. I ordered a pork banh mi (30,000 D), and the staff quickly and efficiently prepared it right in front of me. Finally, I asked about the amount of chili sauce, added it, and then it was ready in the oven.
It looked so delicious and filling, I couldn't resist taking a bite. The combination of the crispy baguette and the filling was amazing, and it might be the best banh mi I've ever had.
I also had it cold at the hotel, and the sauce really came together, making it delicious. It's good value for money, and I think it's a must-visit restaurant if you're in Da Nang.
Delicious, very crowded

My favorite dish. And checked the map and saw a lot of reviews. I also tried to pass by and queue up to buy. The restaurant is very crowded and only opens at 3:00 pm. The bread is crispy and fragrant, the chili is spicy 🌶 and it's really delicious. But the shop is a bit small.

The industrial pork patties and broth are nothing special, not rich. Eating this bread makes you understand why Hoi An bread is truly the best.
The industrial pork patties and broth are nothing special, not rich. Eating this bread makes you understand why Hoi An bread is truly the best.

The girl reprimanded us to get in the "queue" even though we'd been to the place several times before and there had never been a queue culture at the stall to begin with. Fair enough. The bread at this lady's place is okay, generally okay, the staff is also ok, there is a middle-aged lady with a Da Nang accent who is a bit arrogant, people ask without chili, but she answers with an accent like she is the only one in the city selling noodles, as if they are starving. Honestly, I don't really care about this shop. Without her, the market would still be crowded, but with that attitude it's hard to keep customers.

The quality of bread is getting worse and worse, in the past it was less than 20k but there was enough, now the bread is 25k but only has beef patties, and the service sense of looking down on customers, coming in to buy first but the people who come later get it first, mentioning the later to come first but letting the people who come later get it first, then respond and say to wait.

The bread is quite special, the meat is soft and fragrant, the price is reasonable. The restaurant is clean, the food comes out quickly.

I ate banh mi, round mini banh mi, and bread sticks, and each had its own charm. The banh mi had a lot of meat in it, the mini banh mi had a good balance of bread, meat, vegetables, and sauce, and the bread sticks had things like torn braised meat in them, so they tasted familiar. Of all the banh mi I ate in Vietnam, this one had the most local flavor.

The bread is delicious. It's just a small cart that sells only one type of bread, which is Roasted Pork Bread.
The roasted pork here is roasted suckling pig, so it's more special than other places.
The bread doesn't have onions and cilantro like in Saigon, but instead has perilla and Vietnamese coriander. The perilla flavor is quite strong and spicy, so it goes well with roasted pork, creating a very strange feeling when biting into the bread.
The roasted pork bread here also doesn't have soy sauce like in Saigon, but salt and pepper.

Da Nang is famous for their Banh Mi and this little street cart knocked it out of the park. My western friend and I arrived at this stand and their was a long line of Vietnamese waiting to get a sand which. We don’t even know what we ordered there didn’t seem to be a lot of selection. The lady asked if we wanted chilli and we nodded our heads to our surprise she doused it with chilli oil. We timidly bit into the sandwich unsure of what to expect. It was amazing! Fresh, not to spicy and great flavour. The experience of being the only westerners in the Vietnamese hustle and bustle was cool on its own, the ladies working at the food cart are so fast with making these sandwiches its fascinating to watch, not to mention one of the BEST bhan mi’s I’ve ever had.

This rating is solely based on the food itself, as the service and restaurant atmosphere were great.  Including myself, there were only 2 customers.  In my quest to find great pho, based on reviews and the fact that Mr Que advertised one of my favorites (Pho Gau, brisket pho), the large bowl was ordered.  I like brisket because of the flavorful fat.  However, I was disappointed that it had hardly any fat and was more like pho bo (beef pho).  Also, the actual size (more like a medium), amount and type of noodles (very thin), and lack of flavor in the broth.  I'm sorry but I cannot recommend pho here.  I've had pho many times over the years and in several countries.  So far, the best pho has been in the USA. I'm yet to find impressive noodle soup in Vietnam.

For tourists planning to eat here, if you've never been outside of this area of Vietnam you may think this is good food. However compared to places like Ho Chi Minh city there are some key differences. We ordered drinks and there was no ice which is usually available. Additionally there was no hoisin sauce for pho here which is a crucial part of having pho. The amount of food served in the pho was a lot smaller than can be found in other places while costing much more, likely because this is a tourist heavy area next to the beach. A special pho was 75K VND, so about 3 USD. There were 2 waitresses however only one of the workers was working while the other one seemed to be worried about online matters. The pho itself was okay, however the sauce would have made it much better. On the upside there is air conditioning.

Two waitresses on duty but one does all the work and the other is on Facebook. Restaurant is dirty by Vietnamese standards. Lots of flys even with big fans going. Food portions are small and overpriced. Quality of food is not fresh and they don't have hoison sauce for the pho. Which according to my son is some type of crime. Should be standard in all Vietnamese pho restaurants. They also didn't have ice for drinks. This is a tourist area. So once again, not a good look for them.

very good restaurant! i recommend!

ENGLISH VERSION BELOW

The staff's face was swollen like a pump, I called 3-4 times for a piece of lemon but it was like calling into the void - no response, no glance. I ordered 2 bowls of pho with 2 bowls of poached eggs and received the haunting combo: cold pho broth, poached eggs that were raw and had a grin, the egg whites were still clear - it tasted fishy and nauseating.

As for the pho broth... I really don't know what to call it. It was as bland as snail broth diluted with tap water, like the leftover broth from yesterday was added to make it enough. I've never seen such a bland, soulless bowl of pho in my life.

The restaurant's space was beyond words - it was so hot that there wasn't even a fan, flies were flying around like an open-air market. I had to keep chasing the flies away while eating, it felt like I was eating in a garbage dump and not a restaurant.

Honestly, only easy-going Westerners could swallow this kind of food and praise it as delicious. Vietnamese people only eat this once and then say goodbye.

The shop looks clean at first glance.

English:

The staff looked like they lost a bet just showing up to work. Called out 3-4 times asking for a slice of lime, got absolutely nothing. No response, no eye contact, like we didn't exist.

We ordered two bowls of pho and two soft-boiled eggs, and what we got was straight-up disgusting. The broth was cold, the eggs were practically raw, the whites were still transparent, and the smell was nauseating.

As for the pho broth… I don't even know what to call it. It tasted like leftover soup diluted with tap water. No flavor, no depth, just bland, lifeless water pretends to be broth. I swear, I've never had pho this tasteless in my entire life.

The restaurant was itself a disaster. No fans in sight, it was like sitting in a sauna. Flies were everywhere, you literally had to keep swatting them away while trying to eat. Felt more like eating in a dump than an actual restaurant.

Honestly, only clueless tourists would think this place is "authentic" or "delicious." No self-respecting local will come back after this kind of experience.

Never coming back. Ever
