I visited the place to see the World Fireworks Festival and made a reservation for the terrace seat on the same day. It's expensive for Vietnam, but it's worth it. The food is neat and clean. It's delicious. There are also non-vegan dishes. I had a satisfying meal with a friend and was very satisfied with the fireworks. I recognize it as a great place.^^ The owner speaks English very well, so communication was smooth, and all the staff members are very kind. I won't forget it.
Delicious food. Great view of fireworks. Cute staff ❤️❤️

What an amazing place! Great foods and wonderful designs. I had been many times in Shamballa Saigon and always feel to be healed and inner peace to sit here, Wellcome Shamballa to Danang.

Amazing vegetarian! Extensive menu so many choices for vegan, all dishes labeled clearly all diet restrictions. I liked steamed baguete & green curry most. Friendly staff beautiful set up. Overall great experience. Must visit if you are vegan or not. Thank you for your service!

The vegetarian food option was incredibly wide and varied. Our family had a nephew who’s an incredibly picky eater but even he gobbled down everything! The staff members were friendly and professional. We absolutely loved the atmosphere and the overall experience. Highly recommend!

It's a vegan friendly restaurant and definitely hidden jam in Da Nang! Exquisite vegetarian Vietnamese cuisine, which can be customized to meet vegetarian needs. The presentation and taste are exquisite, and the space is full of Zen. I recommend the eggplant vegetable rolls and tofu rolls. You can try them if you have the chance!

The food isn't bad, but the prices are a bit high for what you get. To be honest, there aren't many options here at the airport, at least not before you enter the flight waiting area.
It's hot because there isn't a single fan where the tables are for eating. I like the heat, but it's unpleasant in that area. They should pay more attention to those details.
Thanks, ladies. The noodles were truly delicious. They made my wait for check-in for the flight more enjoyable.

It's a great value and the most accessible of the airport pre-departure restaurants.
You can use your remaining Vietnamese currency here and enjoy a satisfying meal. Prices inside the airport are more than double.
You can also top up your meal while you're there.

When I asked about the business hours for elderly women who was condescending me " This store will be close at 9pm. So you should eat about 5min"
But this store working 24hrs . It was so disappointed and I don't wanna visit again .

Since you have to go up the stairs to the second floor, I recommend coming after checking in.
I heard the pho is delicious, so I ordered that.
The portion was quite large.
If you order a drink, they recommend a combination.
The food was delicious.
I ordered a 250ml beer, but for some reason it was changed to a 500ml, lol.

There were also power outlets at the counter seats.
The assistant manager is very nice and accommodating. The food is delicious, definitely worth your money. The serving is huge.
Awesome service, and Nam is great!
The staff is terrible. If the food quality is not good, at least the service attitude should be decent.
Service is a bit slow, staff is quite crowded. Food is okay

I know it is an airport but .. 180000 dong ($10) for a dry banh mi, a claggy inedible egg tart and a weak western style coffee (we asked for iced Vietnamese coffee) is even lower than the low expectations I had already set. I normally wouldn't even leave a review for an airport cafe but they had a big sign asking for google reviews so I am happy to fulfill.
The pho here is delicious, tasty, the bowl is very big, full. The staff is also nice 😍

very shitty place the food was mediocre and overpriced

The attitude of the service staff is the worst point, they bring food to customers with a face like a pear, not caring about the customers' requests.

Worth eating while waiting at the airport

Review: Beef Noodle Soup & Fresh Rolls

I recently had the beef noodle soup and fresh rolls, and both dishes were a satisfying mix of freshness and bold flavors.

Overall, both dishes were fresh, flavorful, and well-prepared. A perfect combination of comforting and refreshing. Would definitely recommend!
The Vietnamese rice noodle set, which included a drink and fruit, cost around 200K VND. The food was delicious and hygienic, and the prices were reasonable for an airport restaurant.
Food and service was OK but the price is outrageous for what you get.  VND 850k for a pho and bhan mi set + coffee. Yes, airports are more expensive than restaurants town, but not 5x more.
The worst vermicelli inside a beef Pho I have eaten in Vietnam. You should improve the quality of vermicelli. That was terrible.
Clean nice environment but the BigBowl of Pho ~? I don’t know it’s worth it to have as 190. however its nice to chill here before check in (forgot to take a photo of my dessert)

I had Hoi An chicken rice.
I ordered Evian separately.

I don't know what it tastes like in Hoi An, but it was incredibly delicious!

It was quite filling and I think it was around 1,000 yen.

I thought it might be a bit too much, with lots of herbs and other things on it, but once you mix it all together, it was easy to eat.

It was enough to satisfy my hunger while waiting for my morning flight!
Pho is not special but okay, price is quite expensive due to in the airport.

clean, good drinks

A place to go again when you go to Da Nang Airport

The bowl is almost as big as a washbasin

It was high-quality Wagyu rice noodles

You can charge your phone and it is on the second floor to the left of the departure counter

I stayed in Da Nang for 5 days. I will return to Japan via Hanoi. So to speak, my last Vietnamese meal was Bun Bo Hue. Well, it's really delicious!
The service was very good and they counted the change right in front of me. We also have Tiger and Heineken draft beers. It's the best time before the flight!
Amazing staff! They are always smiling and greeting you :) I recommend!

I took Pho wagyy soup which was just perfect!
A large and satisfying portion, with great flavors.
Good surprise at the airport :)
Very tasty and rich phos, highly recommended. A little expensive but acceptable for an airport. Very friendly
Lots of options in the airport for pho and some like this place for fast 🥝 d version of banh mi. Ask for a cup with ice if you want for a soda, for example.
Foods are fine given it’s served at an airport. Services are great with wonderful care to clients’ needs. Travelling with baby and I felt really cared for.
It was open at 6.15 am and had something I could recognize, without being too hard on my wallet.

I know I don't expect much from airport pho, but I also tried ordering wagyu beef pho to be able to evaluate the quality. The pho broth is bland and you can't really see the typical aroma of the spices. Wagyu beef is a bit chewy and a bowl of pho costs 136k but only has a few pieces of beef. The accompanying bean sprouts were few and didn't really look fresh.

The sitting space is shared with many other restaurants in the domestic departure terminal area. Dishes are served cleanly and politely. In general, just eat for fun, but it's hard to visit the restaurant a second time.

So the service was pretty good, but please don't order the Banh Mi Chicken.
I'm sorry, I usually eat everything, but I really couldn't get this down.
The chicken was only half-cooked, and overall, the whole thing wasn't enjoyable.
Good service - ask for Nam!
Amazing service

Just got some bun no hue in here, everything was excellent than I expected. The broth was clear and nice, the manager and staffs r super friendly and nice. i don't know about the other dishes but recommend this one 🥰🌺🌷

It is pretty good but it's expensive (mostly bc airport food is commonly expensive)
Ordered some wagyu pho, got some chewy Vietnamese beef. What a scam!

A bowl of delicious beef noodle soup with just the right taste, a lot of meat, worth the price at the airport, full of basil and a special spicy satay bowl, everything was carefully prepared but unfortunately there was no shrimp paste

The staff saw that I was worried about the pork leg because I had braces so they asked the kitchen to tear the leg into small pieces, very delicate

Amazing huge bowl of Pho we both got beef and it was absolutely beautiful!! The coconut coffee is also excellent.

Good taste,can communicate with english,sweet smile 👌👌
Nice place to eat at airport.Nice soup 🍲
Very nice Pho and mango smoothies. The price is much cheaper than the one at the waiting area . Nice service
We understand Vietnamese, and the waiter complained to us that it was troublesome for us to order separately.
The food is Excellent and the Staff are very accommodating and welcoming..
The pho is delicious. Nhung serves very enthusiastically.

Very good staff, very friendly staff. The pho broth is very suitable for my taste, very delicious and rich. The fruit is fresh and sweet. I am very impressed with the staff named Khanh Phuong. Thank you for your thoughtful service to me 💗💗💗

I had a late flight and was really satisfied with your service this morning at the international airport, 2nd floor, check in area. So delicious & so thanks for the team. My family will come back next time ❤️

We were stuck at Danang airport after our flight was delayed. The vouchers we were given to get a meal were at a place with no vegetarian options. A server heard us ask and she went out of her way to organise 3 vegetarian meals for us. We were very grateful for her help. Thank you Vi for being so kind and assisting us to have a meal, it is very much appreciated 👍
Great deep fried spring rolls and mango smooths.  Staff also very pleasant and helpful.  Would definitely recommend!

Very delicious and affordable cost.
I ate pho, fresh spring roll, and fried spring roll when I arrived and departed.
I ate pho in Hoi an and Da nang, but it is one of the best pho restaurants.

Especially when you eat out and then come in, you can feel the difference more. Even if you order delivery, 1 million dong is enough to feed 4 adult men, but 1.4 million dong. If I had known, I would have left.
The taste is ok but the price is too expensive.
It was delicious.
The mango smoothie is terrible. Don't order that. Too expensive.

The shop sells a lot of things, not just pho. I ordered a fruit tea from Tealive. It was okay, cool, not too sweet. The service from the order taker at Big Bowl and the Tealive delivery person were enthusiastic and cute. The price was a bit high because it was in the airport.
Just had an awesome meal at big bowl in da nang international airport. I personally love their perfect pairing offers. Worth it! 😍 …
Thanks to the kind staff, I enjoyed the airport rice noodles at the check-in area of the international flight

If you wanted to experience awfulness you should go
Kkkk very angry now becausw of thr service

It was delicious. I'm glad I recommended it to you.
The price is too expensive for the food. 1 bowl of pho + 1 glass of passion fruit 405k.
Great

Very disappointed with the Pho. 1 star is still generous.
Same Big Bowl but in SG it's much better, but in DN it's like a completely different version, from ingredients, broth, to side vegetables, everything is terrible.
I hope the DN branch seriously improves to have a better image of Pho.
If you compare it to the pho in town, it's expensive and tastes much worse.
Vietnamese rice noodles and drinks come in various sizes, but are said to be one size. If you look at the receipt, you can see the optional items that the staff ordered as extras.
Unfriendly service

The Phô was delicious, even more so for airport standards. The tea and coffee were nice, in line with local types. Croissant was obviously average.

A bit on the pricey side but it's an airport so, kind of normal

The meat has a fishy smell...
The soup is okay.
I ask for some hot water(I can pay for it) but staff say they don’t have hot water even the coffee machine is there. 🙁

Perfect for killing time
Rice noodles are expensive, but they taste good because they have a lot of seasoning.

Ordered a bowl of beef noodle soup for 144k but it wasn't tasty at all. The price outside for this bowl is only around 40k. I know it's expensive at the airport, but the price comes with quality. I hope Big Bow Danang airport improves the quality.
Delicious, rich food. Good service.At Urban Market TSN

Should upgrade to stronger chili sauce

no taste
unfriendly
I asked him to cut the bread, but he refused.
The food was so bad.. The beef noodle soup was okay but the pho was sweet and had a strong cinnamon smell.

This restaurant was booked by our Vietnamese guide.
The flavor was a little light, but that was actually a good thing. It was easy to eat Vietnamese food.
The burnt rice served in an unglazed pot was delicious.
Tourist restaurant, also quite good

we went as a tour group to this place.
the food was okay, not that bad but we came up later the next morning with most of everyone got diarrhea and sick.

The food may not suit my taste, perhaps due to the region, but the restaurant has a strange odor, some corners of the restaurant are very dirty, the staff are indifferent, after serving the dishes, they gather and sit right away. Review of A Tai Restaurant - Needs to improve many aspects
I had the opportunity to visit A Tai restaurant, but this time the experience was quite disappointing.
1. About the food: Not to my personal taste, perhaps due to regional differences, so I cannot accurately evaluate the overall quality.
2. Space: The restaurant has a strange, unpleasant odor. Some corners of the restaurant are quite dirty, creating an unclean feeling when dining.
3. Service attitude: The staff are quite indifferent, after serving the dishes, they gather and sit near the fan and focus on their phones, not paying attention to customers who need support.
Suggestion: The management should review the way they operate and train staff to improve the experience for diners.
I really hope the restaurant will have more positive changes in the future. Just to press the phone, the manager needs to review the way the staff takes care of customers.
Food is not delicious

The restaurant is located on a main road, mainly serving tourists, so I saw many large vehicles picking up and dropping off guests, but I didn't see locals coming to eat. The dining rooms are large, air-conditioned, and staffed. The food is also delicious and filling, generally speaking, when going on a tour, there are not many demands on food and drink.

Vietnamese food that uses stir-frying method is not delicious in any menu. It has a bad taste and is not to Thai people's taste. The ingredients are bad. I have eaten 9 meals and not one meal has been delicious. What a shame.
Healthy food, fresh food, no fishy smell, mild taste in Vietnamese style, good and fast service.

The restaurant was dirty, the toilet had no water. The staff brought the food up once, no one rushed us but the waiter was so quick as if someone was rushing us, so we ended up eating seafood but the food was cold. The staff seemed deaf or something, they ignored us when we asked for more tea 3 times. Especially the staff named Phi was too much (rude). You are a waiter but you dare to yell at the customer Give me the ladle? We asked again if you were the one yelling at the customer, but you kept quiet and went to another table. The worst service in any restaurant I have ever eaten at.
Noisy, inattentive staff, very dirty toilet, the price paid but the service is not ok, very bad, hot
The food is similar to Thai and Chinese food. The taste is a bit bland. There are shrimp, fish, and shellfish to choose from.
The food is delicious, the dishes are diverse. But the space is still a bit small compared to the number of customers every day, so you have to wait in line and it's a bit hot inside.
Spacious room, but the bathroom is a bit dirty

There was something for everyone!
Very good. Quite crowded, but the service was impeccable.
Amazing,Hot pot.
This is a restaurant that Taiwanese group travelers will definitely visit. I don’t understand the tri-color bean fried rice, but the fried spring rolls/beef pho/Vietnamese bread are okay.

Fried fish is delicious
The rest is so so
Delicious food, good service, clean bathroom
It's not delicious. Half of the shrimps were grilled until they were burnt, and the whole shrimp smelled smoky. Other dishes were not suitable for Taiwanese tastes.
Good food, quick service

I asked the taxi driver to tell me where to eat, and he took me here.

It seemed like he was introducing it to me by giving me a tip.

I ordered fried ribs? Morning Glory, and steamed chicken.
The rice came out like a clay pot, and it was like flying rice, but it was delicious and perfect for when you miss Korean food! I think the ribs would be okay for kids to eat (be careful with the bones..) The Vietnamese chicken is very chewy like native chicken, but since it comes with salt and pepper, it was like boiled chicken without soup.😄😄
Most of the menu wasn't translated, so it was hard, but they also sell seaweed soup and rice (20,000 dong per piece), so it would be good to come here when you want to eat something less spicy!
They gave me watermelon as a service after eating my rice, and it wasn't lukewarm, but refreshing and sweet.

As mentioned in other reviews, you should be careful because there is an additional charge for wet tissues and water‼️

Mama Masala is a true culinary gem for anyone craving authentic Indian flavors. Their dishes, from the crispy dosa to the aromatic biryani, are bursting with taste and prepared with fresh ingredients. The staff is incredibly friendly and welcoming, making every visit a pleasant experience. With its cozy ambiance, it feels like a warm, inviting taste of home. A must-visit for anyone in Da Nang!

Mama Masala Hotel in Da Nang is an absolute gem! The Indian food here is simply amazing—authentic flavors, generous portions, and at prices even lower than what you’d find in most Indian cities. The staff is warm, welcoming, and always ready to help, which makes the dining experience even better.

It’s not just a great place for Indians missing home food, but also highly recommended for anyone who enjoys delicious Indian cuisine. Add to that the wonderful surroundings for hiking and exploring, and you’ve got the perfect spot to visit.

A must-try in Da Nang—highly recommend

Delicious Indian food in Da Nang😍
We lived in India for 3 years, plus 10 years of wintering.
We ended up in Da Nang, like many others this year, by chance.
Our masala levels were low, so we stopped in here, missing Indian cuisine. We were very pleased!
The food is Indian (we just watched it), delicious, just the right amount of spice, everything just right, a huge selection, reasonable prices, and they even play Indian music if you're really craving some atmosphere 🤗🤗🤗
Not good
They had south Indian dishes and Malaysian dishes as well. We ordered pepper prawn, chapati, chicken biryani and egg thosai and everything were delicious. Good service as well. 5 ⭐

I would give 10 stars if I could !!!! The best south indian food. Everything was so authentic. Taste was top notch. If you're in da nang and craving indian food this where you should be dining ! Very sweet staff ❤️

The place is wide and spacious, with plenty of seating and well-placed lighting that creates a warm, homey atmosphere.

The menu offers a wide range of choices, from side dishes to main courses, and their Masala selection is especially impressive. I didn’t realize there were so many kinds of Masala—it felt like a whole new world of flavors to explore. Even something as simple as rice comes in different varieties, so you can really enjoy picking what suits your taste.

I ordered the Chicken Tikka Masala, and it was sumptuous—easily one of the best I’ve had, ranking as my top two. I paired it with white rice, and the serving was very generous. Since I was eating alone, I quickly realized the portions are big enough for two, which worked out well because I was able to take the rest to go and save it for dinner. Their orange juice was also refreshing and pure. You can really taste how fresh their ingredients are—the herbs and spices are top-notch, and the chicken tasted farm-fresh, not just “refrigerator fresh.”

Service was great. The staff were accommodating, quick to serve, and very friendly. It didn’t take long for my food to arrive, and it was easy to communicate since they understood simple English. The menu is also in English, which makes the place very foreigner-friendly.

For the price, it’s good value for money. While it might feel a little expensive if you’re dining alone, the large portions make it worthwhile, especially if you share with someone or plan to take the rest home.

The tables are well-equipped with amenities, and the location itself is convenient. It’s easy to find and accessible through Grab, which makes getting there hassle-free.

Overall, it was a wonderful dining experience. I’ll definitely be back to try more of their dishes.
Exceptional food. Amazing taste. After a long 2 week work, coming back to comfort food hits different. Especially when it’s this good, it hits another level ♥️

I had such a wonderful experience at this Indian restaurant! Being away from home, it’s not always easy to find authentic Indian food, but this place truly exceeded expectations. The flavors were rich, aromatic, and felt just like a comforting home-cooked meal.

The staff were warm and welcoming, taking time to explain the menu and even recommending the best pairings. The service was attentive without being intrusive, which made the dining experience even better.

The ambiance was cozy and inviting — a perfect mix of traditional touches with a modern setting. Every dish, from the starters to the desserts, was prepared with such care and attention to detail.

If you’re looking for authentic Indian cuisine in [Danang,Vietnam], I highly recommend [Mama Masala]. It’s a must-visit for anyone who loves flavorful, quality food served with genuine hospitality. 🌟🌟🌟🌟🌟

After 4 days in Vietnam (Da Nang City), my family and I were craving something different — and Mama Masala truly delivered! The food was incredibly delicious, rich in flavor, and beautifully presented. This place offers one of the best Indian fusion dining experiences we've ever had.

The evaluation is based on the taste of the food as the chicken had a bad smell. We found that the juice glasses were full of insects. But I personally wish the staff members would refrain from repeatedly walking around, coming back and forth again and again in the diving space because otherwise I cannot feel comfortable or  relaxed ( I am not sure why they do so but I am sure almost all people in my country do not like it. ).

The restaurant offers delicious Indian food, rich in flavors and spices. Every dish is prepared with authentic ingredients, bringing out the traditional taste of India. From aromatic curries to perfectly cooked rice, the menu has something for everyone who enjoys bold and flavorful cuisine.

One of the highlights is the masala tea, which is perfectly brewed with a blend of spices, creating a warm and comforting drink. The paratha is crispy on the outside and soft inside, making it a delightful choice for any meal. The samosa is another must-try, with a crispy golden crust and a savory, spiced filling that bursts with flavor.

Beyond the food, the place is known for its friendly and welcoming atmosphere. The staff is warm and attentive, making guests feel at home. The cozy ambiance, combined with great service, makes it a perfect spot to relax and enjoy a satisfying meal.

I recently dined at Mama Masala in Vietnam, and it was an unforgettable experience. I ordered the Aloo Paratha and Paneer Biryani, and both dishes were a testament to authentic Indian flavors. The Aloo Paratha was perfectly cooked—crispy on the outside, soft and flavorful on the inside, and paired beautifully with their tangy and well-spiced aachar.

The Paneer Biryani was equally impressive. The rice was fragrant, fluffy, and infused with perfectly balanced spices, while the paneer was soft and fresh, adding a delightful richness. To round off the meal, I ordered a hot cup of chai, which provided a comforting warmth—especially soothing as it rained outside. It was the perfect end to a delightful dining experience.

The friendly staff and cozy ambiance made the experience even better. If you're in Vietnam and craving authentic Indian cuisine, Mama Masala is a must-visit. I can’t wait to return and explore more of their menu!

We recently visited a newly opened restaurant (just 10 days since its launch) and had an absolutely delightful dining experience. Here’s what we tried: alu brada, pani puri, chicken tikka masala, coconut rice, and garlic naan with cheese. Everything was incredibly flavorful and beautifully presented.

From the photos, you can see they also served mango pickles, sour cream, and some crispy rice paper as extras, which added a lovely touch to the meal. The food was fresh and full of authentic spices, and every bite was a treat.

The staff is incredibly polite and attentive, making the dining experience even more enjoyable. The ambiance is warm and inviting, perfect for a relaxed meal. It’s a must-visit for Indians and anyone who loves Indian cuisine. Highly recommended!

A Must-Visit Indian Restaurant in Da Nang!

This is my second visit to this wonderful Indian restaurant in Da Nang, and it has certainly lived up to my expectations once again! From the exceptional service to the warm and inviting ambiance, everything about this place makes it a standout choice for Indian cuisine lovers.

Food:

Gobi 65 (4.75/5) – A crispy, flavorful dish that’s perfectly spiced. The cauliflower was fried to perfection, and the seasoning was spot on. A great start to the meal.

Chilli Paneer (5/5) – Absolutely fantastic! The paneer was soft and juicy, and the balance of flavors—spicy, tangy, and slightly sweet—was incredible. One of the best I’ve had outside of India!

Mutton Biryani (5/5) – If you’re a biryani lover, this is a must-try! The mutton was tender, and the biryani itself was packed with aromatic spices and flavors. Definitely one of the best biryanis I’ve had in Da Nang.

Chicken Biryani (4.5/5) – Very flavorful, with perfectly cooked chicken and a great mix of spices. Though it was slightly less fragrant than the mutton version, it was still delicious and satisfying.

Vegetable Biryani (4/5) – A solid vegetarian option, though I personally preferred the non-veg versions. The vegetables were fresh, and the rice was flavorful, but I felt it could use a little more seasoning.

Paneer Biryani (4.25/5) – A unique and tasty option for paneer lovers. The paneer was soft and complemented the spices well, but it was slightly milder than I expected. Still, a great dish.

Butter Milk (5/5) – Refreshing and cooling, just as it should be. Perfect to balance out the spices and the richness of the biryanis. One of the best butter milks I’ve had!

Masala Chai (5/5) – A lovely, aromatic masala chai to finish the meal. The spices were perfectly blended, and it was served hot and fresh.

Service & Ambience:

The service here is top-notch. The staff is incredibly friendly and attentive, always ready to offer recommendations or adjust the spice levels according to your preference. The ambience is cozy and welcoming, making it the perfect spot to enjoy a meal with family or friends.

Conclusion:

This restaurant continues to be my go-to place for authentic Indian food in Da Nang. The quality of the food, the warmth of the staff, and the overall dining experience make it a must-visit for anyone craving delicious Indian dishes. Highly recommend it!

This newly opened restaurant in Danang offers a delightful ambiance. For South Indians, the food here brings a comforting sense of home. The staff are exceptionally polite, and the service is outstanding. A must-visit restaurant in Danang—don’t miss the opportunity!

“An Unforgettable Culinary Journey at Mama Masala!”
I recently had the pleasure of dining at Mama Masala, and it was an experience to remember! From the moment I walked in, I was greeted with warmth, and the ambiance beautifully captured the essence of Indian culture with its authentic decor and soothing music.

The food was absolutely phenomenal! Every dish we ordered was bursting with flavors, beautifully presented, and perfectly spiced. The Butter Chicken was a standout – rich, creamy, and cooked to perfection. The freshly baked naan was fluffy and paired wonderfully with the curries. To top it off, the Gulab Jamun provided a delightful sweet ending to an already perfect meal.

What truly elevated the experience was the impeccable service. The staff at Mama Masala were attentive, friendly, and went above and beyond to ensure every guest felt special.

If you’re a fan of Indian cuisine or looking to explore new flavors, Mama Masala is a must-visit! I highly recommend it for an authentic and memorable dining experience.

Our heartfelt gratitude goes to Mama Masala's entire team. We enjoyed incredible meals with our group in Ho Chi Minh and were thrilled to discover their new restaurant in Da Nang. Mr. Jahir sir and Tamil sir provide us a meal, which received glowing reviews, comparable to the esteemed KALYANA VEETU SAMAYAL from Tamilnadu. Chef Mr. Mahandran's and team expertise brought Tamilnadu cuisine to our table. This gem is a must-visit for those exploring central and southern Vietnam. We wish the team all the best and anticipate their expansion across Vietnam.

We order a set from set menu and I think it was my worst decision ever. The salad and the soup were totally hkd$10 quality which is very bad, but it cost me $100 for each. The orange in salad was sour. For the steak, we were super disappointed with it. We ordered a medium rare but at the end it comes out it was 90%raw. I don’t think I pay HKD$500 and I had such a bad experience even though it is cheaper than (HK). For the dessert, I can buy a $10 cake from convenience store and still taste better than that. I saw the comment and people said it was cheap and good quality. However, I went to a 500% much better restaurant and it was much cheaper in Korea last week. I was totally disappointed and my friends felt unwell after that.
I had a wonderful night with my family. The staff is very cheerful and helpful. The food is amazing. My son even said it is the best western meal he had so far. Great value for money!!
Very cosy & cute 😍 restaurant 🥰 serving good quality yummy 🥰 French cuisine for good value of money. Very friendly service in a romantic 😍 setting. We thoroughly enjoyed our meal👍🏻👍🏻. …
Excellent meal, the best quality beef cooked medium rare to perfection.  The house red (Bordeaux) was very decent also.

We had wonderful time at Le Bambino for celebrating birthday with our dearest friend. Thank you Ms Vinh for being so kind to reserve the table for us. Apart from that , there’s a younger waiter who with friendly smile, actively introduces each dish to us. I got fantastic service from staff of the restaurant.All the food we ordered is above average level. Beef is tender and Goose liver is creamy. I highly recommend you to visit this restaurant for enjoyment with your friends and families. To remind, the portion of food is a bit more. Think before you order food.

The food was spectacular, the interior feels very home-y and the staff were extremely attentive at all times! You are really taken care of here and I would recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for some scrumptious good and tasty wine :)
Delicious food with generous portions in a charming authentic french restaurant. The foie gras was excellent and the staff super friendly.

hands down best french restaurant in da nang for food, coziness, environment, ambience, and service. stumbled across this gem for family christmas dinner last year, had the most amazing food so we came back again this year! and will be back again

Friendly knowledgeable staff greet you and guide you through your meal.  Lobster soup and lobster ravioli were nicely prepared and had a depth of flavor you'd look for in these dishes.  Duck conditioner was a good example of French cooking, as were the scallops.  Outstanding opera cake.  Highly recommended.
Good Food and good service！Very recommend to order the rib beef, lamb and foie gras🤩🤩
Good French food. Recommend the foie gras, steak and lamb. Will be back
Wonderful dinner for family gathering with good value.  Nice environment and service.
Very reasonable price for nice french food. Environment is very cozy and homely restaurant.

Perfect seasoning, excellent texture and  beautiful present of foods.
All dishes are attractive, sweet services, cosy place to enjoy our meal.
I really love the starters and the lobster soup.
The duck confit , Angus Ribeye are soft and tender. Raviolis are in rich flavor.
Creme brulee is the perfect ending of a fantastic meal.

We went there for a nice French experience, but we have not had a worse experience anywhere in Vietnam. Yes, we went there with a 1yo toddler who was a bit noisy with his toy, but the staff had a rude attitude, isolating us to a different room and throwing the food on the table as if it was a school canteen. I felt I needed to apologise for having bothered them. On top of that, their foie gras was mediocre at best.
nice vibe and excellent service, great steak too!
Very nice traditional french dishes. Recommend!
The restaurant is a home like design and the food was really good. The waiters were very polite and helpful. Highly recommend to try!
Nice environment. The food and service is nice.

Recommended items: foie gras, snails, lamb. The portions at this restaurant are quite generous, unlike my impression of French cuisine, where portions are usually smaller. Our whole family had a satisfying Christmas meal here.

my wife and i dined here many times. and without fail, we had a great experience. the food is great, the waitstaff is great and the owners are great. each and every time we dined there the two owners spoke with us in a down to earth …

I came to this restaurant expecting less than what I got, I was really pleasantly surprised and very happy.

Normally, I try new restaurants daily to better understand food, culture, execution, and to keep up with my knowledge of the industry. I rarely get surprised. Today was a surprise.

Although I came to the restaurant unannounced, the staff were immediately ready to seat me and assured me that I was in for a nice meal.

From the start, they brought out a basket of bread with premium beurre d’Isigny. Quite surprising to see such premium products being have to customers in Vietnam.

I ordered the scallops, their lowest priced beef steak, as well as a Caesar salad and a chocolate fondant.

All turned out well. Steak was a little bit undercooked (MR vs M), but I can understand the reluctance of the chef to go to far with such a cut of meat. Either way, it still turned out pretty good!

Da Nang is not known for its supply of cheese, and I think they use the have used the best ingredients possible in the Caesar salad; every single bite had bacon, you could taste the anchovies, and there was plenty of Parmesan, although not exactly the aged variety we might see in Bangkok or Hong Kong.

Scallops were fairly large gauge and good value for money.

Steak was great value for money as well and I can’t wait to try the whole range on subsequent visits.

It was really nice to be offered a top up of my bread basket by the staff mid-meal, and it was equally nice to be offered a complementary café by owner Vinh in the end.

Before that farewell café, though, I had the chocolate fondant. This one was particularly excellent. Not the mass-market variety you see in a lot of restaurants (and a number of five-star hotels).

Some thought has been put into the selection of this desert and as a result, it really topped off a great dinner.

Recipes are solid, products are good, pricing is fair.

5/5 and an exceptionally friendly owner.

Would I come back? Certainly! I look forward to my next visit.

My expectation of "French fine dining" should be a combination of ambiance, atmosphere, service attentiveness, on top of the food and drink.  There should be a degree of sophistication to be enjoyed.  Le Bambino  dining area has two …

Having read some of the more recent reviews, you could easily be persuaded to try somewhere else.  ||We decided that Le Bambino was worth a visit and we weren’t disappointed.  But at the same time, we weren’t blown away by the experience …
Excellent food and service. Highly recommended.

Located inside a typically French designed shophouse. The French owner stays upstairs.

Food served were delicious.  Our grouop had Duck Confit, Rack of Lamb and Sirlion Steak.  No complaints only compliments on the food quality.

Service was attentive yet discreet.

A must if you are looking for authentic French food in Danang

We were looking for a French Vietnam culinary experience and we had a delightful one.  When the taxi dropped us off at the entrance of an alley, we followed the signs to Le Bambino.  We felt as if we were arriving at a relatives home as the …

We went here on recommendation from a relative. I'm no expert in French cuisine, but can certainly vouch that both the lamb and duck taste fantastic. The downside, naturally, is price. Le Bambino is FAR more expensive than most places in Vietnam - even most of the foreign food restaurants. Prices are not quite to the level of Europe or N America, but still hard to justify when you're in a place like Vietnam. Treat it as a "fancy date" type of destination.
The food is delicious, the dining environment is good, and the service is great. A satisfying meal, highly recommended to tourists visiting Da Nang.
delicious food with good sêrvice, love the food eapeically the snail and duck leg, great vibe too. highly recommend this restaurant to people looking for delicious french food

Been here a several times and never get disappointment any time. This time i go with Scallops, Frog Legs and two of my favorites-Black Angus Ribeye and French Snails. The Blue Cheese sauce cant never go wrong with the steak, and all the rest is completely blowing flavor. End my meal with Le Bambino signature dessert are Creme Brulee and Tiramisu. The Creme Brulee is melting inside and crispy outside. Beside with the bittersweet of the Tiramisu, the taste i had never have in anywhere else. Go along with a very good sevice , all make me a perfect dinner date. Highly Recommended 👍

Chinese style but said to be a French one. Like a household type with a small pool outside. Food is not so good when compared with the price. Staff is nice but not professional. Never change your plate and even forget to place the knife and fork. Asked for medium rare of the rib eye but come out with well done. You may try but don't expect what you want and pay for it.

Lovely French food in a nice setting. Vol au vent, scallops and tournedos rossini were superb (though I would prefer the beef is served on a crouton- a minor point). Presentation was remarkable. Wholeheartedly recommend dining here.
The price is much higher than Vietnamese food here (like 3x-4x expensive), yet still acceptable as the food quality is excellent! You will enjoy a happy French dinner here. Recommended!

I decided to got o Le Bambino as I heard a lot of recommendation from my friends about it. let me start by saying that this steakhouse is great value for money. It is not pretentious, it does exactly what it sets out to do which is to feed …
Nice food, very good service
Wonderful French food and excellent customer service. We had a great meal.

Lonely planet guided us to this Oasis of calm in the middle of the chaos that is Da Nang. As soon as you pass through the door you feel relaxed and special. A warm greeting from the French and Vietnamese owners followed by excellent advice …

Excellent steaks we had and nice environment with friendly staff. Owner accepted our last minute booking via Facebook messenger app as we did not have a local phone number. Price is reasonable for a decent French meal, we ordered a steak for each (5 in total), lobster soup, tomato soup, snails, salad, a glass of wine and soft drinks. Total was around 3 to 4 times less than what we would need to pay in Hong Kong. But of course by local standard it's very expensive so it's a place for tourists. We had a great time there nonetheless and would definitely go again if we ever find ourselves in Da Nang again.

Very unhappy dining experience, a total disappointment!

Firstly, the place is hot even with a few air conditions. My wife had to use her small portable fan the whole time dining there. Staff saw her but did not even bother asking or switching place or even bring out a portable cooler/fan. The place is not crowded, the whole time we were there, only 3 tables including ours and it was a Friday night.

After we were done with our meal, one of the staff came to ask for our feedbacks on our meal (read: we did not complain, we were asked for feedbacks). We gave our honest feedbacks on how we truly felt. When we asked for the bill, the owner (French men I believed) came and was surprised that we were unhappy with the meal. He started to challenge our tastebuds and made us felt as if we had no right to comment. Note to the owner: if you are not ready for any constructive feedbacks, DO NOT allow your staffs to ask the customers.

1. French snails: tasteless. He told us how French snails supposed to taste and that all his snails are imported from France and that he sold more than 200 plates a month. We seriously do not care how many plates you sold per month, we thought the dish could be improved.

2. Duck breast with orange sauce. Duck breast was chewy and tasteless where the duck was not marinated enough.

3. Seafood pasta. Cream sauce with the miserable small prawns and some squids. Chewy and over cooked.

4. Drinks. We requested for warm water as my wife is pregnant. We were given a bottle of mineral water and the price was the same as my tiger beer.

5. The only good thing about our meal was the lobster soup.

It was our worst meal in Da Nang especially after speaking to the owner, we felt insulted. The price we paid wasn't cheap and it definitely did not worth the price no matter the food, service or ambiance. I'm sure the owner wouldn't be happy with this review and I could see how he handled bad comments online from other patrons. Definitely not going back and definitely do not recommend anyone going. Spend your money elsewhere for better food and services.

Delicious food, better than expected (may be I didn’t have high expectation before), staff are nice, pleasant atmosphere, good wine list with reasonable price, accept credit card payment.

Overall price is cheap as compared to Hong Kong, but expensive to local.

Food is good whilst price is reasonable.
The time I visited here is for celebrate my boyfriend and I sent email for reservation. However, the owner didn’t confirm me if Bday cake can be prepared even I have sent several emails before I start my trip.....

visited this restaurant during our stay in DaNang. The location of it is tricky but obvious because they have a sign at the corner already. We took grab car to the entrance of the alley and walked in. We arrived at around 5:15pm. The server showed us the special menu on a little black board of that day. We ordered lobster soup, beef carpaccio, goat cheese salad, lamb fillet and cod. The soup tasted amazingly good. The beef carpaccio is a big plate with slices of cheese on top. Eat them together to avoid the bland  taste of the beef. The salad and cod are also nice but the highlight of the night was the lamb fillet. I ordered it medium and it was cooked perfectly. It was juicy and really tender. Not dry and chewy at all. Highly recommend. The environment makes the diners feel comfortable . It is not really grand and scared you away that kind of restaurant. The price is not too high and reasonable. We orderd wine and with all the food. It is approximately US$105.

Great classic French cooking in the heart of Da Nang. The food was of the highest quality, cooked superbly. The atmosphere is stylish and relaxed and the owner has the the most wonderful, friendly dog.

Great food with good atmosphere. Will come back again .

Staff is nice and attentive

Angus steak and lamb ribs are nice tender and juicy. Lobster soup was very tasty. Pan fried foie gras was well prepared. The only let down was the escagots. A bit like the Vietnamese seafood style - garlic and olive oil

Every dish was delicious. We ate dinner in this restaurant. This is the First food place in Da Nang where we were understood. It's sooo lovely to hear familiar tones - English and French! Everyone in the restaurant including the owners were warm and friendly. We'll definitely be back if given a chance! Merci beaucoup! :)

After escaping the floods of Hoi An we were lucky to come across this gem hidden down a lane way in DaNang. We had a midnight sleeper train to NahTrang and were hoping to find somewhere dry to relax. Unfortunately no rooms were free, …

Excellent. Well priced. Aircon area is no smoking. Everywhere else is smoking. Located down a dark area. Relaxing restaurant with gentle music, beautiful pool area. I am single, so it's a little boring, as I'm alone. Nobody for conversation. Recommend as one of your top picks in Danang. Singles may get bored.

Wonderful staff, amazing chef, onsite owners, excellent wines (reasonably priced).

Food excellent. Large portions. Gentle music. Quiet neighborhood.

These people who speak negative about Bambino are 🙊 monkeys. Bambino is an outstanding restaurant.

The food is French and the ingredients are imported from 🇫🇷 France!

Do not listen to the trolls, or baboons. I eat here most nights.

The restaurant, and family 👪 of staff, and ownership, are amazing! Wonderful people.

Music is great, gentle. You can hear each other speak, at your table.

Restaurant is airconditioned and quaint.

Pool is for ambiance and grand children. Very nice.

Outside aircon is smoking. I object to smoking.

Meat is excellent. Professionally prepared.

Seafood pasta is excellent and cheap.

The restaurant is not for ill-mannered, poorly employed peasants.

Excellent place to go, with manners, and taste!
Top rank French restaurant in Danang. Food are presented neat and modest. Price is no cheap. Mostly suitable for people enjoying ambience and fine dining at a higher price.

It is not a really French restaurant, the onion soup is not cooked well, the snail has no
Taste, the frog leg cook in a Chinese way

Affordable french restaurant with good duck leg! The salad is okay but the desserts are just fair (or quite disappointing actually).

Good cuisine over priced , quality is good , portions are not consistent with price
They showed special of the day ! Lobster Bisque which we order ,after few minutes they said it won't be available after 2 hours , for the level price of what they pretend to be ???
We pay deliver be careful with over price !

Ordered tenderloin medium-rare. Came overcooked. The creme brulee was overcooked and the sugar crust was so thick it was difficult to break and then sticking to my teeth instead of melting in my mouth. Service was attentive and unobtrusive.

we shared an excellent bottle of wine, cheese plate, salad and kobe steak. delicious break from local fare and tiger beer. Staff and owner were fantastiques! only drawback... dreadful old pop music. though funny, it was out of step with the meal.
Have a  great time to enjoy our French cuisine at this restaurant with atmosphere  is comfort, the food is very delicious and the staff is really friendly to  recommended us good menu for us.Thanks

The food is great and delightful here. Even though it has a higher price than average restaurant here in Danang, but I think it’s worthy to try, and I think I will come back again in the next trip in Danang.
The atmosphere is quite good, garlic butter snail and the lobster soup is tasty! The service is impeccable！

Our family came to Danang by train. We took a taxi to Bambino B&B and arrived to the address 122/11 Quang Trung in about 8.45AM. In this morning time, unfortunoterly for us, this place is not opend yet. It is not a hotel, not a hostel, and …
Very disappointed! Nothing was good! Bread,Salads, duck confit and rack of lamb was under expectations with poor garnish! Will never go again! Service was nice and attentive.

Was cravings for western food after days here in Danang.

Found this hidden gem here.. great service.. good food.. nice and cozy ambience..
Walk 1/2 mile to get here and was not disappointed. Just a great place. Well done by all !!!
a traditional french restaurant that food, style, taste, music, environment is execellent.   Strongely recommand for everyone who deserves good food with reasonable price.

Easy to find the place. Everything’s fine, with good service and high kitchen quality comes high prices, one thing that if you’re eating alone you might not get the quality service as the others who’s in groups, the waitress didn’t even greet me when I stepped in. Wifi doesn’t work, parts of food weren’t served at one time.
We had a great Christmas evening here. The food and drinks were amazing, and the staff are very friendly and helpful.
Request warm water but give hot hot water. Can't drink wid medicine. Food tasteless need put lots of pepper and salt.
Good meal, good service, good value. They’ve got the whole package.

Service very good!!!
Food nice!!
Great place for french food. Not cheap. Expect to pay around 1,000,000 vnd per person for an entree, main course and dessert. Food is good.

We are very happy with the service , staffs are well trained , professional with a great smile . Food was very tasty and price is acceptable, definitely highly recommended, thank you for your service .
The ribeye was nicely done. Definitely worth another visit
Very expensive for most vietnamese. However,food is delicious.  We book a table  for 4 and paid hk$1000.

Vietnam standard French restaurant and do not expect same standard as ur home town. Food standard is just pass. I would call this a good 茶餐廳

Very good food! The rib eye and onion soup was amazing! Highly recommended!
Nice environment, staffs are ok but service is not professional and foods are not really value for money.

Good middle Eastern and Vietnamese food at reasonable prices.
Location: Place is on the main road, facing the han river, very near to Dragon bridge. Easy to access and find.
The food: We tried mixed grill platter, Falafel wrap, mandi rice and Banh mi along with fresh coconuts. Falafel wrap was the best item with Falafel freshly fried. Banh Mi was also good with succulent, juicy chicken pieces inside. Mix grill.platter contained sheesh kebabs, chicken kebab, beef kebab with a bit of salad and rice. Kebabs were good but beef was quite dry and rough with a little of smell too. Mandi rice was quite disappointing as rice were oozing water and in first round chicken was not properly heated. We asked the dish to be reheated which was dine promptly. Portions were decent. Mix platter portion was a bit less while mandi rice portion was quite large.
Ambience: Nice and clean. Not too fancy but quite pleasing to eyes.
Service: Service was super good with staff very responsive and quick. Food arrived quite quickly too.
Price: A sumptuous dinner for 3 costed 1020000 Dongs (~50 SGD) which isn't that expensive.
Overall a good option if you want halal food in Da Nang.

⭐ 1-star review

The meal itself was good, and the pho was delicious, but the service could seriously improve.
The waiter was apathetic and even told customers they couldn't use the air conditioner.

Dining in such hot weather was a very uncomfortable experience.

I just wanted to enjoy a bowl of pho, but the service was so disappointing that it ruined my overall experience.

I hope the restaurant will pay more attention to customer experience and improve its service.
I was initially offended when they said I couldn't sit on the second floor. The food was average. The fried rice was the best. The rice noodles were a bit bland? There were no cutlery provided.
Love the place! Love the food, coming back

The air conditioning is on, and the banh xeo is 8,000 won. They even offer yogurt after the meal. The bathroom is on the second floor. The banh xeo is the same flavor you know. It's delicious.
Delicious food and drinks. Highly recommend! :)
Very tasty and generous portions. Vegetarian banh xeo options are also available. :) The smoothies are also highly recommended. ☺️
One of the best banh xeo I had in all of Vietnam! So crispy and great service.
It was delicious. The price was a bit high.
Lovely little cafe nice coffee we got coconut and got the mixed banh mi which was very nice fresh roll. The cafe was also  very clean
The restaurant environment is very beautiful. I ordered spring rolls, fried chicken, barbecue and fried noodles. The carbohydrates are sufficient and I am very full.

Delicious food, friendly staff. Will come again next time.
Friendly and enthusiastic staff, beautiful and spacious space, delicious food... worth trying
Really enjoyed the banh xeo! The staff was also very kind and helpful.
Very delicious food, enthusiastic staff, beautiful and clean space, will come back if I have the opportunity to visit Da Nang

Don't be fooled by the reviews and comments from part-timers. They say it's Phu Quoc. It's Da Nang, but they say it's a Phu Quoc restaurant. The food, quality, and service are all subpar. And even though there were four people and no other customers, they said there was one spoon missing. 5 stars. Don't be fooled by part-timers who hire you. Instead, eat at a local restaurant in the night market. The prices are twice as high. I hope this post becomes a pilgrimage.

Who are the part-timers who gave 5 stars here? The price is similar to Korea, but the service is terrible. The spoon container is empty, so when you ask for more spoons, they say there are no spoons and gather the kids and play house. I've been living in Vietnam for a month and this is the worst. Seriously, don't go there. They serve freshly made food on an empty plate. Hahahaha. This is not an exaggeration at all. If you exaggerate, I will take legal action.
Honestly, I don't know why it's a 5. The taste is average, and the staff is always a bit slow when you call them.

September 28, 2025. I came to a restaurant where I could eat comfortably after avoiding the typhoon. I had shrimp and pork banh xeo and pork bun cha, and they were delicious! However, they weren't exceptionally delicious, so unless it's raining or windy, go somewhere else. It's only 4 stars because it's expensive~! The staff are friendly and the restaurant is pleasant. However, the bathroom isn't very clean;
Delicious, clean, cool restaurant, happy staff

We arrived on a night flight and checked into the Wink Hotel right in front. We were looking for a restaurant together, and it was convenient because they served late and you could order with a QR code at the table! The bun cha was just okay, but the grilled pork belly, stir-fried seafood noodles, fried rice, and smoothies were all delicious! I think all the meat dishes were delicious! But the food took too long to come out..ㅠㅠ It came out so slowly, like a radish course meal, that we were so hungry that it was a bit difficult, but it was delicious!!
It was so delicious and the staff was so friendly! It wasn't too salty, so I recommend bringing kids.

It took an hour for my order to arrive. The banh xeo was a little bland for me. The toilet was completely out of tissue, there was no hand sanitizer, there was dirty cleaning water left in the toilet, and the lock was broken, so I couldn't close the door. The staff were friendly. The restaurant had a nice, stylish atmosphere. Ordering via QR code was easy, but the Wi-Fi password wasn't listed and the signal was poor, so it took a while to order.
The food was good, the staff was excellent, and the atmosphere was very good.
It's refreshing and delicious. My picky parents really enjoyed the chicken skewers and rice.
The staff are really friendly and the food is delicious. I had a nice meal with my parents.
Friendly and clean interior. Delicious food, I love it~
It's Vietnamese food, not very tasty. It's fine as a get-a-way, but the food was very oily and lacked flavor.

It's just a local banh mi place. They don't speak English or Korean, but the taste is typical of a local banh mi place. It doesn't taste like banh mi cotienne, but it's moderately spicy and has a good amount of cilantro, so if you don't like cilantro, be sure to mention it. It's actually a good thing that there aren't any more local banh mi places like this in Da Nang these days.
Great little restaurant. Enjoyed the food. Had a good time. Would come back easy.

friendly staff 10d

The fried rice is super delicious and the skewers are also really tasty.
Super cute restaurant, bánh xèo was yummy. Open late. Ordering was easy.

The menu is in Korean, and the food is delicious. They even explain how to use the sauces (in English). The coconut milk smoothie is especially delicious.

The staff is friendly, enthusiastic and quick. It is worth visiting many times and recommending to friends!

I must say that the pancakes at BANH XEO CUOI RESTAURANT gave me the feeling of enjoying pancakes in the West. The pancakes were skillfully poured, the crust was very thin, crispy from the inside out. The filling was full of fresh shrimp, pork belly, bean sprouts and green beans. In particular, the shrimp here is very firm and sweet, served with fresh green vegetables and a special sweet and sour fish sauce. The fish sauce was mixed very well, not too salty or too bland, helping to balance the flavor of the pancakes. Just one bite and you can feel all the quintessence of this dish. This is a must-visit address if you are a fan of Western pancakes.

Before ordering, I asked if there was a VAT invoice. The shop said yes. Then I gave the QR code and filled in 77.49 information. But day after day, I still didn't see the invoice. I called all the phone numbers, including the phone number on the bill, but they blocked incoming calls. I texted on FB and made appointments over and over again, but still no answer whether it was yes or no. Anyone like me who goes on a business trip and needs an invoice should stay away from this shop.

I used the service here, did the steps to request a VAT invoice but did not receive it after 5 days. Unable to contact the store, the phone number is blocked from receiving calls, called the HCM branch twice to notify but still got nothing.
The service is too bad, everyone should consider when going on a business trip and need a VAT invoice.

Review_text:
The pho meat was tender and the soup was delicious!

The restaurant kicked out customers normally and gave priority to the group. Too bad.

Hi Admin!
We are from Viatris company.
7/18/2025, the company group ate Pho24 at Da Nang airport. We requested an invoice and were instructed to leave our information. We were not assured and asked again to confirm, and were told that the invoice would be issued on the same day. But until now, the invoice has not been issued to us. 7/19/2025.
If the restaurant does not have a clear answer for us today, we will call the hotline of the Da Nang police and tax department. Thank you!

Restaurant opposite Gate 6 (on the right after bag check)

Food is very tasty.

Spring rolls are especially good.

You can order at the cash register. The food is delivered to your table as soon as it's prepared.

Unfortunately, no knives for cutting the large piece of meat.

Card payments accepted.

Overall, very clean.
Delicious pho. Saves hunger when flight is delayed.

- The Pho taste is also normal, no highlight, if compared to other Pho shops, the bowl of Pho at Quan 24g is not rich and fragrant enough.
- The price is cheaper than the restaurants in the airport
- Suggestion: inside the restaurant, it is best to turn off the music or if you open it, you should play soft music, without lyrics, low volume because the music is too loud and you will not be able to hear the airport announcements.
Good pho

No matter how friendly Da Nang people are, the attitude of the staff at Pho 24 restaurant is worse. If you order food first, the staff will do it later. The pho broth was not hot, so when asked to warm it up, the staff member had a sour face. Stay away from this brand. Too bad!
Average-quality Phở for a decent price at the airport. I recommend.

Just now I ordered a bowl of pho size L, 109k, but I put in a little bit of broth. I asked for an extra small cup of broth to help keep it from drying out, but the staff looked at the manager hesitantly. The manager glanced at me and said no. I asked again a third time, "Sir, don't you add more broth when the bowl of pho is dry?", the staff said back to me, "Yes sir, our manager is difficult". If you have a manager, it's easy to lose customers. I ate a bowl of pho for 109k and asked for some broth but if you're still stingy, customers won't come to you in the future. Especially since I'm a news media company, what if I made this story public? Well, I would like to add that a pho restaurant that doesn't have tissues for customers is not very good

I just ate here, I asked for some broth but oh my God, the manager there didn't want to give it to me. Even when I asked for some broth, my face wrinkled and felt tired. Unfortunately, the staff was very friendly and enthusiastic but the manager always made me feel embarrassed. For example, if the shop doesn't want to give it away, then I'll buy it instead of being glued, so posting an article to remind others is worth it, right??!!!!!!! The page doesn't respond to comments, no one sees it, but even has a 20k follow account. The owner also invests a lot, but the management is bad and lacking, making it easy to lose customers. Tks
The pho is good, the price is more suitable than other brands at the airport. Enthusiastic service, comfortable seating space.

The food was good, the two male employees were very helpful and dedicated, but the female employee was completely incapable of dealing with customers, hence 3 stars.

The food tastes quite good, the restaurant serves quickly and enthusiastically, always welcoming guests loudly :), the prices are at the airport but reasonable. There are both rice and pho rolls... not suitable for vegetarians. I quite like vegetarian kumquat juice, but it may not be suitable for people who don't like sour foods.

My boyfriend is a foreigner. We went together.. he is a vegetarian.. and often eats vegetarian spring rolls.. when he came here he asked for vegetarian spring rolls but the staff didn't hear clearly. made chicken spring rolls.. after they brought them out he couldn't eat them.. we didn't want to bother and called the staff to ask again if there were vegetarian spring rolls (this time I asked) the staff nodded to us and said yes.. but after they brought them out (oh my god) it was unacceptable.. it was spring rolls.. not spring rolls.. but worse, there was a strand of hair inside.. couldn't be more angry.. we couldn't scream because there were other people eating so we left in silence.. hope the management can fix this situation

Warning graphic review.  **!!Do not feed to babies or children not fit for human consumption**!! The price is reasonable but... the Pho has a massive amount of MSG. If you are sensitive to it, it will give you a pre-boarding ride up MSG alley and if your unfortunate enough miss your flight or feel very uncomfortable in flight, BEST TO AVOID. Either way I don't think air travelers need an extra stressor while flighing. Staff were giggling at eachother for no reason the whole time while eating which is unprofessional.

I would like to express my special thanks to you-- Hoang Yen!

Departing from Da Nang for a business trip. After struggling through control gate and check-in port, I was finally in the waiting lounge and hungry for lunch, there were many choices but Pho24 caught my eyes sight.
When i walked in, the AC wasnt working properly but the staff's smile really cool me off. They suggest me their signature dish, "Pho Dac Biet" bowl, I was eager to have some and they quickly served it hot and steamy.
*TASTE: It's 9/10 for me, it wasn't perfect, but I could feel the Vietnamese love in the bowl, warm and welcome. The soup was seasoned just right, the beef was cooked on point and when you dipped them in the sauce, it was superb. The down point was the AC so hot, combine with hot Pho, I was sweating all over the place.
*STAFF/SERVICE: It's nice, very quickly served, they showed me some knowledge about Pho. Not too pricy, actually I can't get anywhere cheaper with this level of Pho.
*OVERALL: Good food, nice people, okay price but hot AC.
The space is small but quite comfortable and cute. The food is rich and delicious. Warm and considerate service attitude. I like it so much!
The space is clean. Delicious pho. My phone ran out of battery but the staff was very enthusiastic to help and ran to borrow a charger for me. Service attitude is very friendly. Rating 5 stars!
Very disgusting, saw at least 5 cockroaches during our 10 min stay, they were on the tables, chairs, walls, everywhere!
Never eat it. Trust it and avoid it.
This is a great restaurant. Beautiful place and enthusiastic staff. This was my first time eating pho, it was really delicious. I will come again next time.

The pho is delicious, to my taste, the restaurant is very clean and hygienic, the staff is friendly and enthusiastic in helping customers, so I am very satisfied.

I'm at the airport, I just went to the restaurant to order 5 bowls of pho, the orderer told me that they are preparing to sell to groups, not to individual customers, and that the wholesaler also chooses differently. The person who ordered pho 24 told me was a girl wearing glasses. If you sell to groups, please tell them in a way that makes it easier for them to hear that you are having some problem and are currently fixing it, please understand, don't say it so bluntly, saying it like pouring cold water on people's faces.

The food took too long to make (a bowl of pho costs 70k), the customer was late for their flight and couldn't wait, the staff gave the wrong change, the customer corrected it and was uncooperative, no cash back. Deserves 1 star, no need to say more!
Pho is okay. I'm so hungry I have to eat.

These guys are one of the popular chain stores in Vietnam. They are affiliated with the Jollibee Group of the Phillippines.

Can't find any fault with the food here except for the prices. They are a bit pricey.

Decent Vietnamese fast food chain specializing in pho. Service is prompt and the quality is standard. Hygiene is better than the street shops. The Vietnamese coffee is a miss as it was only sweet and not strong enough.

Easily the best restaurant of mid Vietnam!
When we tell you that Nén Danang together with Coco in HCMC were for us the two best culinary experiences of the year so far, then you know it’s top class. And we do live in the Flemish part of Belgium, not exactly a culinary desert…
Everything was approaching perfection!
A special word of thanks to the staff. They did a great job. And for us, all speaking fluently English, that was the cherry on the cake.

My husband and I visited this restaurant as the finale of our trip to Da Nang. Although we didn't have a reservation, we were seated promptly. Afterward, more and more customers with reservations arrived, so it may be a good idea to make a reservation in advance.

The restaurant's main course menu is "Journey," a journey-themed menu. Due to our flight back home, we chose the seven-course short course with wine pairings. The restaurant's dimly lit, calm atmosphere allowed the staff to carefully explain each dish. The dishes offered many new flavors and textures, providing a constant stream of new discoveries. The pairings included not only wine but also popular Japanese sake brands like "Senkin" and "Saku," which complemented the food perfectly.

The staff's thoughtfulness was particularly impressive. They realized our limited English skills and even created Japanese descriptions using ChatGPT to show us. Their attentive service truly represents first-class service.

As other reviewers have mentioned, the price was much higher than we expected, coming in at around 50,000 yen for our couple. Still, I am very satisfied that I was able to spend a special experience on a special day that will become a once-in-a-lifetime memory.

Vietnam's first Michelin-starred restaurant 🇻🇳NÉN
Every time a dish is served,
it feels like an exciting journey begins.
The deliciousness is truly moving.
The chef's playfulness and love for this land,
the culture that has been passed down through generations,
reminds us that nothing is wasted.
The final dinner of our trip was a wonderful moment.

Went as a group of 7, spent 4M dong with drink set and sparkling water.

Nen’s lunch course set was amazing and a culinary experience. The server Tor was incredibly polite and took the time to explain each course in careful detail.

There is a drink pairing (alcoholic/non alcoholic) that is available at an add-on price.

I really LOVED the food and the experience. It’s definitely not cheap, but I felt that it was worth the charge for Vietnamese fine dining. The ingredients are unique to Vietnam and each dish is explained by the chef through story cards, which I enjoyed reading.

I would come again with loved ones who have not tried this, or if I am back in Da Nang with a new Story menu. Dessert was AMAZING.

Other than the price being a little steep, there is nothing not to love about Nen. Would recommend trying at least once!

Nén surprised me with its fine dining take on Vietnamese cuisine. The dishes are artistic and full of flavor. You should try their tasting menu for a full experience. I recommend this restaurant for foodies looking for something creative and unique in Da Nang.

A little heavy on the story telling, and some of the flavors were not my favorite. We did the seven course, and I got the alcohol pairing. Frankly I could have done the 5 course…it took nearly 3 hours to finish…the servers we had was excellent-best part of the experience

Hoping to experience fine dining in Da Nang, I visited Nen Restaurant, a Michelin Green Star restaurant serving modern Vietnamese cuisine with a focus on local ingredients.

Tucked away in a quiet spot just outside the city center, it was easy to reach by Grab. The restaurant offered a relaxing atmosphere, away from the hustle and bustle of the city, with ample space between tables, allowing for a relaxed meal.

I chose the "Story Menu," which showcases Vietnamese ingredients and food culture. Each dish was beautifully presented, almost like a work of art. What particularly surprised me was the unique flavors, which were hard to imagine from their appearance. Despite the sophisticated French-style techniques used, the flavors of Vietnamese cuisine were still distinctly Vietnamese.

The staff's service was also excellent, carefully explaining the dishes in English, and providing explanations of each dish in Japanese, so I could enjoy my meal with ease. Learning more about the stories behind the dishes and the local ingredients used made it feel more like a journey than just a meal.

Vietnamese food is often associated with street food stalls, but here you can enjoy Vietnamese food culture in a completely new way. I think it's the perfect choice for a special anniversary or when you want to spend a romantic time with your loved one.

I visited this restaurant a few months ago but only now have time to write a review. For me, except for one dish made from eggshells that felt gritty when eaten, all the dishes here are perfect, the food is meticulously prepared and all the dishes have their own stories, I see that the restaurant has made a lot of effort to elevate the familiar daily fruits and vegetables on the menu, in addition to the dishes in the set menu and the drinks I chose, the restaurant also thoughtfully gave me extra wine. The staff here are very professional from the way they serve to the way they introduce the dishes. The space here is spacious and luxurious.

What an incredible dining experience! This French restaurant offers a beautifully crafted tasting menu that blends refined techniques with local Vietnamese ingredients in the most creative way.

Every dish—from the sea urchin to the pheasant with glutinous corn—was thoughtfully presented and absolutely delicious.

The service was impeccable—attentive, warm, and professional. The staff explained each course with passion and made us feel genuinely welcome. A perfect spot for a special evening.

Highly recommended!

The food was very unique with a nice story behind. The courses were served very fast. Too fast for a comfortable dinner. The windows are also dirty and the toilettes are not clean. There were no towels to dry hands and also the soap was out. Im sorry for the price it was not the service that we expected. At the and we thanked the waitress for her service and she was just looking at the bills and told us „yes“ for a goodbye. Honestly we are not very difficult to handle. There are a lot of lovely places in da nang. If you want some unique food come by. If you want some nice service go somewhere else. Thank you

It’s my first Vietnamese fine dining experience. I was pleasantly surprised and every dishes were executed beautifully.
I recommend this place.
Exceptional meal that all should try when you are in Da Nang! Using true Vietnamese ingredients and every course is taken care of to its very detail, we had an enjoyable dinner here!

Nén Danang, located in Da Nang, is a pioneering restaurant that redefines Vietnamese fine dining through its deep commitment to hyper-local ingredients, sustainability, and a unique storytelling approach. Led by the visionary Chef Summer Le, Nén Danang is not just a meal; it's a narrative journey through the essence of Vietnamese culture and its rich culinary heritage.

The Soulful Cuisine
At the core of Nén Danang's philosophy is its "Conscious Cuisine" and signature "Sto:ry Menus." Chef Summer Le, an acclaimed food blogger turned chef-owner, meticulously crafts tasting menus that are woven with storytelling elements. Each menu delivers a main concept supported by smaller narratives within each course, with a goal to promote kind thoughts and feelings. The restaurant prides itself on using 99% hyper-local ingredients, often sourced directly from its own farm located right in front of the restaurant, ensuring unparalleled freshness and authenticity.

Nén Danang aims to explore the vast potential of Vietnamese ingredients and culture, without resorting to "borrowing" elements from other cuisines. Chef Le believes in the intrinsic strength of Vietnamese flavors, proving that exquisite and beautiful dishes can be created solely from the bounty of Vietnam's land. The menu is regularly tweaked every few months and completely revamped every six months to keep it fresh and exciting, reflecting seasonal produce and new culinary inspirations.

Guests can expect creative Vietnamese dishes that include:

Refined versions of local specialties: Elevating familiar tastes with meticulous techniques and artistic presentation.

Bold creations: Such as complex beef noodle soups with intense, slow-cooked broths, or creatively aged duck dishes.

Unique flavor combinations: Like anchovy sauce paired with pineapple and meat, showcasing unexpected harmonies.

Each dish often comes with a hand-drawn card explaining its inspiration and ingredients, deepening the immersive "story" experience.

Minimalist Ambiance with a Natural Connection
Nén Danang is discreetly tucked away from the main road in a quiet, leafy neighborhood on the Han River. The interior design is modern and minimalistic, with theatrical lighting that sets an intimate and contemplative mood. The serene atmosphere is enhanced by abundant greenery both around and inside the restaurant, fostering a connection with the natural world. This conscious design choice reflects the restaurant's commitment to sustainability and provides a calm oasis away from the city's hustle.

The dining experience is often at a wide counter around the open kitchen, allowing diners to witness the culinary artistry firsthand. This transparent approach, combined with comfortable seating, ensures a relaxed yet engaging environment.

Attentive and Knowledgeable Service
The service at Nén Danang is consistently lauded for being attentive, warm, and highly professional. The staff are well-versed in the intricate details of each "Sto:ry Menu" and its components, eager to explain the inspiration and sourcing behind every dish. They contribute to the restaurant's welcoming vibe, making guests feel at ease and enhancing the overall narrative journey. The focus is on providing a seamless and enriching dining experience, where guests can appreciate the deep passion and precision behind Nén Danang's unique culinary vision.

I ordered food for 4 pax at 7pm but arrived at 6.20 because the guests were hungry and wanted to eat early. I called the restaurant 20 minutes in advance but when I arrived I had to wait until 7.10pm for the food to be served to the guests. The service took a while. The internal food for the driver and the guide was a plate of rice with fried vegetables that were spoiled. The feeling was normal, not as luxurious as the price paid.

You can't imagine the taste just by looking at it.

When was the last time you ate there?

I thought restaurants offering such an incredible experience were only found in big cities like Kuala Lumpur or Bangkok, so I was honestly surprised to find a place like this in Da Nang.

Nen's ambiance, concept, service, and cuisine are all so refined.

Even among Michelin-starred sustainable restaurants, Nen particularly values local production and consumption, and the land and culinary culture of Vietnam. Your journey begins with an aperitif and an explanation of the ingredients used that day.

The dishes, which are all made with Vietnamese ingredients, are based on French cuisine but are unique and have been elevated to Vietnamese cuisine. You'll be surprised and impressed time and time again by the flavors that are beyond your imagination just by looking at them.

While the food descriptions are in English, Japanese descriptions are displayed on every plate, so even those who aren't fluent in English will enjoy themselves.

Spend your last night in Da Nang at Nen, reminiscing on your trip and creating wonderful memories.

We came as a group of four and found ourselves immersed in a unique exploration of Vietnamese flavors. Every dish told a quiet story, highlighting ingredients not usually given center stage, yet each was prepared with care and intention.

What really tied it together was the team at Nen. Their warmth and genuine passion came through in the way they presented each course—not just with knowledge, but with a quiet pride that made the meal feel personal. They gave the whole experience a gentle rhythm, letting us appreciate each moment without overwhelming us.
