This wasn’t just a dinner—it was a calm, thoughtful glimpse into something deeper. We left feeling nourished in every sense.

A fantastic dinner to mark our first visit to Danang, made all the more memorable by the impeccable hospitality of Thö at Nén Restaurant. He provided a thoughtful introduction to the ingredients - fresh from Vietnam, to Vietnam. Looking forward to the next visit. :)

Love the whole concept abs story behind Nen, the emphasis on using local produce and Vietnamese culinary tradition, the intro re all the ingredients to be used for our dishes, highly recommend the herbal pairing, the experience left us satisfied and nourished! Highly recommend!

Definitely on the higher end of the spectrum for price but the experience also falls along that line. Only wish I were someone who can drink so I could enjoy the full “journey” that Summer Le has carefully conjured for visitors.
good service
A place where you can feel the great aroma by making Vietnamese food into fine dining. Other reviews seem so cheap that you might not have any concept of fine dining. It's a choice you won't regret!

Dining at Nén was a memorable experience. From start to finish, it felt less like a meal and more like an carefully curated culinary journey through Vietnam’s rich regional diversity.

Every dish was meticulously prepared and beautifully presented, each with its own unique story. The ingredients were sourced from all over Vietnam, and the team took time to explain the origin and meaning behind them, which made the experience even more special.

You can feel Chef Summer’s passion for gastronomy in every bite. Her dedication to using only authentic Vietnamese ingredients is appreciated.

In a city increasingly crowded with generic street side eateries and quick fixes like Danang, Nén is a rare gem. We more restaurants that celebrate Vietnamese cuisine with this level of artistry, commitment, and respect.

Nén Danang Restaurant is Vietnam’s first-ever Michelin Green Star winner—a fine-dining journey rooted in sustainability and storytelling. Tucked down a quiet lane, this minimalist oasis unfolds a forest-to-table narrative through Chef Summer Le’s innovative tasting menus, built around 99% local ingredients, many sourced from the on-site farm  ￼.

The “Sto:ry Menu” changes every few months, each dish arriving with a hand‑drawn card explaining its inspiration—whether it’s a playful kaleidoscope of textures or a bold nod to regional ingredients  ￼. Standouts include delicate vegetable courses showcasing hyper-local produce and creative takes that balance tradition with avant-garde finesse.

The space is serene and elegant: soft lighting, clean lines, and an intimate energy that complements the thoughtful cuisine  ￼. Wine and sake pairings feel carefully curated, elevating each flavor profile and reinforcing Nén’s philosophy of harmony between dish and drink  ￼.

Pro tip: Book the full “Sto:ry Menu” experience and ask for the wine or sake flight—they really tie the narrative together.

• Vibe: Intimate, minimalist, eco‑luxury
• Price: $$$$ (Sto:ry Menu ~$100 USD)
• Must‑try: Seasonal tasting menu, hyper‑local produce courses, wine & sake pairings
• Accolades: Vietnam’s first Michelin Green Star, farm-to-table pioneer, artistic storytelling
___
Nén Danang Restaurant
16 My Da Tay 2, Khue My, Ngu Hanh Son, Da Nang

#HyperrrLocal #NenDanang #DaNangEats #VietnamFineDining #MichelinGreenStar #SustainableDining #StoryMenu #WhereToEatDaNang #VietnamFoodie #EcoLuxury
Great service and storytelling, waiter really took the time to explain to us the local Vietnamese ingredients in each dishes. Everything was good, dessert was to die for!

Nen deserves more than one Michelin star for it truly is a flag-bearer of Vietnamese cuisine where unfortunately street-food sadly hogs the limelight in everyone’s mind.

It is not very often that one gets the opportunity to eat beautifully crafted Southeast Asian cuisine at this high level, unpretentious and yet very proudly Asian in flavour and taste.

We were so impressed with the variety of local produce showcased in their 9 course ‘Omakase’ meal which is aptly named ‘Nen’s food story journey’.     Ms Summer Le, the owner , should be applauded for formulating such a wonderful menu of taste and discovery highlighting the best of Danang and Vietnam’s culinary heritage.

Her choice of Sakes and wines were spot-on and logical for what would best pair our Southeast Asian spices and produce but an Asian beverage like Sake and Australian wines ,  which have such a good reputation in complementing our Asian palate.

Nen’s service staff, though youthful, were by no means naive.  Their knowledge of the ingredients, the food preparation and how to partake each course should be commended. Unlike other high end places, the waiters particularly Ms Sky , were not ostentatiously
professional  but down-to earth and enthusiastic about their restaurant and food.  It was so refreshing to be served by her.

The highlight of our experience that night was Nen’s house-made  liquor which we found out was made from a local miniature spring onion called ‘Nen’.   It was surprisingly fresh, sweet and tarty. Such a creative streak to make a liquor out of a simple bulb!  It definitely closed the chapter to our wonderful food-journey on a high note.

Thank you Nen , Ms Sky and her team  for making our wedding anniversary a truly memorable occasion!
We will definitely fly back to Danang just to dine when you next change your menu : )

I'm into using local stuff to make inventive dishes, reminds me of Attica in Melbourne.  My meal was good, a few hits and misses, probably just me being picky.

Tonight, I loved:
1. The scallop and rice field crab – a total Vietnamese flavour bomb!
2. The glutinous rice – so much umami, great texture with the mushrooms and scallops.
3. The eel and tofu – I love tofu, but the eels flavour profile was understated, and it was too hot to handle.

The dessert longan honey and starberry was yummy.

It was our first fine dining in Da Neng and we were looking forward to it. The whole experience was not fully terrible but it definitely did not match with its price.

3 friends and I booked the 9-course full experience with alcohol pairing. For myself, only the eel and isopod dishes impressed me. The other dishes really did not perform well like the prawn is overcooked and other dishes were not inspiring.

For the alcohol pairing, they gave us a few sake and also some white wine and red wine. Again they did not taste good just like some random bottles you can find the supermarket. We further checked the bottles to the Internet and some of them were around USD25. The four of us are not experienced person in wine tasting and we were not saying that alcohol with low price tastes poor but wasn’t expecting something in the supermarket will be found in a fine dining restaurant.

Given that the food and beverages are not at their best, we would say the full dining experience is not poor with the stories behind each course and the explanation from Tony.

Cards are provided to us explaining the origin of the ingredients, where the ingredients come from and why are those ingredients are picked. Tony is the staff who served us and he did a very great job on explaining the full story of the 9 courses so that we can fully understand the journey of the dinner. Shoutout to Tony, he is very passionate and considerate person, elevates the whole dining experience to another level.

Overall it was not a 100% poor experience but definitely not a good one. We really appreciates the idea of making the whole dining as a journey. Yet, they are charging us around USD 109 for the 9 courses and USD 68 for the wine pairing. The quality of food and wine needs to have an upgrade, especially with this price in Vietnam.

Probably the top Vietnamese fine dining in DaNang. Definitely worth a 1-star. Seat very comfortably, each table is well spaced; couldn’t hear any conversation from other tables. Have been to other French Michelin recommended restaurants in DaNang, those are really too packed and need to sit near to the main door. Full-Storey experience – all the first 7 courses were amazingly presented and delicious. Ingredients are very thoughtful. Each bite is presented with a note, with full description of the ingredient, method and background. You can eat while reading the card, definitely helps enhancing the overall experience. Personally I love the first sea urchin, Vietnamese Scallop, Y Tendon was a surprise (taste like chopped HK-style 牛筋腩, very elastic and juicy). The Giant isopod was what I was looking forward the whole night. My first time experiencing this seafood, amazingly delicious and definitely load of fun taking picture of the shell. The rice which came along with the beef, so creamy and in perfect texture. Though so full, we asked for refill.

I think the lacking was the dessert. The bottom layer of the jackfruit cake was quite dry, not a lot of flavour. The Longan honey ice-cream was refreshing, however there was a piece of yogurt/jelly at the bottom which was quite hard. I didn’t go for the wine pairing because most of them were sake. Unfortunately the wine menu was quite simple. Not a lot to choose from. I will give a 8.5/10 for Nen. I hope to revisit again later if there is a new menu.
Cheap price but good food quality, I will come back.

I was really excited to try Nen, especially given their reputation for elevated Vietnamese cuisine. While a few dishes stood out and were genuinely well-executed, the overall experience fell short. Many items on the menu felt overly complicated, with too many ingredients and flavors that didn’t come together in a cohesive way. Some flavors were repeated across dishes, and certain components felt like they were added just for the sake of complexity rather than enhancing the dish. Instead of creating a symphony of bold, thoughtful flavors, it often felt muddled and disjointed.

We chose the Full Experience menu with 9 courses.

The first course was a trio of small dishes: sea urchin, mangosteen, and banana rhizome. The sea urchin, served with shrimp roe mousse, was phenomenal, easily one of the highlights of the meal. Unfortunately, the other two items in the trio fell flat. They lacked the same depth of flavor and, more importantly, didn’t feel connected to each other or to the overall theme. The dish felt more like three unrelated ideas on one plate rather than a thoughtfully composed start to the meal.

The second course was a scallop served with fermented coconut and pineapple. I really enjoyed the flavor and concept, but the acidity was a bit too sharp for my taste. A slight adjustment would have made the balance much more enjoyable.

The third dish featured eel fish and tofu. It was just okay, but certainly lacking the “wow” factor I was hoping for. One puzzling element was the addition of sweet potato crackers on top. They were bland and didn’t contribute anything to the flavor or texture of the dish, making them feel unnecessary.

Next came Y tendon and ambarella, which was my favorite dish of the evening. It was incredibly well-executed, with a flavor profile that stood out from the rest, complex, balanced, and memorable.

Unfortunately, the fifth and sixth courses started to blur together. Both dishes leaned heavily on creamy components and, while each had some merit, the repeated flavor profile made the experience feel monotonous. What’s more, they both included a long list of ingredients that didn’t seem to add much value. Instead of enhancing the dishes, the complexity felt forced, like the kitchen was trying to impress with volume rather than cohesion. It left me wondering why the flavors weren’t more thoughtfully restrained and focused.

The final savory course was pheasant with glutinous corn and it was a real miss. The pheasant had a strange taste that clashed with the soursop, creating a very unbalanced dish. The glutinous corn may have been an interesting texture element, but it wasn’t enough to save the dish. Alongside that, they served rice with clams, which was underwhelming and felt disconnected from the rest of the plate. Once again, the lack of cohesion across components made the dish feel confused and unfocused.

As for dessert, it was disappointing. These would be acceptable in a standard dessert café, but in the context of a fine dining tasting menu, they felt basic and uninspired. Honestly, if I were judging just on the dessert, I’d be asking for my money back.

Overall, my experience at Nen was underwhelming, especially given the high expectations set by their reputation for elevated Vietnamese cuisine. While there were a couple of standout moments, like the sea urchin dish and the Y tendon with ambarella, much of the meal felt disjointed, overly complicated, and lacking in cohesion. Several dishes included too many ingredients that didn’t add value, making the complexity feel forced rather than refined. Flavor repetition across courses made parts of the tasting menu feel monotonous, and the desserts fell far short of what you’d expect from a fine dining experience. For the price point and the ambition of the concept, the execution simply didn’t deliver.

I first visited Nen in 2017 and back then my meal wasn’t great, but I very much appreciated the ambition. I was excited to try it again and see how it evolved, but unfortunately I came away very disappointed. Our meal on April 8 was one of the worst fine dining meals I've ever had.

The room is indeed gorgeous and the service was decent, though a bit forced to me. While the food looked the part, with the exception of the scallop and rice patty crab, it just didn't taste good. Throughout the meal, the dishes were tepid and seemed to have been sitting out before being served. Many lacked flavour.

The prawn was overcooked and tasted as if it had been on the counter for an hour. The eel and tofu ‘umami bomb’ was totally undermined by the giant slab of tasteless and too soft tofu. The isopod bisque was bland and watery, never mind the rubbery isopod itself. The corn, with ‘carefully piped’ puree was cold and sad. The cake dessert was burnt and completely unremarkable - you’d get something better at a random bakery. An ice cream dessert was refreshing, but it lacked any sort of flavour and was just watery ice cream.

The wine pairings were also a disappointment. While $80 is not a huge amount for a pairing these days, the pours were minuscule - I’d estimate in the region of half a bottle per person. We had to order beer on top of our pairing. Then, the wines themselves were not very interesting. Four of the eight glasses were sake, which is too many in one pairing and they were not an improvement over serving a wine.

The bill came to $200 per person, but we were given a 10% discount and a bottle of liquor to take away, ostensibly because there was a fly buzzing around at one point in the meal. I overheard them giving a discount to another table across the (near empty) room so I wonder whether the discount is a regular occurrence (for one reason or another).

This was quite simply a terrible meal. The food was bad and I can't help but feel a bit taken advantage of by the wine pairing. Avoid my mistake and go somewhere else.

I rarely give 5 start but here everything was perfect, from the food to the staff.
I loved the cure to details and the really passionate team member always ready to answer questions and to give interesting details.
The food brought us trough Vietnam and the alcohol pairing made me change my mind on sake, a truly incredible experience.
Really recommend!

One of the best choices that I ever made was to come here to have a 9-course and 3h of unforgettable and enjoyable experience 🙏 Thanks to the team: Sky, Louise and a special one to chef Summer 🙏 I’ll definitely recommend Nén to my friends and family!
Exquisite Vietnamese cuisine
beef tendon was my favourite dish of the night. love their alcoholic pairing too with selection of sake and natural wines. service was 5/5

Dinner at Nén, nestled in the heart of Danang, was an absolute revelation. This intimate restaurant offers a sophisticated and innovative tasting menu that celebrates the rich culinary heritage of Vietnam with a modern twist.  From the elegant presentation to the explosion of flavours, every aspect of the dining experience was truly exceptional.

The "Story Menu" at Nén took us on a captivating culinary adventure.  Each dish was a work of art, beautifully presented and bursting with flavour:

Pumpkin Soup with Abalone: The creamy sweetness of the pumpkin soup was perfectly balanced by the delicate flavour of the abalone. The presentation, with the abalone shells artfully arranged around the soup, was visually stunning.
Tomato Soup with Crab: A vibrant and flavourful soup that showcased the freshness of the ingredients.
Compressed Watermelon with Tomato Consommé: The refreshing sweetness of the watermelon was beautifully enhanced by the savoury tomato consommé.
Da Nang Sky: Inspired by the Danang sky, this dessert was a light and refreshing end to the meal. The description card explained the dish's inspiration, adding a poetic touch to the experience.  The combination of textures and the subtle sweetness was a perfect finale.

Nén is a true gem, a must-visit for any food lover traveling to Danang.  Chef Summer Le's culinary creativity and passion for Vietnamese cuisine shine through in every dish.  I highly recommend indulging in the "Story Menu" for a truly unforgettable dining experience.
Turned onto this by the Michelin guide. Great experience throughout. Highly rec.

Perfect and astonishing. I loved many things about this restaurant but perhaps most appreciated the deep context, education and engagement with the ingredients and technique that make Vietnam’s central highlands so unique. I’ve had a lot of great food on this trip but felt like this help me make sense of it all within a bigger picture. The execution and service were flawless, to be sure, but I’m also leaving happier and smarter than I entered.

Too often, tasting menus are abstractions or exercises in self-indulgence. Nen, though, is rooted in something deeper and more emotional. It’s among the most Millennial Michelin experiences I can imagine. Two stars within three years. So thankful for my night in Da Nang.
Complex and brilliant. Exceptional, surprising and impressive alcohol pairing. An absolute must visit if in Da Nang. Thank you for having us.

Even as a native Viet, the experience still surprised me from the use of local ingredients that I did not know about while sometimes recreating familiar flavors. I rated the food 4 stars because there were some menu items, such as the eggshell noodle and isopod, that I felt like were forced attempts to incorporate really niche ingredients. Nonetheless, the staff were incredible and most of the menu were unique flavor bombs. The staff also gifted us with an amazing tiramisu for our birthday and a bottle of their own liquor to take home.

Oh what a journey indeed in this Michelin green star in Danang. The menu tells a delightful and scrumptious story of the local ingredients of central Vietnam. Almost all the ingredients are sourced locally and even grown in their own garden.

A personal first for me to savour Giant Isopod (tastes like a cross between lobster and shrimp?), the Y beef tendon (from the knees... Delightfully chewy like beefy mochi) and glutinous corn (the dish tastes like risotto with a sweet corn flavour).

Especially enjoyed how they introduced the ingredients at the start of the meal. A lovely dining experience and definitely recommended. I was in such a food coma at the end of it that I only realised on my way back that I forgot to add a tip to my total for the splendid service by the Nen team. If you guys are reading this, my utmost apologies...

I loved the experience and food but knocked off a star because I had reserved well in advance for an experience that wasn’t available when I arrived. The staff were all great and food was delicious. I have been wanting to come here for a long time and am happy I did. The flavors and textures were complex and the eggshell noodles were very unique. Thoroughly enjoyed
Amazing experience.

Best meal I've ever had, no exaggeration. We had story meal number 0 and it was phenomenal from start to finish. Pairing the food with the alcohol pairing was a real treat; I got to try things I never would have been able to try otherwise. We had 1 person who had a food allergy. They were more than happy to accommodate us, and it did not detract from the experience at all. Would come back in a heartbeat!
The food is delicious, beautifully decorated, good service, good manners. However, I don't like the crushed eggshells.
Nice ambience, creative dishes and friendly staffs

Very unique  and so memorable restaurant.
Great chef.

Our visit to Nen was wonderful from beginning to end.  They took excellent care of us and our children. I cannot thank the staff enough for their care of my children/family.  We frequent Michelin restaurants and this was on par!  The food was an excellent take on Vietnamese cuisine.  Most dishes contain shellfish so if you have allergies, you will likely need to choose vegan unless the menu changes. One person in our party did the vegan option and enjoyed every dish!  With a few more touches (focusing on textures, ease of consumption, timing, and variety), this restaurant will surely earn its own Michelin star.  Price was on point for the service provided.  Would definitely go again! ❤️❤️❤️
Meticulously crafted menu, creative use of local ingredients, artfully presented, and exceptional service. We enjoyed the ‘Journey’ experience tremendously. Highly recommended. A must try in Danang.

From the moment you step into this restaurant, you’re welcomed with warmth and hospitality, starting with a lovely drink in the foyer. The staff are incredibly polite and attentive, making you feel at home right away.

The atmosphere is beautifully designed, creating a perfect setting for an exceptional dining experience. The introduction to the ingredients and their use adds a thoughtful touch, making each dish even more special.

The cuisine itself is nothing short of incredible—artfully presented, full of creativity, and with an extraordinary combination of flavors. Every plate is a masterpiece, showcasing attention to the finest details.

Service is impeccable, with every aspect carefully considered to ensure an unforgettable experience. If you appreciate innovative Vietnamese cuisine with a refined touch, this place is an absolute must-visit.

This was the best fine dining experience we have had in Vietnam so far. The staff was specially trained to give a great service. Food is always a personal experience, but everything felt superb. We tried the vegetarian menu, which was also great. We will be coming back and recommending the place to our inner circle.
ok

My partner and I sat for a “Sto-ry Menu #4 Origins - Ve Nha” dinner in December of 2024. The chef’s menu concept was thoughtful and left a nice personal touch to the overall dining experience. The staff was attentive and professional, though it lacked the Michelin level of professionalism. For example, on my way back from the toilet to my table I passed by a hall staff that was crouching on the ground taking a break - in the customer area. Not noteworthy outside of a Michelin experience but it felt out of place here. Unfortunately 2 of the 9 course dishes tastes also fell flat for us - to a point where my partner did not want to finish it (the smoked coconut water). It was a memorable experience but not sure we would make it back. I wish the restaurant all the best in the future!

Modern dining by a female Vietnamese chef using Vietnamese ingredients. It is of a very high standard even by international standards. It is a little far from the city, but it is only a quick Grab ride away. Presentation, service, and taste are all top-notch. If you're a gourmet, this is a must-go.

I came with my girlfriend because it was my birthday, but I was disappointed.
The first wet towel is not good. The smell is very unpleasant.
The staff said there were no spines in the fish, but when I was eating them, the spines came out and I wondered why I should eat this at this price. The staff explained each dish, but my breath was so bad that I lost my appetite. We were eating and tried to clear the plate. It was my first time at a Michelin restaurant, but I don't think I would ever go to another Michelin restaurant if it had the same taste and service.

Amazing experience
I was very well taken care of by the host and staffs
Very good

Great and memorable experience. A must visit if you come to Danang

I came on my birthday. They prepared me a cake and a present which are very nice of them.

Thank you to the amazing and professional team at Nen Da Nang for taking us on a culinary journey of the local Vietnamese culture.
My partner and I both dined on the vegetarian set menu (9 dishes + complimentary palette cleansers + tea/coffee).
We were both very impressed with the meticulous level of care, thought, innovation and love that went into each dish and the story that was intended to be conveyed. We especially enjoyed the waiter taking us through all the core ingredients and the meaning behind each dish.
We loved everything, especially the desserts. Nen definitely exceeded our expectations of what a Green Michelin Starred restaurant should be and we cannot wait to come back and dine again in the future.
Thank you once again to the team at Nen Danang!

We had an excellent dining experience at the restaurant and tried the "Origin" Story Menu. The food was outstanding, and the dinner was delightful overall. It truly was a memorable and enjoyable evening.

Sto:ry Menu - Origins (Về nhà)
A tasting menu woven with storytelling elements
8.3.2024

The service, food, and presentation were all perfect. The menus and explanations were provided in Japanese, so I felt at ease.
(By the way, it was a surprising area to be in...lol)

We started with a welcome drink, and they confirmed the course menu and drinks (thanks for their flexibility, even though we were late!).

We were then taken to a separate room for a presentation of the day's ingredients, highlighting their focus on local ingredients.
Each dish was accompanied by a hand-drawn explanation card, and the chef occasionally used Japanese to provide personalized explanations to maximize our enjoyment.
The pairings were a mix of wine and sake, and with each dish, I was worried I might get too drunk, but everything was so delicious that I ate it all up in no time! (lol)

The signature dishes for all three meals required the use of cilantro, and since my partner doesn't like it, they prepared something like beef tendon curry, which was also absolutely delicious.
I was able to enjoy food of a higher level than Japanese Michelin restaurants at a reasonable price, and it was one of the best memories of my trip. 
I'll be recommending it to everyone when I get back home!

This is a very interesting fusion restaurant. It reminded me of the now-defunct Gaggan, Asia's No. 1 restaurant in Bangkok. In fact, one of the dishes is the same.
The chef, who studied Japanese cuisine, prepares creative dishes, so you can pair them with Japanese sake. The dishes are very sophisticated and rich, but the flavors were a bit off. I enjoyed the jellyfish dish and understood the theme. The other dishes, while I understand the theme, would have tasted better if they had incorporated Japanese dashi broth. Indeed, Gaggan is a fusion of Indian, Japanese, and Thai cuisine, and I remember enjoying the flavors and textures more than the food itself. If you visit with the expectation of a fusion cuisine on another level, you'll probably enjoy it. However, be aware that the prices are quite high.
Dr. Goryainova, recommends 🙌

We Went there for the 7 Course menu and the wine pairing. It was not having dinner, it was an absolute stunning experience. The stories to every single course were wonderful. The tastes of all courses were extraordinary. At the end we payed 7.000.000 dong but in our opinion it was completely worth it and we will visit nen again
Expensive and unpalatable. I don't feel full.

The food was omg awful, expensive and awful
I attached pictures specially. It was really awful. I felt really bad after eating it. I was very disappointed because it was really awful. I didn’t know what I was eating. Two people spent over 8 million. Money is not a problem. The point is that it is not cheap. It was also awful.

What an unusually elegant, focused on high-quality ingredients this place is for Danang. The course consisted of numerous dishes that were beautifully presented including an information card for each one of them. The chef and the team do their best in bringing locally sourced ingredients in the most eloquent way on your plate. We enjoyed every dish. Keep it up!
The food in my opinion was ok nothing special. Tried the 8 course tasting menu. But the service was very good and nice. Nice atmosphere. Good place if you are going on a date.

It was a culinary experience that I was not expecting. Everything was so unique and flavourful. It was a play on my tastebud and senses.

Truly blessed to have the opportunity to dine here.

We were in the private founder's room which was a pleasure to be at. Our server was meticulous and attentive.

The alcohol pairings wasn't really my cup of tea. Some were good, but it was a bit too much for me.

Overall though, I had so many mind-blowing bites of food that it was still way better than I had anticipated. Would come again to try the other tasting menus because if they are as good as this one, I know I am in for a treat!

The only Michelin Green star in Vietnam. The executive chef Summer Le has put an effort on creating the menu by using hyper-local ingredients. It’s nice to experience how the chef putting ingredients together and you can taste all the of ingredients in the dish. We have the menu #4 on that day.

One thing that I would comment is that the kitchen staff are a bit too loud. My wife and I could hear them talking from the dining area (we even sit at the furthest table from the kitchen).

This is one of the best food experiences, we have ever had. The story and presentation was done with such beauty and mindfulness using local and traditional food sources and, at the same time, being innovative when emphasizing the experience in taste and smell.

Recently visited this restaurant for my birthday on our first day in Da Nang and although I didn’t have high expectations, I was utterly disappointed with the food especially for the price point which is high even for the states. I’m genuinely confused with the high reviews this place has gotten. It started off strong with the aperitif and the whole staff was just so sweet. However, everything progressively went downhill with every new dish we got. I enjoyed the drink pairing more than the food itself and that’s saying a lot because I usually don’t even like to drink. It felt as if the chef brought a bunch of ingredients together, displayed beautifully in small portions, paired it with a story and slapped a “Michelin selected” price tag on it. I hate to give this place a 1 star (which is rare for me) and especially since the staff is so nice, but I’d like to see them do better or maybe not charge an outrageous price for mediocre food. Save your money as you’ll likely get a better meal for a 10th of the price in Da Nang.

I'm just so impressed by the amazing food, space, and customer service...✨

This is exactly what makes me smile...

This is my second time visiting this store.
I can't forget the excitement I felt when I first came, and I will definitely come again!! ️, and I did what I said.

Not only am I happy to be here again, but even though last time was so moving, I think this time it will be even better. I was even more impressed.

First of all, the staff at the store remembered me from the last time I was there 😭
And just by looking at the accessories...
I was really happy 🍀

Each dish is carefully explained with illustrations written on paper.
Moreover, he immediately noticed that I was Japanese and even brought me a paper in Japanese🙏🏻

The taste is indescribable, and I can't convey my excitement until I actually taste it.

The aroma and taste of Da Nang's mysterious ingredients were carefully extracted, and I could feel the detailed work with my tongue.

It's so delicious I have no words 😭

I want everyone to experience this excitement.
I sincerely agree.

And the space is also wonderful.
I have never seen a restaurant with simple walls painted entirely in black.
The lighting is just right, the tables and chairs are made of wood, and even the napkins are carefully selected.

Even people who don't usually take photos will be tempted to press the camera shutter.

And finally,
I had my hair down, and the moment the store staff saw me trying to tie it up, they brought me a hair tie...
How much care do you give...

I was moved by every scene.

I don't want to touch on it too much, but there are people who are intentionally lowering the store's reputation with obvious throwaway accounts.
It's all a lie so don't believe it.
Harassment can happen anytime, anywhere, so it can't be helped.

I highly recommend this store to everyone.

I think it's worth coming to Da Nang just to visit this shop.

Thank you very much for the wonderful time 😊
I will definitely come again 🩷

from Miumiu

Avoid, not Compress
Red tilapia with honey wax, tiny sea beetles, "mini" abalone noodles. What's wrong :))))) I don't understand that they use beautiful words to describe what the food does when the most basic thing is that the customers who use it get a full and delicious meal, but they don't ☺️

We absolutely loved our experience at Nen! Our waiter was super nice and he explained every dish well. The food was delicious and the portions were good (not too big, but not small).

The ONE complaint and hopefully something they can fix in the future. The restaurant is gorgeous. Very beautiful lighting and architecture. The toilet paper holder (men's toilet) is a hideous, industrial one. It is one minor thing, but it really stood out. Hopefully it is only temporary and a better looking one has been installed.

If you are a fan of fine dining, the Storybook Menu is a must-do experience in Danang. It was such an educational, enriching, and intimate journey through Vietnam's history and culture and the vision of the chef and owner.

The innovative dishes all highlighted different aspects of what it means to be Vietnamese and celebrated the local flavors and traditional dishes in a beautiful way. I was so moved by the presentation and the stories shared.

The waiters at Nen are very cute and attentive. When it comes to the food, I find that for the price I paid, it's really worth it for me. I'm Vietnamese myself and know a little about cooking, so I was very impressed with the unique combination. I didn't post pictures of the dishes because I hope you guys can explore them ☺️ and it was a very interesting experience, thank you very much, Comen. Will definitely come back ☺️

Thanks to my wife, i became a frequent fine diner. This very experience in Nen was surprising. I like how the restaurant challenged me on the taste of food in fine dining experience. Normally you would expect good looking food that also …

As a Vietnamese, this is the first time I have seen such "strange" Vietnamese food. Cultural elements from the past are expressed by the chef through the food in a very unique way. The staff is very nice and has a good manner. I will come back for the new menu.
Journey getting know more about Vietnamese ingredients. Informations from staff is enjoyable

Excellent food!
I hope more people know about this place.
The worst fine dining I have experienced ever. Sorry but the food tasted really bad.

Intrigue dining experience. We tried the Story Menu 4, each dish comes with a story about vietnam which is indeed interesting and unique. We didn’t like the food as much though. In our view, there l too much focus on creating a linkage to …

I recently visited Nen Restaurant in Da Nang, lured by its reputation for a sophisticated dining experience. The atmosphere is indeed something to behold, with a thoughtful renovation lending the space an air of elegance and style. The presentation of the dishes is immaculate, and the menu is a collection of well-designed names that promise a culinary adventure.

However, it is with a heavy heart that I must report that the substance of the meal did not live up to its stylish wrapping. The ambition to create a fancy and attractive setting seems to have overshadowed the most crucial aspect of a dining establishment – the food itself. Each dish, though visually appealing, was a gastronomic disappointment. The flavors were indistinct and monotonous, with none of the vibrancy or depth that one would expect from a restaurant of such purported caliber. The ingredients seemed to lose their individuality, merging into a singular, unremarkable taste with no layers or complexity to savor.

A restaurant's soul is its cuisine, and no amount of atmospheric charm or menu creativity can compensate for culinary execution that fails to deliver. I would urge the chef and the management at Nen Restaurant to realign their focus on the essence of their establishment: the food. Only then will the beautiful shell of the restaurant find its pearl. As it stands, the pursuit of style over substance leaves a diner feeling underwhelmed and longing for a meal where the flavors are as compelling as the presentation.

A fun take on Vietnamese cuisine using local ingredients. Each dish was served with a hand-drawn card denoting the main ingredients. My favorite was “The Paper”, duck pate & grilled eel sandwiched between “Dó” paper made of a local green.

The price was definitely on the high side, and the AC was a bit lacking, but the overall experience is worth a visit if you happen to visit Da Nang and craving for something fancy.
This place is absolutely amazing. Foods are wonderful and the stories behind it are even more inspiring. Serve was also unmatchable. Highly recommend this place. 11/10
10/10 the best fine dining experience I’ve ever had. All dishes were so good and reminded me of home! Would definitely come back

Had an amazing experience, thank you.
The food and story behind it is such a great opportunity to learn a bit of Vietnamese culture.

Such a unique and beautiful fine dining experience. We enjoyed the full menu with the wine pairing. I love Nen’s story and Summer’s journey to how this place came to be. Appreciated the efforts to highlight the local food and drinks of Vietnam. Highly recommend this experience, especially for those who appreciate F&B. Best souvenir I had from Da Nang was this experience and the menu cards I took from this meal!

Definitely one of the best restaurants I’ve visited among many cities. Food were very creative with impressive presentation way. Of course also very delicious. Wine paring has included sake options, which is seldom to see. I was surprised about how professional the staff has been trained, our waitress Camille explained us every story and material, also our questions to local culture in perfect English. I don’t think it’s easy to find the same level in other place. It was a wonderful night and experience. Would like to visit them again!
total disaster and thank you to ruin my valentine's day

Do they impose culinary ideology on people? Vietnamese food? Are not ! I'm sorry that's not Vietnamese food? they go overboard in their culinary ideology, and everyone is forced to follow...
I ate a red tilapia fish dish cooked with beeswax? some sea beetle meat or something... Oh! I felt really disappointed because the taste really wasn't good, the wait was too long, my friend fell asleep... and the price wasn't cheap.
A great "journey" about Vietnamese ingredients
Absolutely fantastic food & service!

The comment below by ㄱㅅ is exactly right. I get that it's experimental, but it's tasteless. It's strictly Vietnamese dining, and there are quite a few local flavors. The main dish, fan shrimp, was served in a 1/15th of the size, and the main dish, abalone, was served in the amount of abalone you'd find in convenience store abalone porridge. The duck dish had the tendons intact, so it wasn't cut or chewy. I told them it was too tough, so I followed the recipe and they said they'd cut it up for me if I needed it. Just eat whatever they give you, no one cares. The restaurant I paid 7.3 million dong for two didn't even pour me wine. I poured it all myself, like I was pouring soju. They showed me how to cook it, and then spilled wax on the table, scraping it off, causing a huge fuss. This restaurant is a great option for most restaurants in Da Nang. Don't be overly curious, and I highly recommend going somewhere else. It's Vietnamese cuisine presented beautifully, so it's a novel approach for locals, but for foreigners, it's tasteless. It's a Korean fusion restaurant, but it's not my style. It's like putting ketchup on a kimchi stew that's exactly the size of a restaurant. I'm a Korean resident, and if someone were to go there, I'd do my best to dissuade them. I couldn't understand why neither the manager nor the chef asked why they left so much food behind. I have no ill feelings toward the restaurant, and this review comes from the heart.

My husband and I had dinner. The service was beyond praise. Service, atmosphere, presentation of dishes - 10/10 👏🏼 A very interesting experience! However, I have to take off one star because, having chosen the most expensive set of dishes, I couldn’t even eat some of the dishes. Some of the dishes were great! But, for example, one of the dishes was beef knee cartilage in sauce. I understand that everyone has their own taste, of course. But such a “masterpiece” is absolutely not for me. Or, for example, the duck. It looked delicious, I love duck, but I chewed it for a very long time, and still couldn’t chew it. We paid about 5 million for dinner. For the sake of new emotions and combinations of flavors - it’s definitely worth coming. But next time I would go to a similar place in Bangkok, for example. I wish the guys prosperity and new interesting ideas!

about 4,000,000 pp including 8 courses full journey, service charge and tax.
Very good experiences and appreciate that the founder team has made so much efforts on the menu and the way how they put all ingredients together with well demonstrated storytelling, taking us into a wonderful food tour all around Asia. So lucky that they’ve cut the loss and survived in the last three years.

I'm pretty mixed about this restaurant.  We had the 5 course meal, with one vegetarian, and it threw off the pacing of the meal and took about 3 hours for some reason.

Also some of the deconstructed items were very odd, like a mi quang dish being presented as a rice noodle pasta dish.

Generally speaking, wasn't in love compositionally with the tasting menu, but I had bigger issues with the amount of time it took us to get through the meal.
This kind of price for this kind of dining is ridiculous. The best.
It was great to spend a special day here and have a meaningful gift, hope to accompany each other on the menus for future shopping experiences.. love it❤️

This restaurant should be called Ne
The food is too ordinary compared to the price paid
This is a restaurant that brings happiness through a unique experience.

A different experience vs other high end dining experiences we’ve had in Vietnam/else where — more experimental and had more local ingredients/flavors. Might not be the most filling for some, but we found it totally fine. Highly recommend!

Good food with innovative ideas. Had the #0 journey full experience, liked almost every single dish of it. Could be a bit overwhelming for someone who’s not used to Asian food as some of the ingredients are quite bold / unique, but the flavors were all in good harmony to me.
Also, go chef Summer! As a girl :)
Wonderful

Too disappointing.

I respect your desire to honor Vietnamese cuisine.

No matter how advanced your cooking techniques are, the most original purpose of the dish is to be full and delicious, and you have completely failed.

Not to mention that with a price of more than 2 million, the ingredients and quantity of food you serve are too disrespectful to the diners.

And it is also difficult to understand with those ingredients and prices, who are you serving?

Honestly, the quality of the food is too mediocre compared to Japanese and European restaurants in Da Nang with even lower costs.

Nen is back in Da Nang and it’s great to see this worthy addition to the hospitality scene here.

For a special occasion or just a good meal, Nen’s fare surpasses a lot of fine dining in the country as each dish throughout the meal is part of a story. No wonder their sister restaurant in Saigon was anointed the Michelin Select rating, saying “hey it’s good … you might just want to check it out.”

Since Da Nang is small, you definitely should check the one out. Congrats on the reopening.

I booked Nen right after seeing it reopen, and it didn't disappoint. I've tried several fine restaurants in Da Nang, but Nen's was the most comfortable and satisfying. Enjoying food with a story to tell, each piece is like a work of art, making for an unforgettable evening. See you soon. 🤩

Absolutely delicious course menu. The tastes were so complex and technically executed. The ingredients were used to perfection and the technique was exquisite. I was particularly worried about how the "bee larvae" mousse was going to taste, but it ended up being one of the most delicious items on this menu. The menu changes every 3 months, so you'll always get something exciting and new. The setting was very romantic, and we basically had the whole restaurant to ourselves. Their wine selection was delicious and their staff was knowledgeable, professional, and attentive. I highly recommend this restaurant for a nice night out with friends, family, or a romantic date. Price very reasonable for the quality of food!
Must do visit: very impressivce

I can honestly say that this is hands down Danangs best restaurant. It may even be Vietnam's best. Certainly of the restaurants I've been to. The most delicious (modern) Vietnamese food I've ever tasted, Perfect Ambiance, Amazing Service, Solid wine list and unbelievable value. Get there RIGHT NOW!!!
Great food, great service. Well worth the price and the experience. Dishes were truly different and delicious.. not just fancy looking!
Nice place, nice people
Amazing gastronomic dining in Da Nang. A full set of culinary experience about Vietnam fusion cuisine. Definitely worth the price.
Good restaurant, the duck was a little chewy but the seafood was excellent
Nice one in Danang, and I definitely will back again !!

Good romantic dinner place where the chef put a spin on authentic Vietnamese food. The Tré (fermented pork) and stuffed snails are amazing. The rest i feel they overtried a bit and things could have been done more simply (i guess it's easy to fall into the trap of fine dining complexity). Having said that, one of the most decent food experience that's worth checking out.
Interesting experience but a bit pricey.
Very good Vietnamese food
tasty

Had a fantastic dinner here a couple of days ago. We got to taste things I can't possible imagine where else to try, with great service, fine dining quality, and at a very reasonable price (at least for a Swede). If you're curious about food, this is a must when in Da Nang. We learned a great deal about practices and ingredients from our waitress. Stuff that broadens the mind, really. For those anxious about fine dining not filling you up, at least this 75 kg man got plenty of grub and drink. You won't be rolling like a barrel out the door, but is that really preferable? Plus; in the unlikely case of you leaving hungry, there's about a thousand great exotic restaurants within reach that'll fill you up for 1,5 USD... 5/5, would eat there again!
Average taste, good environment, relatively remote

We visited there for my daddy’s birthday.
I ordered the special cake before the Vietnam stay. Thanks to English fluent staff, we totally enjoyed the food and atmosphere!
(Unfortunately we were already full before the cake, so we brought back to the hotel and enjoyed it:)) thank you for the cute chocolate <3

I will strongly recommend this restaurant for special occasion:)
Great food. Great take on viet food. Great service
Luxurious, quiet restaurant
Incredibly unique, exciting food, high end Vietnamese, tasting menu only.

I went here with my partner a few days ago. It was a great experience! We ordered the five course meal with a bottle of wine. The highlight for both of us was the crab bisque.

The food was incredibly unique and a delicious take on Vietnamese cuisine. The staff was very friendly and knowledgeable and the ambiance was great.

I would definitely recommend this restaurant to someone who is looking for a delicious and unique fine dining experience!

We made a reservation for dinner via OpenTable, and came a long way only to be greeted by a closed gate when we arrived. The sign on the gate said that the restaurant had closed for the day for urgent maintenance. We were extremely disappointed that we were not informed despite making a reservation two days in advance. Better service would have been expected from a fine dining restaurant like Nen.

NYE 2019 dinner. Would have been a solid four star but rounding down because of service.

What a great way to welcome 2020! Some excellent distillations of Vietnamese flavors for about 3/4 of the degustation, hats off to the chef. Unexpected cuisine in Danang!

Sommelier was the weak point. Didn’t engage us enough to ask which wines and vintages we’d enjoyed in the past in order to guide us to the most suited wines for our palates and for the flavors of the menu. When the wine list is limited, we’ve found that more highly skilled sommeliers are needed and attitude in place of actual knowledge and service skill is a definite turn off.
The price is a bit too high. Not very cost-effective.
Had the vegetarian degustation. Creative and innovative menu executed to a high standard.

great experience. amazing food and great service. a bit overpriced, but the food was amazing. definitley unique, but not 100% sure if this was truly authetic vietnamese food, but would recommend if you want a fancy, advanced meal.

A Vietnamese creative cuisine worth a try
The only dish that was ordinary was the bird's nest
The cinnamon ice cream was very creative, but the garlic oil on top was too strong, which slightly ruined it
Overall, it is highly recommended.
I will try it again next time I go to Da Nang

It is a late review but as i have just thought about this place it reminded me to write a review because it was such a highlight in 2019 for me.
I have celebrated my birthday with my loved ones at Nen restaurant for dinner , and it couldn’t have been more perfect than it was on that day.
We have arrived in the evening and they even put my name on the table on a cute card and wrote a nice text for my birthday.
The food was incredible honestly, every course had been spectacular and was so well thought. Even though in the beginning i wasn’t fond of everything i had read on the menu, everything i ate was brilliant !
In the end, they even gifted me their homemade chocolate as a little present and we took some nice polaroids.
The service was outstanding and very very attentive and they always checked on us i really loved the atmosphere. The restaurant is beautiful in general, a little bit dark but it suited the experience.

All in all very harmonic and detailed from the beginning to the end.
I would recommend to whomever is reading, to definitely stop by Nen restaurant ! Especially for that price and that excellent quality of culinary experience.
Ok great food

Great culinary experience, unique in this area. Seemed like each dish had it's part in the story, nicely combining lots of ingredients and flavors.

Staff & the chef were super nice, she came by and told us a bit about the restaurant, which is now a bit more than 2 yrs old.
from Hong Kong highly recommend this restaurant to have a very romantic atmosphere ..... very nice wine pairing 8 sets only1,350,000

The cheapest course meal for three people was 190,000 won.
Considering the cost of living in Vietnam, the price is ridiculous and the food is really disturbing for the price.
I can't trust the reviews of Da Nang restaurants anywhere.
Very cool !!😀😀😀😀 …
Fantastic service and innovative menu that really captures Vietnamese flavors using modern technique.
Food is nice here. Will come back.

It branded itself as fine dining, and definitely charged as such. For that amount, you will get a secluded dining place away from the huzz and buzz of city center, and two hours of pretentious fine dining that were served in portion so small that you will have go for second round at the night market far away. The taste is nothing surprising, and the wine pairing is chaotic (soup with zinfandel?). Overall, an expensive experience but none of the indulgence of fine dining.

Very nice fusion cuisine in Da Nang  but not suitable for children cause the place is quiet and they only have testing menu the price is high but the food is absolutely delicious is good for anniversary or celebrate
Very good

The food is great and service is impeccable. However, I feel it over did the dishes for palate cleansing - too strong flavours that defeat the purpose of these bits between dishes. The wine selection seems to be more from south hemisphere.
Thank for the excellent food, service and making the birthday event a memorable one for my wife.

Fantastic dining experience! They served Vietnamese French cuisine. We had the tasting menu with wine pairing, the presentation of the dishes were simple and nice. The whole menu tasted great and the satay duck breast was my favourite. The …
It's great, good food, beautiful decoration. Service staff is enthusiastic and attentive. I had a truly memorable birthday party here. Thanks so much
good service! i'll visit here again and again!!!
Totally satisfied with the food journey. Took our group 2.5 hours to go through the journey. We were happy! Thank you. Keep up the good work. …
Excellent food with good presentation.  Service is also amazing good. I would definitely go back there again.

It's in such a quiet place that you'll wonder if it's really in a place like this in Da Nang, Vietnam. It's not in a busy area lined with hotels, so we were able to dine in peace. As you'd expect from a famous restaurant, all the food was excellent and a feast for the eyes and the taste.
And best of all, the staff were very friendly and explained things carefully and slowly so that I, who can only understand broken English, could understand. We had our children with us, but we had no problems at all and had a wonderful time. My favorite part of the course was the main dessert, a plate of ginger ice cream and tofu pudding.
a little overpriced for what it was

A great experience at this fine dining Vietnamese fusion restaurant.

We made reservation with the online reservation system.

We ordered a 5 courses menu tonight. The food is delicious and the portion is just about right.

Some appetizers were provided between each courses.

Personally, I like the beef stew soup and duck breasts a lot.

Kids menu is also available. My daughter ordered a very nice BBQ chicken wing.

If you would like to find a Vietnamese fine dining in Da Nang, this is a must place to go. You can enjoy a decent dinner with a choice of 5-course or 8- course. And it serves vegetarian-course too. Those dishes and little treats between each dishes are delicious! (I don’t wanna share photos of dishes, this restaurant will give you surprise.)
Very good experience, 5 and 8 degree dishes, after trying them, we feel that we must choose 8 degree Lai! Delicious, affordable, and great service! 👍👍😋😋 …
Fantastic restaurant! Great staff and proffesional. Food was excellent !!
Very good

A restaurant with sincerity and creativity, offering a pleasant atmosphere, high-quality food, and excellent value. They utilize authentic Vietnamese ingredients and incorporate French cooking techniques. They offer the same high-quality food.

Men's social studies tour to Da Nang
NEN made a reservation.
I didn't feel so reserved.
It's located in a back alley, so I had a hard time finding a taxi. Please show this Google Map to the driver!

To put it simply, I think NEN has good taste ^_^

The entrance and interior are also modern.

The food was very attentive and I got a mouthful of food in between the 5 dishes.

It was quite a volume.

The store staff greeted me with a smile, so it was easy to spend time there.

The price was 6000 yen including one bottle of white wine for three people.
I felt that the cost performance was good!

Recommended for anyone going to Da Nang!

Amazing... Went for the 8 course menu which brought us through a wonderful journey of exquisitely crafted Vietnamese cuisine. Interesting palate cleansers were served every 2 dishes. Every dish did not disappoint, with unique flavours that came together so well. Plating was beautiful to a point that I had to stop and pause to admire before tucking in. Chef notes were provided as well, wonderfully written. I particularly enjoyed the poem for the dessert, which by the way was particularly spectacular as it looked like a stone but tasted nothing like one. ♥️ Service was really good. Linh our server was so thorough in her introduction of each dish that made us look forward to each one. Nen will be part of any trip to Danang for me henceforth. Thank you, Nen.
The food is a bit salty for me, otherwise it's ok.
The food is beautifully decorated but the amount of food is too little, it is located on a route that is difficult to find, the Taxi driver has run many routes making me pay a lot to the driver.

First time I go to a gastronomical restaurant and I have to say that the experience is memorable. Very good staff giving you explanation about the taste-science behind the food if you want to, and the cuisine itself was also amazing. Can't really assess the pricing since I have no means of comparison.
Great experience, recommended place to enjoy a pleasant evening.
Tasty

Nen offers a choice of a five course, 8 course set menu for both vegetarians and non-vegetarians. I had both the eight course set while my wife had the five course set. There isn’t complete overlap between the two so I was able to try a lot of different dishes.  In between the courses you will also receive palate cleansers, an amuse bouche, and other small tastes. So be prepared to spend anywhere between 2- 2.5 hours for your meal.  The meal is really a good bargain at 893k and 1,380k for the five course and eight course respectively. I definitely would recommend coming here if you want to enjoy a nice meal while in Danang.

Food: 4.25 stars
Service/environment: 4.5 stars
Value: 4.5 stars
Overall: 4.25 stars

If you have the time I would go for the 8 course set. The courses aren’t more tapas portions and I would have not been full with the five course set (I eat a lot).

My favorites of the evening:

Bo Kuo (beef stew) - To me this was the best tasting dish of the evening. Extremely clean broth that reminds my a bit of Taiwanese beef noodles soup with the star anise and five spice flavor really prominent here.
Mi Quang - The noodle dish is a staple of Da nang. I’m no expert on Mi Quang but I did really enjoy this version. This had a nice balance between the brininess of the clams with the pesto noodles. It was also really fun mixing this dish together.
Cockle with fermented sea urchin noodles- I really enjoyed the grilled conch. It had a nice textural contrast to the softness of the noodles.  The noodles themselves tasted good but I wish I got more richness from the sea urchin. That luxurious creaminess from the sea urchin would have really made this great and would probably put this over the beef stew as my favorite.
My grandma doesn't like Western food, but she always praises this place.
bery good
The food was nice but a bit too expensive comparing to other restaurants in Vietnam

The food tasted good 😋
The restaurant had some issues. We ordered six meals, but each appetizer only gave us three, and the waiter told us to share. 😲😲
We complained to the assistant manager, but he didn't address the issue. Does this affect the diners' mood? 😫😫😫
Excellent dining experience, amazing service and food. It isn't cheap by Vietnam standards, but it's still a good deal that would probably cost more than 2x as much anywhere else. Highly recommended.
Great experience and thank you Linh for the service
Excellent

Don’t label as a fine dining when your service is not up to the standard. Our first time in Nen restaurant was on the 17 Feb 2019. Prior to booking I requested a special occasion I didn’t accept the kind offer which cost extra for our special occasion, however I expect at least a greeting for our date but nothing happened. First step into the restaurant was cozy and quiet atmosphere. The guy with Blue shirt (seems like a  manager) greeting us informally by straight into the options of the menu without explaining and introduction.
We both selected the New Vietnamese menu as we appreciated the chefs effort but starting with 2 complimentary drinks that was to strong and has a burning taste that stuck to your through top with very salty apple skewers it ruined the palate and caused a very unpleasant amuse-bouche. Part 2 from the menu, the quail dish overall was too salty and the fried quail taste like KFC. Part 3, smoke braised fish dish was a failure to me because the rice was very dry like a hockey puck with a wilted spring onion and the fish and the sauce was very salty. The only best thing about this dish was the quail egg and the  homemade pickles. All palate cleanser was very wonderful. Finally we had ginger theme dessert dish. The ice cream has a very nice flavour but the texture was too icy not creamy. The tofu pudding was light in flavour but with a very wet cookie. Overall it was okay and not worth the value caused of mediocre service.
Amazing

Reservation is required. It is a creative Vietnamese cuisine. One of the three dinner packages is VND890K. There is a large wine list and you can choose a glass or open a bottle. Among the four procedures, there will be three snacks or drinks that change the taste, which may be sweet or salty. Overall, it is worth a try.
Absolutely stunning New Vietnamese tasting menu!! Hidden gem in Danang.
Beautiful and delicious

Viet haute cuisine taking inspirations from its humble roots. The flavors are bold as dry-aging and fermentation techniques are emphasized ( sometimes a bit overpowering as is the case for us in the duck salad ) Although some dishes are off-balanced, overall it’s a very creative menu and highly focused on details. It gives us foreigners a way to learn traditional Viet food, presented in modern form. The service is good and they make sure to explain every dish, ( though sometimes the staff seemed a bit in a hurry. ) Especially appreciate the piece of paper explaining the ideas behind the dishes as the dinner went on.
Truly an amazing experience to say the least.  The combinations of flavors was on point AMD the chef really knows how to combine unique flavors in a remarkable menu.

personally didn't find the food spectacular but maybe its because we went for the refined traditional vietnamese food menu. perhaps the contemporary menu would have been better.

the quality of the refined menu was decent but not better than some street food stalls. the ingredients sourced also seemed like they could be obtained at a low cost so it seemed quite pricey for what im getting. like bun bo hue or chicken rice.... it didn't seem worth it

I didn't expect to have such a wonderful dinner in Da Nang during my family trip in May 2018.
I was truly impressed by how the clean, well-decorated interior and delicious, creative cuisine enriched my travel memories.
The photo I shared was the front page, lol.
I'd love to visit again someday when I visit Da Nang.
As a chef i Cann say thanks too the whole team who made our christmas eve even better! and what a great menu. Vietnamese haute cuisine! Thank you again!!

We went here for Xmas eve celebration, so we can only have xmas set meal; thankfully they got vegetarian options! Some of dishes were so incredible in both display and taste, while few were just soso. But the service was nothing to complain at all, there’s a staff introducing for us every time they served a new dish. My bf was not a big fan of this kinda creative cuisine so he’s not that satisfied with its price hahaha. But for me the dinning experience was brilliant  :)

Only 1 tasting "Holiday" menu option when we went- haute Vietnamese.  This resteraunt encapsulates everything wrong with fusion food.  Pesto + Mi Quang?? Vietnamese food is better on the street and far more flavorable.  Not fine dining.  Tea was served cold.  If looking for flavor save your $ and go elsewhere.
Michelin stars level viet fusion restaurant
Wonderful place for dining with family. The Christmas menu we tried last night was delicious. Highly recommend!

Absolutely great tasting menu!!! We picked New Vietnamese which every dish was just great! Highly recommended for everyone and it’s only cost about $50US for 6 courses!
All 11 out of 12 photos are included as some of them are the refreshing dishes
Three
Valued at its price
Nice
Nice

I have been to several fine restaurants, but this was the best food I have ever had. It was a great experience. If you are in Da Nang, you must not miss this experience. The price per person was 300 kr for food, and if you want a wine menu it is also 300 kr extra. Really cheap compared to the quality!
You will be surprised by every single dish and found everything is interesting.
Quiet space
Nice fine dine place in the area. Very special menu, romantic place.

The romantic space is like getting lost in a quiet garden. You are served attentively and the feeling of enjoying Vietnamese dishes is raised to a new level, which is wonderful. Here you will be the real owner of the meal with the feelings of hearing, sight, smell, taste and then feel all the sophistication in each dish that Nen Restaurant brings to you. The wine is great. The price is quite expensive but worth what you experience here. Professional staff. The chef is a lovely and friendly young lady with a passion for Vietnamese cuisine to introduce to international friends when coming to Da Nang city. If you have the opportunity, you should come to this place.

We ate at Nen on the last of a 4 night trip to the Da Nang/Hoi An area.  Although the food everywhere we ate was delicious, Nen was on a totally different level.  It was neat to end the trip there, after eating a lot of traditional Vietnamese food and getting a sense of the cuisine.  Nen offers two set menus (and an a la carte menu)--the "Refined" which is more classic dishes, and "New" which is the chef's more modern creations using traditional Vietnamese ingredients.  My husband got New and I got Refined so that we could taste both.  Both were fabulous.  I did the Refined with wine pairing and thought the pairings were excellent.  Everything was very, very well executed.  No overly strong flavors or strange textures as noted in other reviews.  The flavors were bold, presentation charming, and portion-size just right.  I don't even like dessert but this dessert was really food.  Chef came out at the end and actually sat at our table and chatted for a few minutes.  The dining room is very simple but lovely--all glass and surrounded by greenery in a quiet suburban neighborhood.  We've eaten at many 1, 2, and 3-Michelin starred restaurants all across the world, and as I told the chef at Nen, her food is worthy of at least a star and I hope she gets it someday.  Chef said it's hard in Vietnam, but with the combination of food, service, and setting, I'm hopeful.  In the meantime, make sure to try this place before it's impossible to get in!
Great experience ... Wonderful food

The experience of dining at this beautifully designed restaurant is a memory I will carry with me forever.
Due to my rare allergy to fish, traveling in Vietnam is a real challenge.
But upon arrival we were informed the chef had prepared a complete multi course menu for me.
There is no other word but perfection to describe the food and service we were so privileged to experience that night.
Mick Crosland

I really enjoyed my experience at Nen, the food was well thought out and the presentation was on point. Some of the textures in the dishes were a little harsh. These guys have a great concept and is well executed. One of the stars are …
One of the best meals I've ever had. Inventive takes on classic dishes, and spot-on wine pairings. Truly exquisite.
Did not live up to expectations. Very expensive ($165 for 2 pax) for average food. A lot of glamour but little substance.
Nicely decorated fine dining place.  Downside is that the portion is extremely small and I don’t enjoy it much.  Well, maybe I was not into fine dining at all.
Fancy restaurant small portion high price. Taste very good.

It is a very atmospheric restaurant. The dishes are mainly set meals. The food is very exquisite and tastes good. The waiter carefully introduced the ingredients and characteristics of each dish. It is a very good choice for couples.
Excellent overall experience. Food and wine pairings on the “new” menu were top notch. Service and response time were great too!
Good

This was a great restaurant experience with good food, knowledgeable staff, and friendly service. And I wish I could give it a 4.5 stars because it is a fine dining experience but not all of the dishes were so well executed. Nevertheless I still highly recommend it as you won’t so easily find such modern take on traditional Vietnamese fare. We tried the “refined” set. Will be back next time to try the “new” set. Maybe that will elevate this rating to five...
Nice food and great service.
Exquisite dining and amazing customer service. One of the best meal experience I had in Da Nang. Highly recommended.
World class restaurant.  Modern Vietnamese tasting menu. Perfect service.  Separate vegetarian/vegan choice.  Beautiful and polished.
Definitely worth trying! Had an amazing experience
Awesome food 😋😋😋 …
Amazing flavors and beautiful presentation of courses. Staff is very friendly too and able to explain the courses in both Vietnamese and English, and probably other languages as well.

The best meal I have ever had in Vietnam! The staff were wonderful. The food was amazing. We were so full. When we visit again we will fast for a day before. The chef even came to our table to explain how one of the dishes was prepared.
Beautiful house design VJC
Food and service was fantastic. Well worth a visit
Okay

Great restaurant with 3 tasting menus. Enjoyed 2 of the menus in our group of 5 people. Might lean towards the “new” menu vs the “refined”. Wine list somewhat limited. Enjoyed the cocktails and beer in addition to the wine. It was very nice of the chef to come and visit our table towards the end of our meal.

This is fine dining but very relaxed. 3 different 8 course menus. All Vietnamese and so tasty. Due to allergies, I had a mix of 2. Showing flexibility, just lovely. If you like the vegetarian menu, you are advised to book forehand. Just go there!
Great flavours and value.
good place for quality local food. Highly recommend to order the Refined Set

Just when you thought you'd seen everything in Da Nang, wait till you visit this place. Set in a secluded residential area of Da Nang, this restaurant is arguably one of the best.

They serve contemporary Vietnamese cuisine, as the restauranteurs like to call it nowadays, 'reimagined'.

Most of the dishes served were delicious. Some of it missed the mark though. Overall the I give it a 9/10.

An experimental fine dining restaurant... but it was a reckless experiment. Ingredients were out of harmony, and the flavors and aromas didn't take into account the flow of the course at all... At this price, you'd be better off going somewhere else and eating seafood to your heart's content. They used anchovy sauce here and there, and it was so salty and strong that I took one bite and threw it all away. Think carefully before you go. It's a concept that ordinary people would never understand... No, even experts wouldn't understand it.
The food is great and service wonderful. Fine dining street food.
The most professional restaurant in service in Danang, the food is delicious and the flavor is clear. The price is high but the happiness is worth the money.
A must-try. I always hope my hometown would have this kind of creative bistro
Good
Great food, great service. Although we know the menu in advance, the food could still surprise me. I would strongly recommend my friend to visit this restaurant.

Best restaurant in Vietnam! We ordered the "Refined" and "New" menus for our dining experience and the entire meal was absolutely fantastic and such a surprise.  I have traveled around Vietnam for 5 months and this was my favorite restaurant in the entire country.  I'd recommend going with someone who doesn't mind sharing plates so you can try two different menus as you will be blown away by the range of variety and taste from one to the other.  Summer Le has compiled a fantastic menu!

Went here for their soft opening with my fiance.  We had both their new Vietnamese and refined Vietnamese menus.  The food here is both familiar and inventive, refined, but still keeping in touch with the rustic traditional roots.

Their variation on My Quang is delicious, with a sauce that is unctuous, and thicker than usual Mi Quang sauce.  The grilled beef in betel leaves is meltingly tender, and the peanut sauce that comes with it is so good, they could put it in a bowl and sell it on it's own as a meal.  Their wasabi infused fish is brilliant.  Their tongue with crispy fried spleen is unique, and delicious.

There are plenty of other great dishes, but the best thing I can say is you will find something to appreciate about each item in the menu, and it will broaden your palate and make you want to talk about what's on the plate in front of you.

Go. Eat.  It's (really) good.

The food was average, but the portion size didn't match the price. I wonder if this is truly a "bistro" experience, as it contradicts the essence of some Chinese cuisine.

I'm not sure why the restaurant, which clearly provides free napkins, only places them at the cashier, not on the tables. They only provide paid wet wipes on the tables, and you have to go to the front desk to ask for free napkins. Is this a "hidden cost" or "forced consumption"?

This is a great place to get acquainted with Sichuan cuisine. The dishes aren't as spicy as they look. The food is delicious; I recommend the dumplings in spicy sauce and the cucumber salad. The service is fast. The pepper leaves a pleasant tingling sensation in your mouth and a numbing sensation.
Tasty, spicy, but pleasant😁
Ironically, this is the most delicious food I've had in Vietnam. LOL If you order plain rice, they usually bring you a whole pot of it. It's better than any average Korean Chinese restaurant.
The tast is so so and wait toooo long for food even in the restaurant have 3 tables. No recommend.

Ayi Bistro (四川小馆) brings the fire of Sichuan to Da Nang—bold, spicy, and unapologetically authentic. Tucked just off the Han River, the restaurant has a laid-back, bistro feel, with red lanterns and the unmistakable aroma of chili oil and peppercorns in the air.

The menu is stacked with Sichuan staples: mouth-numbing mapo tofu, fiery chongqing chicken, hand-pulled noodles, and silky dumplings swimming in chili sauce. Every dish balances the signature “mala” punch of spice and numbing heat with rich, savory depth. If you’re craving comfort, order the beef noodle soup; if you’re chasing a thrill, the hot pot will test your limits.

Portions are generous, perfect for sharing with friends over cold beers or tea. Staff are friendly and happy to guide you if you’re new to Sichuan food. Prices are wallet-friendly: mains $5–$10 USD, hot pot and larger dishes a bit higher.

💕This Chinese restaurant, where I ate two days in a row, was the most satisfying restaurant I had during my trip to Vietnam! Chongqing locals really recommend it. If you're into strong flavors, tell the owner: the Chengdu lady is super nice! She's cheerful and generous. I'll be back next time!!! Really recommend!
Chinese locals really recommend it!
The best Chinese restaurant in Da Nang, a city dominated by Korean-Chinese cuisine. Be sure to try the tantan noodles and mapo tofu.
There was a long line next door, and the weather was perfect for lunch today, so I came in. A restaurant that Koreans will love.^^

One of pretty authentic place to enjoy sichuan dishes. All dishes we ordered were tasty and freshly made. Their portion were quite big, and service was decent and quite friendly despite the barrier language. When we were there, there seems to be a lot of Chinese tourists who ate here as well. Definitely could recommend if you are up to trying sichuan dishes in Da Nang!
Sichuan restaurants offer a wide variety of dishes that cater to Chinese tastes, allowing those traveling abroad to enjoy a delicious meal.

Near the Dragon Bridge, many dishes have increased in price. Please update the menu in time. The price-performance ratio is not high. A bottle of Coke costs 6 yuan and rice is 3 yuan. It is more expensive than most restaurants in Danang.
Oversalted
Very authentic, especially recommend the sauerkraut noodles, will come again

The food was average, but the portion size didn't match the price. I wonder if this is truly a "bistro" experience, as it contradicts the essence of some Chinese cuisine.

I'm not sure why the restaurant, which clearly provides free napkins, only places them at the cashier, not on the tables. They only provide paid wet wipes on the tables, and you have to go to the front desk to ask for free napkins. Is this a "hidden cost" or "forced consumption"?
generally
The food is delicious. Although it is Sichuan cuisine, it is not very spicy and tastes authentic.
The food has a Chinese flavor but is not too spicy, suitable for Vietnamese taste. Very delicious 👍👍👍

✔️ Special Notes

A Vietnamese-Chinese style restaurant with a slightly casual atmosphere, a little different from the authentic Chinese restaurant.

I visited after hearing rumors of a "good restaurant" locally, and the interior was so comfortable that it felt the coolest among the restaurants I've visited so far.

There are about 10 tables for 4 people.
It was a 'perfect' atmosphere where I could focus on the scent and taste of the food.

1. TÔM MIẾN SỐT TỎI (VND 219,000)
Ingredients such as shrimp, glass noodles, cabbage, and enoki mushrooms
Tastes like a Korean earthenware pot with a lot of garlic? It was also quite tasty when mixed with the rice that came with it. This was my favorite of the 3 I ordered. Highly recommended!!

2. Cucumber Salad (VND 75,000)
Cucumber Salad
Sweet and refreshing dressing, peanut topping, and edible.

3. Sui Khao (VND 79,000)
