Sui Khao is much more spicy than I expected!

My lips were tingling as soon as I ate it.. Highly recommended for those who like spicy food.

However, those who are sensitive to spices should be careful.

4. LARUE (VND 25,000)
Larue beer / Beer produced in Da Nang. Manufacturer: Heineken Vietnam.

5. TIGER (VND 30,000)
Tiger beer / Singaporean lager beer

✔️ Final evaluation (Overall)
➖ The meal is edible / *Okay for a meal*
However, there may be likes and dislikes.
Good mapo tofu and cucumber salad
Very happy eating

*edit* Updated review – very disappointing

Sadly, my second visit was the complete opposite, uncomfortable, disrespectful, and upsetting.

I arrived ahead of my partner and TRIED to order 2 portions of the Sichuan chicken for both of us, just like we did before. But instead of simply taking my order, the staff member questioned me over and over: “Are you sure?”, “It’s a lot of food”, “How many friends are coming?”, and kept pressing despite me explaining that my partner was coming shortly.

She left without placing the order. When my partner arrived and confirmed the order again, she repeated that it was too much food. I was so frustrated I finally said, “Yes, I’m fat. What now?” only then did she stop and take the order.

It was completely unnecessary. I came in wanting to support this restaurant, and I even planned to recommend it on my food review YouTube channel. But after this experience, I honestly can’t recommend it or say I’d return.

*old review*

*AC & card payment available* Just WOW amazing, authentic Chinese food! We tried so many dishes and loved them all. Everything was full of flavour and cooked perfectly. Most dishes are quite spicy, so if you’re sensitive to heat, it’s worth asking for less spice when you order. Definitely a must-visit if you’re craving real Chinese cuisine! Definitely coming back soon! 🥰

Food - Overall, it's delicious. 1. Mala-mat dumplings 2. Fried rice 3. Shrimp dumplings are delicious in that order.

Air conditioning - There is one, but it's not very cool and it's a bit hot.

There were wet tissues on the table, so I asked first, and they looked a bit sheepish and said yes, so I thought it was free and used them, but they charged 3,000 won each. That was ridiculous. Haha. If you didn't understand properly, you shouldn't answer. It's not much, but it makes me feel bad.
It would be better to write that it's paid or to remove them from the table.

This Sichuan place is honestly a gem! The menu is huge - like, almost overwhelming in the best way possible - and everything we tried was spot on with the flavors.

What I really appreciated is that they actually listen when you ask for "not too spicy." So many places either ignore you or make it so mild it tastes like nothing, but these guys nail that sweet spot where you still get all those complex Sichuan flavors without your mouth being on fire.

The dumplings though - wow. Seriously some of the best I've had. They're clearly putting real care into making these, and it shows. Whatever they're doing with the seasoning across all their dishes just works. You can tell someone in that kitchen really knows what they're doing.

It's one of those places where you keep discovering new things to try each time you go back. Perfect for when you want authentic Sichuan food but don't want to gamble on whether it'll be too intense or not flavorful enough. They've got that balance figured out.

Definitely going back to work through more of that massive menu!
Some dishes are delicious, some are not, prices are acceptable (100k/dish), parking on the street.
Tasty food. We asked for just a little bit spicy but it is still too spicy for our preference.
Real (and spicy) SICHUAN food... ❤️❤️❤️❤️
I am very happy to be able to eat such authentic Sichuan cuisine in Da Nang.
Excellent noodles and dumplings with proper Sichuan pepper seasoning
Very good food and great service!
Team building last month  Thank u ayi offer good meal for us ❤️✌️

Jelly noodle with shrimp was really  tasty’ suitable for people who dont eat spicy ‘ we were waiting 4 p pizza, but so many people waiting outside , we decided walk in ayibistro , so cool dor aircondition ! Nice ya

My friend and I came to this restaurant for lunch. The food was absolutely amazing — I really love Sichuan cuisine, and I haven’t found any other place in Da Nang like this. The service was superb too. Highly recommend!
Mapo dufu the best , no doubt
Thats my favorite chinese restaraunt in danang city !! 3days we come back 2 times , hoan thanh is best !! And spicy chicken !! Must be oder it !
First time come to chinese restaurant try sichuan food , it was soooo good , me and my family all like it !! Staff so cute ~ we will come back again

I am the only vegetarian person in my group of friends and we managed to ask the restaurant for some vegetarian dishes. The staff were so lovely, helpful and attentive. We loved all our dishes, both meat and vegetarian, they were very flavorful and aromatic. It was the first time I tried this type of food. Their desserts were also very yummy and refreshing. We would definitely come back with more friends!
The food is ok because it's a bit oily and has a bland spicy taste so it gets boring quickly.

Authentic Sichuan cuisine at its best! The staff were all incredibly friendly and helpful, and the place was spotless. Every dish was flawless, so flavorful! I couldn’t stop eating, and I left in a happy food coma. Easily one of the most satisfying lunches I’ve had in Da Nang!

Very delicious, but I hope the packaging for delivery can be healthier.
Hot food plastic wrap is very unhealthy
Every time the soup bowl is deformed because it is too hot
Can’t order takeout often🥲

I wanted to come here since last year, but my schedule didn't work out so this was my first time visiting. I heard that the store has been open for 9 years, but the store is really clean and the food is really delicious. The fried rice, mapo tofu, and chicken were so delicious that I ordered dumplings. The dumpling sauce was spicy and I couldn't stop eating it, so it was delicious. I want to visit again.
The restaurant is very delicious !! Go in peace !!

Me and my pasl favorite meal in Vietnam after being 7 days in it. Love every single dish we tried. No one is there when we are dinning so we worried abit at first but grab keeps picking up food that’s when we knew it has to be good. We emptied all the six dishes we ordered. Rice was free for  ordering above 2 or 3 dishes. We were there on public holiday and we have to wait about 15 mins.

A place where you can taste real mapo tofu
Stir-fried glass noodles taste similar to jjajangmyeon, and if you eat them with rice, you get jjajangbap!!
And the dandan noodles are also worth eating.
The shrimp dumplings are pretty good.
Reference - YouTube Myeongilne -
The dandan noodle soup is fabulous! Highly recommended

We also saw on Google Maps that this restaurant is an authentic and delicious Chinese restaurant. I came here to eat yesterday on April 19, 2025. I was really not disappointed. It is a clean and comfortable restaurant. Everything we ordered was delicious, except that the shrimps in the spring rolls were not shelled, which affected the taste a bit. I told the waiter and she said she would give feedback to the boss.
My husband is British and he said he didn’t expect the food in this restaurant to be so delicious!
The waiters here can all speak Chinese, the service is very good, and they are very gentle. If you are traveling to Da Nang and like Chinese food, you should not miss this restaurant.
We are going to stay in Da Nang for a month and a half and we will come back, highly recommended!
After chatting with the waiter for a while, she said that the boss is from Sichuan and the chef is Vietnamese. The boss's mother taught the chef how to cook the food. It seems that the boss's mother is a capable person.
My favorite Chinese food in Da Nang! Authentic, fresh 😎, flavor dishes. Service is amazing and owners are the best
This is a great restaurant!!

The food is authentic Chinese, delicious
Comfortable space, staff smile more is ok. The owner is cute
Will come back again

I had an unsatisfactory experience here, the restaurant space is clean, the service is okay, however the food here is not suitable for me, the Sichuan noodle soup has a strong star anise smell which is difficult to eat for me personally. I ordered stir-fried zucchini with garlic and stir-fried beef with celery but the taste here does not seem to suit me. I did not eat and left everything, what a bad experience.
I'm going back to Korea tomorrow. I really want spicy food, so I found it. The taste is very authentic. The boss must be Chinese.

We came back here after three years, and it’s just as amazing as we remembered! The food is fresh, flavorful, and authentic, with top-notch quality. The warm atmosphere and friendly service make it a great spot for a delicious meal.
Tasty and fresh food, friendly staff! Go there - you won't regret it!
More than happy to try it. Fantastic food with very good flavors.

I agree with many of the reviews. The food isn't that great. I also asked the waitress if the food I ordered was spicy, as I didn't want it spicy, and she assured me it wasn't. I couldn't eat more than a quarter of the plate because of the spiciness. More expensive than it was worth.
Everything was good, but the chicken was bland (it's a world upside down).
Divine authenticity. It's like I've arrived in Chengdu.

Personally, I liked the broth and cucumber salad the best.
The mala xiangguo felt a bit lacking, and I had high hopes for the mapo tofu, but it wasn't quite what I expected.
As depicted in the picture, it was a relatively comfortable meal.

Recommended if you speak Chinese. The rice bowl is huge, so order one to try it out. Luckily, we were able to return one bowl, otherwise we wouldn't have been able to finish it. If you prefer spicy food, try the mild version. Highly recommended.

I just love this place, it's so delicious. I think about this food every day 🙏🏻
I highly recommend the Sichuan Special Beef Soup from the first page - it's expensive, but 1000% worth it. You get a BUCKET of delicious soup for two, and that beef made me groan with pleasure EVERY time.

I also feel a little weird paying for napkins, especially since they are wet and very large, and I prefer dry ones. You can ask the waitress to bring dry napkins, but I feel a little awkward every time, so I started bringing my own 🙊
The shrimp dumplings were average. The mala-tang was not strong, but it was delicious. The fried rice was the best.

I came here on the last day because I was craving something spicy.

A husband and wife and a child went there.

Tantan noodles
Tomato and egg stir-fry
Shrimp dumplings
Mapo tofu
Salad with sesame bread(?)
White rice

I ate it all and ate it all. It was just my style.

They had wet wipes, so I used them, but since it was 3,000 dong,
I took off a service star. Lol

Awesome restaurant 🍴 The environment and atmosphere are particularly good! The key is that the ingredients are safe to eat and meet the tastes of various places. I highly recommend the hand-shredded cold chicken. Vietnamese food is light and not greasy. I decided to change my taste. The private room is very upscale when traveling with many friends.
Neither good nor bad! Average!

Customers waited 30 minutes without food being served. When asked by the staff, they were told that the food was taking a long time to prepare. Meanwhile, many tables that came later had their food served and finished eating and then paid. In total, they had to wait another 6 minutes for the food to be served. Obviously, they forgot the customer's order and still made excuses. Disappointing.

Danang's only Sichuan restaurant
It suits Korean tastes very well. Be sure to order Mapo Tofu with white rice. It's super delicious!!
The taste is amazing, just like home.
The food tasted different from the last time I visited, the food came out slowly, the dishes were quite bland, not spicy. very disappointed
The owner was really friendly, recommended food, gave us extra stuff to to try, the food was really good! Would definitely come again.
The vibe of this place is amazing! The staff was friendly and attentive. The food was flavorful and the portions were big. I recommend this place to my dear friends and family

I don't really like Sichuan flavor so it's quite spicy and bland. Suitable for those who like spicy food. The staff is quick, the food comes out quite quickly, and there's a lot of food. The wanglaoji soup is delicious hehe.

Every dish is very delicious and goes well with rice. My family doesn't like spicy food. After ordering, the restaurant was very cooperative and adjusted. Everyone was very satisfied. The service staff was very good and could speak Chinese. I will definitely come again!

Help, this is the ceiling of Chinese food in Da Nang. Do you know the kind of satisfaction and emotion that people feel when they live in a foreign land and eat a mouthful of authentic Chinese food? The attitude of the store clerk is also very good, I have eaten here several times.
The food is totally different from the menu photo

The taste is not bad, but most of the menu items such as fried rice and wonton soup cannot be served. 😂
There were no stores open during the New Year holidays, so I had no choice but to come, but I would have preferred not to.
Not a bad Chinese restaurant, I liked it
Not used to eating

A treasure shop I accidentally discovered in Da Nang, specializing in Sichuan cuisine, Malatang and dry pot, is very suitable for people like me who love spicy food. Although the taste has been locally improved, the overall experience of the environment and service is nice🎉🎉

I have lived in China for over 15 years.
I went there thinking it would be traditional Sichuan cuisine, but it was a bit different.
The waitress speaks Chinese and is friendly.
The taste is just right.

Since I came here for the first time last year and had spicy chicken and mapo tofu, I have become a regular customer. The chicken is not too small, it is a bite-sized dish, with good texture and fragrance. If it can be stir-fried with …

Very tasty!
But a bit pricey of course..
—— …

Seriously, it's spicy!!
Spicy.. Especially for those who like spicy food, I highly recommend it🥹🥹
I discovered a restaurant that I've never been to in Korea …
It was so delicious that I forgot to take a photo 😂 …

If it's nearby, it's worth a visit
Tantan noodles are delicious
Cucumber salad is also delicious …
After being in Vietnam for a few days, I finally found a Sichuan restaurant to satisfy my cravings! ! It's great! ! I recommend everyone to try it

As a fan of spicy food and Chinese food, I think this is my favorite restaurant in Da Nang at the moment.
The price is quite high compared to the general level, the quality is stable.
Ngonnn 10 VND
Pricey but excellent Sichuan, both delivery and dine-in.

The food was, at best, average. While I was expecting authentic flavors or even a unique twist, the dishes lacked the zest and quality one would hope for in a dedicated Chinese eatery. Some dishes were overly salty, while others felt bland, as though they were missing key ingredients. It wasn’t terrible, but it also wasn’t memorable.

Atmosphere & Service

One of the most unsettling aspects of the experience was the staff. They seemed visibly unhappy, which created an awkward atmosphere. Throughout my meal, I couldn’t help but notice staff members staring at customers. While it’s common for attentive service to involve occasional check-ins, this went beyond that and felt intrusive. It made me and other diners visibly uncomfortable, detracting from the overall dining experience.

Rating: ⭐⭐/5

Sichuan cuisine
I went there because they told me to eat mapo tofu
but my friend and I didn't like the smell
shrimp dumplings? Those were delicious
and the fried rice was delicious
Today I went to Ayi to try a new dish. The noodles were delicious and the beef was flavorful. Will come back many times.
followed google reviews and tried this place.. the spicy dumpling, chicken and beef fried rice was really good! definitely recommend!

This is the most delicious and authentic Sichuan food I have ever eaten outside. It is so delicious that I want to cry! The children saw Liangpi at the first sight and ordered a bowl and finished it alone. Being able to eat such authentic food was so touching that it made me want to go back to my hometown in Sichuan. I missed the taste of my hometown. Friends who want to eat Sichuan food must not miss this Sichuan restaurant!

The Shaozi noodles are delicious, the fried beef with celery is also good, but the fried dumplings are not good, they are hard and not crispy at all, and the dipping sauce is only spicy but not salty!

The voltage is very stable, the steamed eggs are soft and melt even though it takes a little longer but it's worth it. My friend likes spicy pangolin dried shrimp hot pot. This weather is perfect =]] . Cute, enthusiastic and loving staff 🫶

If you're not Chinese you're not going to love this food, strange taste, very spicy, I didn't liked it. Everything is with pork. Very expensive for vietnam , there is no value for money. But the staff is nice.
The strange dish has the numbing taste of pepper; Those who are not familiar with it will find it strange, the food portions are large, the lovely staff will come back
5 stars for the enthusiasm of the service staff. The lovely students work extra, so sometimes there are a few small mistakes but forgive the cuteness.

Guest reception is a mess. There weren't many customers, but they didn't come to take their orders, and even though they ordered, the food didn't come out. After 30 minutes, I protested and asked to order again, but the male owner just laughed sarcastically.
Do you have any contact information? I want to order takeaway.
Very tasty dumplings and hot delicious tea😍😍😍
Great , authentic , delicious.
Fast service, clean and airy space is also quite harmonious. The dishes are diverse and not too spicy so it is easy to eat. Worth trying Chinese food

Food: delicious, fried vermicelli and Quang noodles are delicious, full of flavor, delicious Wanglaoji drink 9/10
Restaurant space: polite, cool 9/10
Fast service 9/10

My favourite place for Szechuan food. Great quality, amazing flavours and affordable prices.
Been here many times and it never disappoints. I will keep coming back to get my spicy kick fix!

The best Sichuan restaurant in Da Nang. The dandan noodles served here are completely different from Korea, with a lot of layu and thin noodles. They are full of octagonal cinnamon, cloves, meatballs, and chopi peppers!!!!  It's five spice mara rayu.
It's really delicious. Above all, it is an oil, but it does not feel greasy at all when you drink it, and this is the clean, top-quality marara oil!!!!  Be sure to give it a try!!!

But it's quite spicy and spicy, so if you like malatang and really like layu, try it. If you don't like oil and don't like mala, don't try it. ~^^

Heavenly level Rayu!!!!!!  It really absorbed all the oil!!!

The mapo tofu, which was highly praised by some, did not suit my taste as the Chinese-style soybean paste was thicker than I expected, and the tofu was soft tofu, so it was very soft!!!
If you think of Korean food, I recommend it. It's a new flavor. It's not the best mapo tofu!!!

Most recommended shrimp dumplings ㅡㅡ

It's the worst ㅡㅡ.  ?

Oh, I'm not saying it wasn't delicious, but those were fried dumplings, so they came out a bit hard and the taste was ordinary, so I didn't like it.
Expectations were high! !!!
I recommend eating wontons, steamed dumplings, or water dumplings here rather than those! Especially the pork dumplings drizzled with rayu sauce!!!!

Really 90% Chinese customers! 10% foreigners
No Vietnamese at all

The store is very clean, the staff barely speaks English, and the air conditioning is great!  It's a bit pricey but well worth it.

A Sichuan restaurant you must try when you go to Da Nang!!!!

PS. Personally, it was the best Rayu and it had a shocking taste!  Daeun Da Nang’s one pick!  The most memorable dish in Da Nang!!!!

When Chinese people are abroad, their Chinese stomachs are still the most soothing. The spiciness of the Sichuan cuisine here can be adjusted according to the customer's preferences. It is really rare that a Fujianese like me who can't tolerate spicy food at all can enjoy the meal. Don't miss it if you pass by. The waitress is super beautiful and speaks very good Mandarin!
Pretty authentic sichuan food! Portion is quite large and value for money!
If you're craving Chinese food in Danang, this is the place to go. The food is average, the place has air conditioning, and the service is friendly.
Best dumplings I’ve ever had, one of the best spots in Da nang
The food here is great. Very good, everyone should come and try it.
Lovely service, delicious food, pleasant space
The Chinese food was cheap and delicious.

Quite disappointed. We came because of the good reviews and left with a bad taste in our mouths.
The spicy dumplings are good, but the spicy chicken was inedible. There was only grease; the meat was nonexistent.
Plus, they charge you for the napkins you use...

First time trying and really liked the chili oil. I felt like eating it was like a mixture of hot oil, roasted sesame and chili powder (chili powder eaten with stone-grilled Chinese sausage). I was fascinated by the spicy taste so it was very suitable for my taste. The big bowl of grilled pork was served with extra white rice, it took 3 people to finish it. The restaurant was full of foreigners, I sat and ate for an hour but didn't see any Vietnamese people 😂

We were travelling in Danang for a week aleady, been really miss eating rice because we are Thai. We so googled for Thai-Chinese restuarant and followed the reviews. We found this place and we think we wete right to pick this place. Foods are good. Staffs are nice and friendly. Loves it!
Delicious, authentic Sichuan flavor. Highly recommended for those who love Chinese food.
The toilet is very nice.
Wow~ Delicious!!

I have been craving for some Szechuan taste and this place hit the nail.

Ordered the fried rice and the spicy noodle both are very good

This was the best Sichuan food I've ever had! The dishes were bursting with authentic flavors and the perfect level of spice. The cucumber salad is to die for—refreshing and packed with flavor. Every bite was a delight, and I can't wait to come back. If you're a fan of spicy Chinese food, this place is a must-visit!

The place serves Szechuan cuisine and while great attention is paid to the technique and individual element on the plate (excellent quality noodle, great sear technique, just overall very nicely done individual elements) a few things put me off. Firstly, the portion sizes are very small. The prices get you thinking this is one of those affordable spots but its not.
Secondly, funnily enough, the food looks spectacular but lacks the Szechuan spice. It definitely has heaps of the tingling sensation making it feel like you’re eating mint or a pepper. Even their chilli oil lacks spice. The food is on the oilier side. I know Chinese cuisine is supposed to be oily and being from pakistan, i can appreciate oily food. But this felt a little extra. Thirdly, the place has Ac as well as giant fans and the food runs cold very quickly.
So quite disappointing when food runs cold and lacks spice in a Szechuan restaurant.
I tried Sichuan cuisine for the first time and it was really delicious. It takes courage to always try something new, but that's why I travel^^
The first Sichuan dish I ate in Da Nang was delicious. It was just the right amount of spicy and good😬😬😬

I ordered shrimp dumplings, mapo tofu, white rice, and cola. 
The food is clean. The mapo tofu with white rice is especially delicious. Be sure to order shrimp dumplings. They're the best. 
The restaurant is cool and the staff is friendly.
Food tastes great, reasonably priced, good atmosphere. XiChuan food lovers should give it a try.
The food was delicious and the manager was lovely. I'd love to come again.
It was really delicious.
If you want to eat authentic Sichuan cuisine, I highly recommend this place! The owner is Chinese and a really nice guy! I'll definitely go again!!
Great

The portion is generous and the taste is good. The flavor has been adjusted so it is not too oily or spicy. The hand-shredded cabbage is stir-fried to be crispy and tasty. It is the best stir-fried vegetables I have tasted in Da Nang. The only difference is that the ribs in the rib dry pot are different from the ones on the menu. The ribs are very small. The mapo tofu is a must-order for rice killers. There is a charge for table towels. The service staff are very friendly and cute. If you miss Chinese food, you must come here first. You will definitely not be disappointed.

As a Chinese who love spicy food, this is definitely an authentic Sichuan cuisine restaurant. I could eat here everyday! Make sure you visit here if you love spicy and Sichuan food, but they also provide non spicy dishes.

I ordered the spicy dumplings on Grab and they were SO SO GOOD! I have been craving this type of dish for ages and haven't been able to find anything quite like it in Da Nang. Until I found AYI and I'm so happy I did! So much flavor - I will definitely be ordering this dish a lot. Great portion, packaged well, and so tasty. Highly recommend!
Small servings
The chilli shrimp dumpling were good, mapo was good as well. Not really the best but decent szechuan cuisine!
Great
I recommend trying all the dumplings if possible. Mapo tofu is best mixed with white rice.

Please order the shrimp dumplings twice. No, I am writing this review because it reminds me of it so much even after returning to Korea 5 times. Compared to Korean malatang, malatang has a lot of oil and less toppings. There are no bean sprouts.
I didn't expect to have such authentic Sichuan flavor in Vietnam, which tastes better than some Sichuan restaurants in Malaysia. 5-star recommendation.

The store address is very eye-catching and easy to find!
The cold noodles taste amazing👍delicious! First of all, the noodles are right! Not just any noodles can be made
Worcestershire sauce is also very delicious, and the flavor in the chili jar is very strong
Chatting with the waiter, I found out that the chef is a local, but the boss is from Sichuan! It’s the cooking skills taught by the boss
Whether you have a Chinese stomach or not, you should try this famous Chinese delicacy

Very authentic taste
Worth a return visit
Nice portion and taste. Price are reasonable as well. Definitely will recommend if you like Sichuan.
Lovely food , big portions so is good value for money, recommended,  greetings from Ba Lan 😘
Food was mediocre and price was high

Wow... I came here through a friend's recommendation.
I think people who like mala will really enjoy it!
Mapo tofu... egg fried rice... I really ate the shrimp dumplings!
I think I'll come back again because I think of this food when I go to Korea..ㅠㅠ♡
Sichuan people enjoyed satisfying Sichuan food in Da Nang!

The taste is normal. When paying the bill, I asked what the 6,000 dong was and was told that it was because they used two wet tissues. There was no price displayed on the tissues on the desk. If you pay by credit card, a 3% fee will be charged to you. There is no receipt.
Food is great and also the service too. I like the place and its atmosphere.Best place to chill.

A modified Sichuan dish. The pickled fish lacked flavor without the Sichuan peppercorns, but the portion was generous. The stir-fried pork belly in red oil had sugar in it. The steamed buns needed vinegar to eat them, otherwise they would be average. The shrimp vermicelli burger was generous in portion and light, perfect for Taiwanese tastes. The restaurant was clean and tidy.
Friendly staff, spacious restaurant, diverse menu.

Such amazing food. We were warned about the spice level but found it completely fine and so flavourful. Each dish we had was amazing and quality. Only suggestion would be to play some background music as it was a little quiet

The only Sichuan restaurant in Da Nang that I feel is the most delicious and authentic. The owner is Chinese, so the Sichuan flavor is unquestionable. The restaurant is clean, the staff is enthusiastic and attentive. Everyone in my family eats here and everyone says it's delicious.

A Unique Menu
Egg Fried Rice: Delicious...

People who like mala flavor will like it very much.
The scent is a bit strong for me. it is delicious.

I had their spicy Chinese dumplings and it tasted amazing!!! The indoor decor was really cute and their staff was super friendly! Their owner is this really cool gal from Chengdu so authenticity guaranteed😋I highly recommend this restaurant to those who are a little tired of all the pho and want something to the heavier side!

This isn't our first time here; the food is always delicious and served quickly. The dumpling portions are not large, nor are they expensive. Some dishes are spicy, but I'd say they're piquant, as the spiciness doesn't cause discomfort but rather complements the flavors very well. The staff is always friendly.

I had seen this restaurant before Chinese New Year, and I finally got to eat there this time! I was amazed at how delicious and authentic Sichuan cuisine can be found abroad! It's so rare! The sauerkraut noodles are amazing, and I also love the shredded chicken and spicy wontons.

Looking for Authentic Chiense / Sichuan food ?

Do visit this place
All the Dishes here are amazing, do try their desert Tremella Sweet Soup.😘
An excellent choice if you wish to eat authentic Si Chuan food in Da Nang.
The food was wonderful and the suggestions given by the staff were also delicious. The staff were friendly, helpful, always with a great smile and positive attitude.
If you want to try Szechuan home cooking, this is the place! And not just figuratively, because the cook is literally the owners Mom! …
We had incredible noodles and dumplings! The best food we have had so far in Vietnam and the value is really good (most smaller meals are 70k-100k vnd. We will be back for sure!

Great little Sichuan restaurant, food was very authentic and yummy!

The owner is an absolutely lovely Sichuan lady - she gave us recommendations on …
Delicious food, especially the rose dew
I can't get used to Vietnamese food these past two days. This Sichuan dish is very delicious. I recommend everyone to try it.
I admit that this is a really good spicy stew restaurant...!!

This is definitely the best Sichuan restaurant in Da Nang. Our group of four had a fantastic meal! The restaurant is beautiful, with simple and elegant decor, and the value is excellent. The owner is especially friendly 👍. It's definitely a …
There is a cold room so it is cool.
Perfect chinese restaurant
Fantastic dumplings!! Bit overpriced
The dish is quite unique, delicious and suitable for taste. A bit spicy but the restaurant can make it not spicy. The restaurant space is spacious and clean. Will come back many times.

Excellent Chinese food served with a smile! We enjoyed everything we ordered and were shocked at how inexpensive the tab was. We leave Da Nang tomorrow, but if we were staying longer, we would be repeat customers. Be sure to put Ayi Bistro on your list of places to eat in Da Nang!

Best Sichuan cuisine in town. Located in the heart of Da Nang City (04-06 Hoang Van Thu Street). Excellent food. Hospitable hosts, the chef's also Chinese so she knows how to make great Sichuan dishes. The menu is extensive and seasonal to a particularly high standard. Highly recommended!!

Very good Sichuan cuisine!! Really great!! A little less spicy than the original!! But it accentuates the flavor and isn't just spicy. I think these were the best Dan Dan noodles I've ever eaten!!! So much flavor and perfectly spicy!!! Thank you so much!!!

Ayi is a Chinese restaurant located at 04-06 Hoang Van Thu, the center of Da Nang city. The dishes here have been adjusted to better suit Vietnamese tastes but still retain the typical flavors of China. Reasonable prices range from a few …
This sichuan cuisine is amazing . I was study aboard in china , thats really good chinese favor in da nang ! U should try

The food is super delicious, at first I thought Chinese food would be picky but it turned out to be super addictive. I like the thin-skinned beef dumplings, fried crispy on one side. One bite and the beef filling is full, not too little. The chicken salad and noodles are just the right taste, very easy to eat. The noodles are rich in flavor. The staff is enthusiastic, the manager is also cheerful. Will come back many times.
Delicious food, airy and cool space, clean (Highly recommend fried rice with eggs)

Ayi Bistro Restaurant embodies the essence of Sichuan cuisine, delivering exquisite flavors and impeccable service. From the moment you enter, you're greeted with warmth and authenticity. The menu boasts a wide selection of traditional dishes, each expertly crafted to perfection. Whether you're a fan of fiery spices or delicate flavors, Ayi Bistro promises a culinary journey you won't soon forget.

If you want delicious Chinese food, this is a restaurant you should try. Quality from food to service quality. The restaurant is clean and airy. The staff is cheerful and enthusiastic with customers. Great
Cool space, delicious food especially dumplings and hot pot. Cute and friendly staff. Overall very ok
Delicious food, friendly staff, airy space, will come back 🥰🥰

Tứ Xuyên Restaurant offers an authentic taste of Sichuan cuisine with bold flavors and attentive service. From aromatic spices to traditional dishes, each bite is a culinary delight. A must-visit for those craving an unforgettable dining experience.
The restaurant has a variety of food, just the right taste, not too greasy. The staff is very enthusiastic and cheerful.

Tucked away in the heart of the city, Tứ Xuyên Restaurant offers a delightful journey into the flavors of Sichuan cuisine. With its authentic dishes bursting with bold spices and traditional flavors, dining here is a true culinary adventure. From the moment you step inside, the warm ambiance and attentive service create a welcoming atmosphere. Each dish is meticulously prepared, showcasing the rich culinary heritage of Sichuan province. Whether you're savoring the numbing heat of hotpot or indulging in the comforting embrace of mapo tofu, every bite is a testament to the restaurant's commitment to quality and authenticity. The staff are friendly and knowledgeable, eager to guide you through the menu and ensure a memorable dining experience. For a taste of Sichuan's finest offerings, look no further than Tứ Xuyên Restaurant.
Great food quality, cool atmosphere. Great staff, reasonable prices. Everyone should try it.
This restaurant has been around for years. It's delicious, clean, and the staff are friendly.
AYI Bistro restaurant specializes in Sichuan cuisine. Really worth the experience.
Authentic Sichuan cuisine, reminds me of the taste of the restaurant I ate at when traveling in China. Highly recommend for those who want to experience the original Sichuan flavor.
The restaurant space is beautiful, cozy, the food is rich and flavorful. The staff is quite cheerful and cute!!! 10 points
Very good food, polite and attentive staff
I like the stir-fried vermicelli with shrimp and the shrimp spring rolls the most. The staff is quite enthusiastic and cute. I will come back to enjoy many more dishes.
Good food, handsome host!
Delicious food, clean restaurant

Update as as of April 2024 there's a whole new menu - I've posted photos under the menu tab

I was delighted to find Ayi Bistro open after their Tet Lunar New Year holiday as I was looking forward to sampling Sichuan cuisine again.
I was initially disappointed on my first visit as a few dishes were not available due to the extended Tet holiday break but this was soon dispelled by the quality of the food.
The mapu tofu with a few dashes of Chingkiang vinegar soon had my lips tingling delightfully for the duration of the meal.
The spicy wonton dumplings were utterly delicious and the double cooked pork with peppers and cucumber salad set each other off to perfection.
I probably ate too much rice but simply couldn't resist once it had soaked up all the cooking sauces.
I'll definitely return to try more items on the menu.

I saw the food in Da Nang recommended by the boss lady on Xiaohongshu. After trying it, I found it to be a good choice. So I came to try the restaurant opened by the boss lady herself. I didn't expect to be able to eat such authentic Sichuan cuisine in Da Nang. It tasted like what I had eaten in Chengdu. The restaurant is not big but clean and comfortable, and the price of the dishes is very reasonable, which is rare in Chinese restaurants overseas. I believe that such a sincere restaurant will definitely do better and better. Next time I come to Da Nang, I will definitely come to check in again.

I ordered malatang to be delivered because I heard it was delicious, but it was the worst.  The quantity is not half as much as that of other Malatang stores, it is not spicy, there is no cilantro or vegetables, and it tastes just like hotpot without even marinara.  It's just salty and tasteless. The soup only tastes like oil, with all the oil floating around in it.  Secondly, this has no taste, and it doesn't taste like Malatang.    The fried rice is pretty good, but since I ordered it for delivery, I ate two spoons and threw it all away because it wasn't tasty.    I uploaded a photo by mistake, but I couldn't delete it.
I traveled to Da Nang and was taken to this Sichuan restaurant by a friend. The food was delicious and easier to eat than I thought (I asked for less spicy).
Truly Delicious Sichuan Cuisine, friendly staff. Highly recommend for whom love Sichuan food

The fried rice has a small amount deep fried rice mixed in, so it has a nice crunch in every bit. Loved their spicy dumplings. I liked this place so much I can a 2nd time. Then I brought my sister and her friend. They also liked this place so we went once more. So I been here 4 x in a week.

It's delicious! It was so delicious that I kept adding more while eating.

This is my second visit in two years. It's still delicious, and the fried rice is generous.
The dumplings were drizzled with a strong prickly ash flavor, which I really enjoyed.
But those who don't like prickly ash might not like it.
Delicious, homestyle food with friendly service.

Friendly service
Delicious meals
Reasonable price

after spending more than a week eating vietnamese food, we decided to enjoy cooked food-- chinese food is good! the only thing I'd say is the food lacking the final wok flavor. it is tasty, but a punch of wok wouldn't hurt! the positive thing is, all the ingredients is very very fresh

The staff were lovely to me, and every piece of food i had was delicious! I didn't get a picture before i started eating, but here's halfway through😂 a little more expensive than what i usually go for, but i think it was worth the price. I would definitely reccomend.

After 9 days in Vietnam🇻🇳I finally had a full meal😋and ate it all
The authentic taste is recommended to friends who like to eat Sichuan taste😘
Finally found a proper Sichuan place in Vietnam! Can taste a real taste from Chengdu

I came here specifically to try pelmeni. Not in vain :) very tasty with beef and shrimp. The portions are small, so you need to order several dishes at once. It would be cool if there were assorted sets on the menu. The place is clean, neat, there were no people except me.

Came in and was seated outside even though there was an empty table inside. Waitress gave me a menu and then never came back. I waited twenty minutes and I saw her taking orders of customers who came to the restaurant after me.

Authentic Sichuan food, very fresh from the crust to each ingredient. Not too spicy and the tingling taste on the tip of the tongue is quite addictive. The restaurant is cozy, the staff is very enthusiastic and the owner is lovely. The spring rolls I ordered were very delicious, crispy and not greasy, I highly recommend trying them. The dipping sauce is introduced as chili powder made with a special recipe, only available at the restaurant. Location 10 points, space 9 points, food 10 points. I will invite more people to come! Thank you for giving me a delicious meal.

Da Nang’s best Chinese Sichuan food, friendly staffs and restaurant owner Nico makes dining an absolute joy 🤤🤤✨✨
Don’t sleep on these 👇🏼

Crispy and tender filled Special Fried Shrimp Rolls, hand-crafted Fried Shrimp Dumplings and Mapo Tofu elegantly put together with its homemade original Sichuan ingredients and Vietnamese cooking style (peppercorns made slightly less spicy)

Had 3 dishes for dinner and is perfect for 2 ❤️ Located right next to Pizza 4P’s and Ca Phe Muoi. Thanks for having us Ayi!

The aroma of wine is not afraid of the depth of the alley. For this store, it is completely in place. All kinds of Sichuan flavors are originated from Chengdu. The taste is great and the environment is elegant.
In addition, the proprietress is very nice and hospitable. The base ingredients in the store are all seasoned by the proprietress’s mother. I highly recommend it and the price is very reasonable.

After a few days having Vietnamese food around Da Nang, we decided to have a try in this Chinese restaurant, and it’s just being amazing! Fried drypot Shrimp is my favorite, it’s so fresh, crisp, tasty with different flavors all in once. (Sorry it’s not included in my photos.) Of course other dishes like the spicy fried dumplings and vegetables are delicious. The price is really good, even a bit low when you taking consideration of the taste. And the owner of the restaurant is just so kind and sweet, she provided a lot of travel tips around Da Nang and those tips are so helpful for us as tourists, making us feel so welcomed and grateful as international tourists to Da Dang.

If you are staying in Danang for a few days and seeking for some food apart from Vietnamese food, I would highly recommend taking a visit at this restaurant. As a native Chinese, I would say this restaurant is not only a good choice as Chinese cuisine in Da Dang, but also better than most of the Chinese restaurants back in the mainland of China, so please don’t miss it. You won’t be disappointed.

To sum up- if you need a little Szechwan chili pop on your taste bud, don’t hesitate to give it a try. They also provide non-spicy food for the kids.

It’s located at downtown, DaNang near the dragon bridge, so it’s easy to reach. The food here is really authentic Szechwan(or Sichuan) flavor. Plus the boss lady is really nice.
If you’re craving mala, I recommend mapo tofu.

I bought it with Grab and it arrived hot and quick. Shrimp dumplings, fried rolls, soup noodles (looks like dandan noodles), and mapo tofu were all delicious. Shrimp dumplings, a taste that Koreans will definitely love. Fried rolls, crispy and filling. Mapo tofu is spicy and spicy + slightly sour, so it has a bit of a kimchi stew feel. I want to eat it again, but today is the last day. Highly recommended to those who want to have a blood transfusion!!!

The delicious Sichuan food made me go back to China directly. The lady boss is kind and kind! 👍
Sichuan food is amazing! ! ! must try,Trust me!

delicious clean kind
best sichuan bistro in danang!
I had a proper Ma-Ra Su-Hyeol (Korean spicy food) treatment. When you're tired of Vietnamese food, I highly recommend the Mapo Tofu and Cucumber Salad.
Good Szechuan mouth numbing Chinese food!
Everything was great. We enjoyed everything and definitely recommend it.
Delicious traditional China food. Recommend to try it while you come to Da Nang. Very delicious Sichuan flavor, highly recommended

Pretty authentic mala dishes. Not overly spicy that you can't enjoy the food. Will recommend especially to Koreans who are tired of Vietnam food and wanted some Szechuan food during the colder winter months.

Mapo Tofu 99,000
Hand-shredded cabbage 79,000
Malatang (small) 145,000 comes with a bowl of rice

If you miss Chinese food when you come to Hong Kong, it is highly recommended to have a meal here! The two people in the picture are very filling and really delicious! Every dish is delicious!
Clean and delicious food. The shrimp dumplings are delicious. The owner is very friendly and the prices are reasonable. I highly recommend it!
Super delicious shrimp dumplings. If you order mala tang, they give you rice with it.
Delicious Chinese food. My husband and I enjoyed it and will certainly return. We tried the wonton soup, the beef with celery and the pan fried tofu.

This restaurant is a wonderful discovery. I ate shrimp wontons, one of their specialties, which were excellent. The service is impeccable. The place is clean and well-lit. You absolutely must try their pear-based dessert; it is simply divine.
The food here is wonderful. My wife and I liked everything here and a really good price too
Delicious and super nice service 🙌🏻🖤
A great restaurant! Delicious food from Sichuan, friendly staff and fast service! 10/10, I recommend!

I went on New Year's Day!
We ordered mapo tofu, stir-fried cabbage, seafood wontons, and fried rice!
Everything was delicious 😋
We have a palate cleansing service✨
I don't know the name, but it was sweet and delicious. I want to go again! Recommended ✴️

This is seriously so delicious. I wanted to eat spicy food while traveling in Vietnam, so I came looking for a Chinese restaurant. First of all, the mapo tofu is also spicy. So, we ended up eating spicy mapo tofu and spicy soup. It's really delicious!!!!!!! It's not that bland spicy soup, it tastes like real authentic Chinese spicy soup! There's a lot inside,,, and the shrimp dumplings are really crazy. It seems like they wrapped shrimp in minced pork and then used as dumpling skin. Anyway, I'm eating it now and I'm so impressed that I'm writing a review.

I went to this Bistro two times. The second time the owner came and she was super friendly. Both times the food was amazing. I am comming back for a third time and more! Amazing food and friendly staff
Delicious food, lovely host. Will definitely be back soon!

Cozy restaurant with fresh food that tastes homemade.
The staff was very welcoming and the service was fast.
The place is very clean and the atmosphere is chill.
Excellent sichuan food! The dumplings and double cooked pork are too good!
Visited Chengdu last month, and this restaurant reminds me of the food there - great mapo tofu!! And excellent dry pot, cabbage was good too!
Good authentic Chinese foods with perfect friendly services!

Everything I ordered was delicious. This was the only restaurant I visited twice during my trip, and I was so happy to have found it. It's friendly, clean, and, most importantly, delicious. Life is all about eating and drinking!
Yummy! Really love it 🥰🥰 …
great chinese food. best in the city imo. definitely get the crispy stir fried chicken

Real Chinese food here!
The service is so good, they even gave each of us Chè dưỡng nhan.
The first time I ate authentic Chinese food, I thought it wouldn't suit me, but it turned out to be surprisingly good.

It’s my first time in Da Nang. Before my friends arrived, I came here to look for my favorite Sichuan food. I also found it through Google. I ordered a whistle noodles and fried shrimp dumplings. The whistle noodles are very special because they have an extra plate of lettuce, but they taste good. The fried dumplings are whole shrimps wrapped in them. The fillings are also very plump and the bottom of the dumpling skin is crispy. In short, they are delicious. Don’t overstep the mark👍🏻👍🏻
Delicious Sichuan food, authentic Sichuan pepper flavor, can ask for less spicy
Clean and delicious. The food is delicious and reasonably priced.
Delicious food, good quality. Light space, quick staff. The food was so delicious that I didn't have time to take pictures hihi
The best Sichuan food you can find in Danang, order the cold noodles, you will never disappointed
Very delicious

Exactly like Sichuan food in Chengdu or Chongqing.
I ordered Dandan noodles and baozi and it was so good.

Plus they are super friendly and the price is reasonable. A+
That is best Chinesefood in Danang city, no doubt!!!!  Here has Lovely staff with good service, nice experience here with my family ! We gonna come back again
Food absolutely delicious,environment was comfortable and the staff very politely.You can get a chance to having your lunch or dinner here.
Have been to this restaurant. Delicious food and attentive service. I feel satisfied and will continue to support.
Authentic Sichuan flavor, high cost performance, love mapo tofu and shredded potatoes, the boss is a Sichuan girl

After playing for a few days, I got tired of pho and Korean food, and I felt alive again after eating some Chinese food. The臊仔面 and shrimp dumplings were really delicious. The store's interior was also very nice, and the prices were okay. I recommend it!

It was my first meal in Da Nang. I found it on Google Maps. It had air conditioning, and the dishes were delicious and authentic Sichuan style, especially the spicy red oil. The spicy red oil wonton tasted like Chengdu. The waitress was a young Vietnamese girl who spoke very good Chinese and communication was barrier-free. I went there again for lunch today.
Ok. Chinese food is a bit greasy.
The dumplings are good. The other dishes are a bit more bland than what I was used to in China.
Great food , tastes 🔥
It's really delicious. I recommend it. Next time I come to Da Nang for business, I will eat here again.

The Sichuan cuisine in this restaurant is delicious and authentic. The Malatang is not very spicy. I asked them why because the food in Vietnam is not that spicy. You can add more spiciness. The spicy chicken is also very good.

The restaurant space is small but clean, I like the way the staff cleans the tables and chairs neatly, the dimsum dishes here are delicious, the food is not too spicy, if you want to reduce or add more spiciness, just let the staff know, …
Delicious food, warm welcome and taking care from the staffs. It's good for tasting in this season.
I've eaten so many places but none can compare to this one, the spices and flavors are truly Sichuan, the desserts are also amazing, so delicious I ate it all without taking a picture ^^

A delicious Chinese place in Da Nang.
The portions are huge, worth the price. For two people, it costs about 100-200k/person, reasonable price. There are many options for spicy and non-spicy eaters. …
Delicious food, suitable for taste, airy space. The staff are cute, attentive service. SATISFIED ❤️
Delicious food, unique flavor. My favorite is the spring rolls. Good service.

Delicious and unique food. I used to eat Sichuan spicy hotpot, now I have heard about and tried dry hotpot :)) I ate it 3 times, the most impressive dishes were dry hotpot, ma ba tofu, shrimp dumplings and beef stew. The price is also quite reasonable, 2 people eat for about 300-400k, group of 4 eat for about 600-700k, full
The great place to enjoy Chinese food in Danang. Food tastes really fantastic. If you like spicy food, Xichuan Tofu with rice will make you go to this place over and over again.
It’s delicious and worth a try. If you don’t like Vietnamese food, you can come here to eat Chinese food.

Delicious food. This is real dim sum (not frozen industrial food)
Friendly service. Clean space. The price is a bit higher than the average but still worth the money.
5 star Sichuan Cuisine
I can't eat coriander. It's definitely not to my taste.

If you're in Danang and like Chinese food, give this place a try; the food is delicious and the service is excellent.

The food is delicious and the service is excellent.

It was easy to find and very friendly. I hate the smell of coriander, so I liked that it wasn't overpowering. I'm not sure what kind of dumplings you'd find in Vietnam, but I highly recommend it when you're tired of Vietnamese food.
Good sichuan cuisine. It is changed to suit the local taste.
craving Chinese food and found this restaurant, service is very good. food are tasty .  not a big menu but what they offer is authentic.

We had the shrimp wontons, fried shrimp rolls, buns, and bok choy. We were disappointed to find two items we wanted on the menu out of stock. The items were all okay but we have had better before. The fried shrimp rolls would benefit from detailing before frying as the tail is completely hidden in the roll and hard to remove gracefully.

I am a fan of chinese food. Especially mapo tofu. But the mapo tofu here was not in any way similar at all. Besides the hint of Chinese spices I could taste, the flavor was so bland.. so bland that it could be compared to drinking a drink that had all the ice inside melt down. And it was cooked long enough or with enough heat for the flavor to really stick to the tofu. The dumplings were also just okay. Not any real strong flavors as one would expect from Chinese cooking. I honestly thought that this place was just an imitation of Chinese cooking.

visit this lovely restaurant in Danang. The service is unmatched. Menu is extensive with a lot of options. The food is absolutely amazing – everything we tasted melted in our mouths. Who would of thought you’d find amazing Chinese in Vietnam.
The place is nice and the service was great, though, the food was just ok far away from Chinese taste. Specifically, Sichuan food was lacking spices.
Although the place is not big, the food tastes very good and is very satisfying.

Grab order
I made a reservation for delivery 2 hours in advance to get a massage and eat dinner, and ordered it to match the time I would return to the hotel after the massage.
While I was getting the massage, the driver called to say that he had arrived at the hotel, and I said I would pick it up at the reserved time. The driver kept calling me to tell me that he had to deliver the food, and I was upset that the food arrived earlier than expected and was cold, so I tried to send it back, but there was no solution.
I couldn't contact the restaurant because there was no phone number on Google.
Even in this heat, the cold mala-tang had oil floating on it, and of course it couldn't be delicious.
I happened to visit Yangang on May 1st in Binh Duong, Ho Chi Minh City. This restaurant is really delicious and worth recommending😀
Delicious food, good taste, reasonable price.
Very spicy 🥵
Good food, reasonable price
Very small portions(
Delicious meal! Would have stayed longer but they were out of beer. :)
Unbelievably good food. Have been in Da Nang for a week now and have come here three times. No matter what you order, you cannot go wrong!! Highly recommend
Delicious food. Noodles and dumplings are great.

The best restaurant I ate at during my 4 days and 3 nights in Vietnam
Best for Korean tastes
Especially the shrimp dumplings are really delicious!!!!
Highly recommended👍👍👍😁

It's great, although the space in the house is narrow, it makes up for the beautiful outdoor space. The food is very delicious, the staff is very friendly and enthusiastic. Because there were many mosquitoes in the yard, the staff brought fans and incense to burn the mosquitoes for us. Overall, it's super cool here <3

The food was tasty, especially the dumpling with beef and celery. We also tried the spicy chicken which was very flavourful but it was a bit weird having some bones in there so you have to be careful while eating it.
The atmosphere wasn't my favorit, due to too much white light and lack of decoration it looks more like a buffet/eatery than a restaurant.
I was surprised because a lot of reviewers mentioned the 'enthusiastic staff' but we did not meet them: the waitress was not enthusiastic at all, we had to wait 30 minutes for a rice while every other food was on the table because they were preparing some Grab orders. She did not even try to understand us and just gave us the 'no clue' face multiple times...it just takes out the fun part of the experience.

Food is ok, space is clean but a bit small, staff is enthusiastic
Will come back
The service is courteous. They serve authentic Chinese food (generally very spicy). However, the prices are quite high for Vietnam.
I ordered the spicy chicken and it was indeed very spicy but really good. travel partner ordered the cool noodles which were good but nothing too special. Really friendly staff and good prices.

The mapo tofu was a bit long. Must eat with rice
The shrimp dumplings are not steamed, but gyoza style.
Chicken is spicy and good
Wonton soup and dumplings are good too.
Overall, the food tastes good.

Came here due to the reviews and exceeded our expectations.  The ambiance is a little lacking, bright lights so we chose the patio with softer lighting.  However, the food and service was incredible.  This is definitely part of our Danang restaurant tour.  Highly recommended.
Ngonnn, large portions.

I’ve been here several times. The food is always amazing, and the best Chinese food I’ve had in Danang. The staff is super friendly and atmosphere nice and comfortable. Prices are also very good for the quality. 5 ⭐️!
Chinese food, spicy but a bit monotonous. Normal view. Lovely staff.
Delicious Sichuan food!
It's a Chinese restaurant, not Vietnamese, but it's delicious. It's a Sichuan restaurant, so it's a little spicy.
Cash only, the food was great!
This is by far the best food in Danang if your craving the lip tingling sizchuan flavour  that is hard to find in Vietnam weve been here 3 times in 24 hours ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

I saw this restaurant on Facebook so I decided to come here for Christmas. The restaurant space is quite small so it is cozy and very close. I haven't tried the whole menu yet :))) but in general, it's delicious and suits my taste, spicy and numbing.   Enthusiastic staff, hehe, if you don't know what to eat, the staff will advise you. 💯💯
Order through grab, we got it within half an hour. Noodle was still in perfect condition and everything was amazing!
Delicious Sichuan cuisine, mapo tofu and sauerkraut noodles are just right

Do yourself a favor and visit this lovely restaurant in Danang. The service is unmatched. Staff are extremely knowledgeable and make great recommendations. The staff truly cares about your experience. Menu is extensive with a lot of options. The food is absolutely amazing – everything we tasted melted in our mouths. Absolutely the best meal we had while in Danang. Highly recommend! 🥰❤️
Great food & service was excellent, a must place to wat in Da Nang

I went with my mom, forgot to take a picture when the dish came out 😂😂 only remembered after almost finishing eating. The price is acceptable, the food taste is delicious for me but my mom is not used to the pepper flavor and feels a bit numb, the staff is enthusiastic.
I have eaten here many times, the food is authentic Sichuan flavor, the staff is enthusiastic and attentive.
The food is authentic Chinese style, spicy from pepper, quite delicious, lovely staff, small restaurant but quite clean.
best Sichuan food ever 🤤🤤. Just go and try it.
Reasonable price, small but clean space, enthusiastic staff. Highly recommended Ma Po Tofu & spicy wonton 👏

It was clean, and it was a place where I could have a slightly different meal after eating Vietnamese food every day. The mapo tofu was really a rice thief... The shrimp dumplings were also delicious.
Mapo tofu and shrimp dumplings are very delicious~
I have been here several, this is a great place for Sichuan style food. My favorites are the mapo tofu and Sichuan style Mì Quang
I was so hungry that I thought of this while inhaling, so I hope it helps. Mala Xiang Guo, shrimp dumplings, mapo tofu, they're all delicious. Next time I'll try Mala Tang!

Ayi Bistro

A Chinese restaurant that impressed me a lot.

First, the price is extremely reasonable, each dish is about 60-80k, very reasonable for students
Second, the staff is extremely enthusiastic and attentive.
Third, the restaurant is small but the odor removal system is extremely good
Fourth, the food is super delicious, rich and quite similar to the original Chinese taste

The minus point is that the restaurant is small, the restroom is not very clean
Delicious lunch – fast, clean, and very friendly! Definitely recommend it.

川菜 or Sichuan cuisine is one of my favorite genres of cuisine. The main flavors are pungent, spicy, garlic and chili, with the addition of the Sichuan pepper, 花椒.

The hope with this restaurant was that I would get my Mala fix but unfortunately I was slightly disappointed.

Ordered the misappropriated xiao long bao (the version here is not a soup dumpling but a dry filing dumpling) and felt the filling to aspire but not fulfill the idea. A bit more heat from a seasoned pan might have given the bun some crispness, otherwise it’s nothing to write home about.

The dry pot chicken was well presented but similarly lacked the full flavor profile and most annoyingly had smashed chicken (similar to Da Nang fare) instead of distinct pieces of chicken thus leaving you in a minefield of bones that wreak havoc on dental work.

Would probably not go the chicken route if I ever come back but given other options, I think I would rather head to a higher end diner of the same genre and not risk my teeth!

I do thank the staff for asking for feedback at the payment point. I hope they one day get to visit Sichuan and learn from the wonders of this amazing Chinese province.

Best sichuan food I have ever had in my life.
Sauce was on point, food were super delicious, even better than luxury restaurant.
Nothing to complain with such an affordable price.

Staffs are friendly, they are kinda busy with delivery but managed to serve us with short waiting time (15 minutes).

Nice food and attentive staff.
Depending on the weather the restaurant become quite hot, I had to switch from inhouse to take away.
The price doesn’t match quality.

If you're craving Vietnamese food, this is the place to go and leave feeling incredibly satisfied. The wonton soup, which is almost like dumpling soup with just the right amount of seasoning, and the mapo tofu are recommended.
cute Vietnamese staff, authentic food, reasonable price. my husband loves eating here 🥰🥰 …

Find your appetite lost in the heat of Da Nang here👍🏼 The spicy wontan with a strong mala flavor was really delicious, and the stir-fried pork and vegetables were also delicious and perfect as a beer snack. The beer goes down smoothly~~~ When you get tired of Vietnamese food, try this place. I'm going to eat it again.
We had five different menus and each dish is so tasty and professional. Price is reasonable for that good quality. Strongly recommend for dumpling and mild spicy tofu!!!
It was delicious.
It has a slightly refined taste, but you can enjoy clean Sichuan-style Chinese food.

Incredible Sichuan restaurant. As someone who lived in Chengdu for 6 years, I haven’t had any authentic sichuan cuisine for over 2 years. I came here with high expectations after reading the reviews and it didn’t disappoint. The mapo dofu was perfect and the spicy wontons were amazing. The dumplings and xiao long bao were also spot on.

This is the best sichuan cuisine I’ve had outside of Chengdu and Chongqing, even compared to other cities in China!

The only disappointing thing for me was not being able to go back again and try the other dishes.

If you’re in Da Nang, I highly recommend this restaurant

Absolutely incredible Mapo Tofu, and great dumplings to pair with it. Many other things on the menu look great, but the Mapo is too addicting, cannot stop ordering. I don't even like tofu 😆. 100% recommend

First of all, it's delicious.
It's Chinese food, but it's different from Korean Chinese food.
It's slightly weaker than traditional Chinese food.
So it tasted just right to my taste.
If you ask for it to be done in traditional Chinese style, they will do it.
Two things were especially delicious.
Noodles and mapo tofu.
The noodles feel soggy, but if you eat them with soup,
It's just a taste that I'm craving.
The more you eat, the more delicious things come in.
Two bowls will be possible.
This is my first time trying mapo tofu.
Using very soft tofu, it melts in your mouth.
It breaks down gently and has a particularly spicy flavor.
It was very impressive.
If you like spicy food, slightly spicy.
You have to ask for it.
It would be even better if you order and eat cucumber salad together.
Shrimp dumpling dish is also good.
There is also a spicy stir-fried chicken dish, which is really spicy.
It definitely doesn't taste like Korean spicy chicken feet.
Because it is stir-fried with spicy peppers, dancho, sancho, etc.
When you eat it, you say “Wow!”
The chicken is cut into small pieces and fried before being stir-fried, so it is a bit hard and seems to go well with beer.

Since it's local, it's in Vietnamese, English, or Chinese.
You can order.
Great dumplings and Chinese food, the place deserves its high ratings. I wish them growth and find a bigger place to attract more customers
Very nice menu. Food tastes good especially Mapo tofu. The place is a bit hot. Hope they will fix the AC soon.

Great food. I went to the restaurant with my colleaguea. It's a big suprise when enjoying the food. I didnt think the food taste that good. Menu is well designed, offers lots of different dishes. Presentation is simple, clean and it does the job. Food quality is super. One of the best Chinese restaurant in the city. I will take my family here next time.

Friendly staff, afew can speak Chinese.
Food is good,  especially after days of vietnamese food lol

It was raining a lot, so I ordered delivery.

Shrimp dumplings: My child liked it the most.
Special shrimp roll: Highly recommended! (It has whole shrimp with the shells still on!)
Wonton noodles: Handmade dumplings in a light broth
Fried rice: Salty fried rice
Mapo tofu: It has a unique spicy flavor that is a bit different from the typical Mapo tofu at Chinese restaurants in Korea. It might not be too spicy for Koreans.

The delivery was super clean!!
Affordable price and satisfying taste.
This is the first restaurant that gives gum after a meal.

Special shrimp roll
You must try the Special Fried Shrimp Roll!

I recommend it.

I came here by chance when I saw it on Facebook. The restaurant is quite small, the space is a bit narrow. To be honest, I sent a message to the restaurant's page asking for the menu, but there was no reply. When I arrived at the restaurant, it was empty, so I don't understand why I didn't see any reply to the page's message. Ordered 3 dishes: Ma Ba Tofu, Wonton Soup, Special Dumplings. Ma Ba Tofu is soft, fatty, and moderately spicy because you can choose the level of spiciness. The wonton soup is super delicious, clear, and slightly sweet. Special Dumplings, in my opinion, are normal. Total cost 245k. Will come back.

Authentic Sichuan cuisine, modified to suit your taste.
The food is delicious!
All the food was bursting with just the right amount of flavor

The shrimp dumplings and wonton soup were delicious👍

The other dishes were also above average.

Will definitely visit again😊

Small, clean restaurant, central location.
I ordered Ma Ba Tofu, Mixed Hotpot and Cucumber Salad. The taste is quite good, you can adjust the spiciness. I ordered medium spicy but it was not too spicy, those who can eat spicy should order the standard Sichuan spicy level, it will be more delicious. Cheap compared to the general level, about 50-80k/dish. The 3 dishes above + 1 pot of jasmine tea cost about ~320k.
The staff is knowledgeable about cuisine and enthusiastic in consulting.
Will come back.
P/s: If the restaurant reads this, I suggest just playing normal Chinese music, no need to change to US-UK music.
Lovely food only they should have prepare some rice for the lunch hour rather than to cook them when I ordered
Truly chinese food, Sichuan.
This place is da bomb! Best dumplings in Da Nang hands down.
Very delicious and very cheap! Great service!
The taste is pretty average, but what I can't understand is that a serving of dry pot shrimp costs nearly 150,000 yuan, and there are only 8 shrimps in it?

I ate Mala Tang, Mala Xiang Guo, cold noodles, tomato egg stir-fry, and shrimp dim sum. First of all, the price is cheaper than other Chinese restaurants. And Mala Tang is on the salty side. There is a 15% discount event going on right now. It is very clean and the friendly staff speak Vietnamese well.
The atmosphere is nice, but the food is not tasty. They changed the chef... I don't think I'll go there again.
Excellent dinner with authentic Central Vietnamese flavor. Open space, fragrant, romantic sea view.
The food was delicious and the staff were kind and helpful.

Flying Fish Restaurant is truly a wonderful destination with an open, airy space, a view of the blue sea and a cool breeze - extremely ideal for relaxing and enjoying the cuisine. The food here is delicious, especially the fresh seafood is richly prepared and delicious. The staff is lovely, quick to serve and always smiling, creating a very comfortable feeling. The restaurant also has an outdoor area by the sea, watching the sunset super romantic, extremely suitable for dating or gathering with friends. It is worth a visit!
Bad restaurant, low quality food, don’t suggest.
beautiful
First time experiencing the restaurant here, I must say I am very satisfied with the service here. Traditional Vietnamese dishes. Great space, very suitable for experiencing
I had a great experience at this restaurant. The space is very luxurious, the food is delicious, the staff is enthusiastic. I will definitely come back here to enjoy.

I did not stay at this resort, I just happened to stop by and eat at the Flying Fish Restaurant. I was surprised by the quality of service here, the food was delicious, especially the Hoi An chicken rice. The restaurant has a spacious, cool space, the soft music is very suitable for the vibe of the restaurant. The staff here are very dedicated and attentive, I had a lot of requests but they were still happy to meet them. Service 9.8/10!!! Will definitely have the opportunity to visit this restaurant again!!

The restaurant has a cozy space, delicious food, rich flavors and beautiful presentation. The staff is enthusiastic, friendly, always ready to support customers. This is an ideal destination for those who love cuisine and want to experience professional service.
Delicious food, enthusiastic staff

I had a great experience at Ca Chuon Co restaurant, the staff were very enthusiastic, the food was delicious, a compliment to the chefs. I will come back to the restaurant when I have the chance. Highly recommend everyone!!!

We enjoyed our first meal here so much that we ate at the restaurant 3 times during our stay at the Premier Villages.  A massive thanks to the staff who really made the experience wonderful.  The restaurant is a lovely place to eat with some views to the beach and super comfortable.  All our meals were fantastic and the 3 of us ordered different things each time we ate here and were never disappointed.  Le Hong looked after us and the recommendations he made for us on our last night at the hotel were exceptional.  We will always remember his wonderful service.

Have had three amazing meals during our stay, each one quite different but all have been fabulous.  It is nice to have restaurant that focusses on Vietnamese foods cooked to perfection and not the usual bland hotel fare.  We were served by Anthony and he really treated us like kings and queens. Would highly recommend the wontons, not and all what we expected.  Anthony recommended we have the fish and we let him make the choice for us.  A whole groper steamed in a soy broth.  It absolutely melted in the mouth.  Even the skin was delicious and I don't usually eat fish skin. Thank you Anthony for taking such good care of us and we are sure you will have a wonderful future in hospitality, your passion shines through.

Upon entering, the beautiful surroundings immediately set a promising tone, and the food was absolutely delicious, truly a highlight. However, the atmosphere suffered from a lack of an outdoor space to escape the indoor noise of guests walking through to the beach side or the moving of tables setting up groups for dining.

While the staff were undeniably friendly, the service often felt disconnected. Despite their presence, we consistently had to flag someone down, as no one seemed dedicated to our table. This led to a significant wait for our food, and even some drinks being missed from our order, even during what started as a quiet period before becoming steady. Our Vietnamese friend's quick eye was essential, catching an error on the bill.

Despite these service hiccups, the lovely shuttle service back to the main gate offered a pleasant end to our visit.

This place has immense potential, especially if the service can match the warmth of its friendly staff and the quality of its delightful cuisine.

The food is diverse, delicious, attentive service, and affordable compared to other resorts along the coast of Da Nang. In addition to Vietnamese dishes such as Hoi An chicken rice, mixed salads... You can order pizza, pasta, fried chicken... from the restaurant next door to bring to you. There is fresh beer brewed from the factory of Ba Na mountain resort, delicious, priced at 80,000 VND/cup.
Enthusiastic service staff
great weekend experience
Good will come back if have a chance
Good service, delicious food, nice view
Delicious food, attentive service
The beach is visible and the place is friendly. You can bring in food for those who can't eat local food♡

The dishes are skillfully prepared, rich in flavor, especially seafood - always fresh and beautifully presented. The staff is professional, friendly, always ready to support customers wholeheartedly. This is the perfect choice for memorable meals with family or loved ones.

🌟 “A wonderful experience! The restaurant has an extremely impressive sea view, enjoying food while watching the sunset is unbeatable. The food is delicious, beautifully presented and very delicate in flavor. The staff is extremely friendly, attentive and professional. Will definitely come back!” 🌊🍽️✨
I just had a very happy experience at the restaurant, the food here is delicious, seasoned to taste. Very suitable for families to come to parties and meetings
There was no breakfast place at Lemongrass, so I ate here. It's small, but it's nice because it has a beach view. ㅎㅎ
The food and the atmosphere were both great
Delicious food, attentive staff, beautiful sea view, my family had a wonderful dinner

The food was delicious, but the service was terrible. I didn't have any cutlery at all. After I reminded them, the ones I didn't need were not what I needed. Then the waiter kept pretending to be busy and couldn't find anyone. Overall, it wasn't delicious enough to make a special trip, and the price wasn't particularly affordable.
Enthusiastic service, delicious food
Service was amazing, all waitresses are attentive. Food is excellent; fresh and delicious. Thanks to the manager and the chef to serve us the best meal today.
Delicious food, beautiful sea view, enthusiastic staff, thank you Thuong
Very fresh and extremely tasty seafood. The best bingsu I’ve ever had! The mangos were so fresh. Are here everyday during our stay at Premier Village

Tried the Ocean Breeze buffet for the first time and the food was delicious even though the spread is not a lot. The half lobster for each diner was fresh and delicious with tender meat. The oysters and sashimi were fresh and succulent. Dessert section doesnt have a lot of choices though. Ambience was good with live band performing. Service was prompt and friendly. Comes with free beer and soft drinks too. Highly recommended!

I just had a meal experience at the Flying Fish Restaurant, the food is beyond words, extremely suitable for many people's taste, not only that, the staff also enthusiastically introduced the restaurant's signature dishes. It is worth trying when you come to Da Nang.

Pros
- The view was amazing. It was a windy day so we had to sit inside.
- Their barista knows how to make a good mojito.

Cons
- We ordered seafood tower or whatever they called it. Unfortunately it was overcooked. Grilled prawns and lobsters were extremely dry. mussels and claims were mediocre.
- They forgot my drink when we moved to the other table
- Staff couldn’t recommend me their signature dish. Wondering if they have any signature dish?
Mango dessert in front of the sea is good
Luxurious, comfortable restaurant

First, I want to talk about some positive things. The restaurant is located inside of a resort. Upon arriving the staff picks you up with a small car and drives you to the restaurant. The restaurant looks very nice, the tables are very clean and you can see the sea depending on where you were sitting. Bathrooms were also very clean and well maintained. Our mocktails were nice also the size is very small, about 200ml.

Unfortunetely, that was all there is to say regarding the positive aspects.
The staff does not communicate well and is not well trained in English. We chose to apertisers and two main dishes. Out of our four choices, one apertiser and one main dish were not available, which is very sad considering the restaurant was empty.
The food wait time was about 20 minutes which is very good. My chicken was served cold. I asked and it is supposed to be like. It lacked seasoning and taste. My partner ordered noodles with spicy beef. The beef was raw. There was water poored over the noodles and beef and thats it. Also lacked taste. You have to consider that we paid almost 40 dollars in total which is a lot in Vietnam so our expectations were high but not met at all.

I just cannot recommend this restaurant and would advise you to look elsewhere

Saw reviews of this place on trip advisor
After some significant effort booking a table we arrived for dinner.
Orders were taken promptly.
However once the food order was taken the staff were back twice to say certain items were no longer available.
Seems the kitchen and wait staff were not communicating making the decision for the order longer.
Food ordered was mostly average tasting even though it was well presented.
The atmosphere was rather dead even though outside they had a large party with karaoke and BBQ.
The staff never came back to offer dessert or further drinks

At 11pm nothing left to do but get the bill.

Overall an Uninspiring meal in what should have a been a first class environment.

Would not return
I was really impressed with Ca Chuon Co seafood restaurant. The dishes here taste very delicious and rich. The staff is enthusiastic and gives advice, the restaurant space is very cozy

Our family really loved Da Nang and chose a random restaurant that was on the top of Tripadvisor, the Flying Fish Restaurant - a very strange name, really as expected, the restaurant has a sea view very close to the sea, fresh and delicious food, the staff is very open and friendly, introducing us a lot about the restaurant's cuisine, this was a great experience, I will come back and introduce more to my friends

Ly Han Trinh was very friendly and helpful! She gave us excellent advice and made us feel very comfortable!
The food was excellent, and we'd love to come back!
Overpriced but good quality seafood.
Great service lots of fresh selections,
