Nice view, good food, I'm feeling satisfied
Woof
Very nice dinner and cocktails and very good value. Nhi was a very nice host who made us comfortable and gave us great service. Thank you, Darin and Michelle from Australia 😊

I had dinner at the resort and then had mango bingsu. It was so delicious. ~ Dinner was also delicious. I should have taken pictures when it was pretty, but the kids couldn't help it and ate it all up^^

I had a week of vacation at Premier Danang, I had lunch and dinner at this restaurant.
The view is extremely luxurious, the space is quiet, it's okay for families or couples
The fried dishes are extremely delicious, you should try any fried dish
The white rice is sticky, the stir-fried vegetables are also delicious, the grilled pork cheeks are very ok.
The seafood is fresh, the squid, shrimp, fish, and clams are all big and sweet
The mixed drinks are not delicious, especially the crushed ice, it's very thin, only has the smell of milk and ice. I used it for 3 days and the taste was not good
The soup is a bit bland, thin compared to my taste
Good service, very professional staff, fresh seafood and fast service. Excellent. I will definitely come back next time.
The restaurant has a cool, clean sea view. The staff is enthusiastic and attentive. The food is fresh, delicious, suitable for family experience and entertaining guests.

Food was overall good
It was expensive compared to downtown Da Nang
I visited with a baby and the waiting time between meals was too long, so it was difficult
The staff was friendly and provided a variety of food. Trinh was very friendly and accommodating.
Overpriced but good quality of food.  Great services

I liked this restaurant because their service was great, they had a very long selection of food in the menu, they had a sea view and very exquisite dishes such as the stir-fried Crab meat with vermicelli noodles and a lot more dishes for other people to try.
Delicious food, good service, very satisfied with the meal
Thanks to the meticulous care of the trinh staff, 3 families and 9 people had a pleasant dinner.

I come to the restaurant almost every week, the most impressive thing is the extremely friendly staff. The food is delicious and beautifully presented. The dishes are beautiful, the space with a sea view is very romantic. Tonight I tried some new dishes of the restaurant, the seasoning is very delicious.
The worst restaurant I've ever been. Staffs, food, unclean dishes. . . . . worst of worst.

I wanted to take my husband out for a nice seafood dinner for his birthday and found this restaurant on Trip Advisor.  I had to change the reservations a couple times, but they were very responsive on the Google chat function.

We were a little worried when we got to the restaurant initially.  It's located in a resort, so you had to take a shuttle to the restaurant from the parking lot.  We walked in and no one else was in the restaurant (Thursday night).  Luckily we stuck with it and the food was finely prepared and delicious.  We had the rice noodle with seafood (fresh with chopped seafood), sweet and sour green mango and crispy flying fish (great flavors and textures),  stir-fried crab meat with vermicelli noodles (not a lot of crab, but had a tasty smoky flavor) and Nha Trang sturgeon marinated with galangal & tumeric (great sauce, topped with dill, and came with rice paper to wrap with some lettuce and vermicelli noodles).  Although it was more expensive than most restaurants in Da Nang, it's worth the ambience (and AC!) and well prepared meal. Unfortunately the sun had already set so we couldn't see the beach.  They even brought out a cake with candle for the birthday celebration.
Attended the lobster feast and seafood buffet last Saturday, absolutely delicious food and wine served with love from friends. Always great 😍
The lobster was delicious, the restaurant had a large selection of food, very pleasant and attentive staff, beautiful interior. The coffee is great

It's located inside a resort, so you can enjoy your meal while taking in the ocean view. The Bibim Rice Noodles with Flowers were more visually appealing than delicious. Everyone thoroughly enjoyed the Seafood with Lobster. It was fresh and the sauces paired well. The Morning Glory was, of course, excellent.

The staff is disrespectful to customers. There are small children but they ask rude questions. They tell them to get food like adults but they say everyone eats only lobster? Does that mean the children can't eat that? Or can't eat it?

Amazing restaurant and only found it by googling fresh seafood restaurants in da nang. Beautiful view of the ocean and food was the best we have had here. Service was impossible to fault and our waiter Van was so sweet and friendly. Definitely recommend.

We had our lunch here, we have enjoyed as it's delicious. The service we've received was excellent especially from Ms. Dao, she explained very well the food on the menus and also very attentive on our request. We highly recommend this restaurant.
Delicious food, reasonable price. Clean, cool restaurant, beautiful space. Friendly and enthusiastic staff. Can't complain about anything ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Restaurant with nice view, delicious food
Great, luxurious space, delicious food. Million dollar sea view.
Quiet atmosphere, delicious food, and especially good service. NHI staff is very friendly. Recommended.
This is the most wonderful restaurant in Danang. The papaya salad with beef was over the top delicious. The service was 5 star. If you are in Danang this place is a must 🥰
Near the sea. nice view.

4 of us treated ourselves to dine in at the Flying Fish restaurant. The food was amazing, we ordered 4 starters, 4 mains and shared 5 sides which were all brilliant alongside a couple bottles of wine. It was a quiet Monday evening so the atmosphere wasn’t great but the restaurant and surrounding Esco beach was beautiful. Thank you so much to Phuong who waited on us, she really ensured we had a great experience and looked after us!
Love the atmosphere, staff is so nice to me mention Ms Phuong !

No need to waste your time in this restaurant. I never received my order.
The experience was a complete disappointment!
It's great to be able to taste traditional Vietnamese cuisine. Accor Plus discount. 50% off for 2 adults, 33% off for 3 adults.

A relatively quiet and leisurely restaurant. Compared with the other one in the hotel, I like the atmosphere and dining scenery here more. The food is delicious. The unique aroma of Vietnamese coffee is also unforgettable. The waiters' smiles and service are very good.
Really good vietnamese steam fish with reasonable prices. If you want to chill or enjoy with friends, it is a perfect location with an amazing view on the beach. …
The food is fresh and delicious, but the service is too slow, the waiting time between dishes is quite long so I'm not very comfortable.

The food at Ca Chuon Co Seafood Restaurant was good, and the staff were excellent, really attentive and made us feel welcome. We did have a little trouble with the frozen dessert, but the staff quickly noticed our struggle and provided us with alternative options, which was a really nice touch. While the prices are definitely on the higher side, it's a great option if you're looking to experience fine dining and enjoy some quality seafood. Overall, a great experience!

We found this restaurant by mistake as we were coming back from the marble mountains. We ordered the "catch of the day" and it was amazing, totally recommend you to ask about the fish they have available as they don't list it on the menu.
The service is amazing, they make sure they serve you some starters and an extremely polite and kind service from Nguyen who took care of us for the night.
The restaurant is by the sea, great atmosphere surrounded by palm trees and the waves crashing while you enjoy the food.
We also tried their coffee, sea salt coffee was a first experience for us and we loved it.

The food is ok. We had such amazing food in Vietnam that we could not really appreciate the food here. The view is amazing..it is right on the beach and in a wonderful property but definitely you can enjoy better food around.
Good place for seafood, can definitely be recommended. We enjoyed a delicious lunch. Has a nice view of the beach. Especially friendly and good service!

Everything was delicious, we discovered new flavors, local dishes and were amazed. The setting is beautiful and elegant, the place is of a reasonable size and the atmosphere is even intimate (because it is not very busy in my opinion).
The staff present were very professional, attentive and pleasant (we would like to warmly thank Truong, our hostess who was more than perfect and gave very good advice).
We benefited from the special menu called buffet and were therefore able to taste almost all the dishes on the special menu. The chef even offered us a local specialty off the menu. My companion who was there mainly to accompany me loved everything.
They made the menu of the other hotel restaurant available for our children, which meant that everyone was satisfied.
Worthy of a high-end restaurant.
Very good value for money
Thanks to the whole team.
Good

Great for relaxation and beach activities.
Breakfast is rich and high quality.
The manager Duc is extremely friendly and professional.  The views from this restaurant are outstanding and the cappuccinos are great!
The staff is very friendly guys ❤️❤️❤️
Delicious food, friendly staff
Friendly staff, delicious food.
Restaurant with nice view. Delicious food, friendly staff.

The space is luxurious but feels cozy, and the service of a 5-star resort is also different.
Enjoy the Buffet at a reasonable price.
Delicious food, very friendly staff. Highly recommended!
Enjoy every bite.

Delicious food and friendly service
We had a very pleasant visit – the food was delicious and lovingly prepared, and the staff were consistently friendly and attentive.
Very fresh tasting and perfectly cooked filet of salmon. The deep fried salmon roll with avocado was delicious as well. Service was fast & friendly, highly recommend!
Tasty tan tan ramen and good quality rolls🍱🍣
We really liked the food And wiskey cocktail. Not cheap as most Vietnamese food.

The food is delicious and fresh, everything you order is delicious, the restaurant is clean, although a bit small, the price is reasonable, the service is enthusiastic and quick, you should order beef and mushroom udon noodles, it's super delicious
Food (fish, oyster) is not fresh, when I told them they just give me that sweet smile😊😊. I'm not a happy camper …

Hands down the best sushi experience I’ve had! Everything was incredibly fresh, beautifully presented, and absolutely delicious. You can really taste the passion and skill from the brothers in the kitchen – every dish was prepared to perfection.

A special shout-out to Bina, our waitress, who made the night even better with her warm personality, attention to detail, and genuine care. The service was flawless from start to finish, and the atmosphere was welcoming and vibrant.

Absolutely the best sushi I’ve ever had! The fish was unbelievably fresh, every bite melted in my mouth, and the presentation was spot on. The chefs clearly take pride in what they do – you can taste the quality and care in every roll. The service was friendly, attentive, and made the whole experience even better. If you’re a sushi lover (or even just curious), this place is an absolute must-try. I’ll definitely be coming back!

We went here as we wanted to have some refreshments outside Vietnamese food. We came a bit too early before opening hours, but one of the chef let us sit to choose our menu while they were preparing for their open hours. This small act was really making an impact for us, showing how passionate and kind they are as a person. Food were definitely delicious and fresh, we ordered some sushi dishes along with ramen. Ramen portion were quite big, and sushi were made fresh in front of you and chefs were making it carefully each pieces. It’s a small restaurant but it feels intimate, waitress were also ready at all times to help and even made a small talk with us. It’s located just at the side of the street. Honestly I could say that we were glad we found this restaurant!

If you’re in Da Nang and love Japanese food, Ichiban Sushi is a must-visit gem! We came here to celebrate my girlfriend’s birthday and were instantly wowed — from the moment you see the glowing red lanterns outside to stepping into the warm, authentic Japanese-inspired interior, it feels like a little escape to Japan right in the city.

We went all in with the food (just check the photos!) — fresh sashimi, melt-in-your-mouth sushi, creative rolls, perfectly crisp fried dumplings, and steaming bowls of ramen so massive we had to share one. The flavors were spot-on, portions were generous, and every bite tasted fresh and well-prepared. We even enjoyed two smooth whiskey cocktails to top off the night.

And here’s the kicker — all of this came to under 750k! For the quality, quantity, and atmosphere, it’s an unbeatable deal in Da Nang. Whether you’re here for a casual dinner, a date night, or a special celebration, Ichiban Sushi delivers an experience that will have you planning your next visit before you’ve even left.

⭐ Fresh, delicious, and affordable
⭐ Beautiful Japanese-inspired décor
⭐ Massive ramen bowls worth sharing
⭐ Amazing value for money
⭐️ Fast and Amazing Service
Everything was delicious, fast and fresh. The sashimi was excellent. And the prices were reasonable.
Frankly wonderful for eating roll & sushi
Lovely fresh Japanese with friendly attentive service. Recommend

Super delicious~

Don't think of the kind of sushi you eat in Korea. Even though I ordered it as a single item, the sushi smelled.

They took out the sashimi and used the fish for sushi, but all the sashimi had lost their color. (Tuna, salmon, sea urchin, etc.)
It was to the point where I wondered if it was even edible.

I used to work at a salmon sashimi restaurant, but this was the first time I'd seen something like this.
The person making sashimi didn't even know how to hold the rice properly, and he would grab the sushi and slurp it several times.

There was a reason there were no customers in the restaurant.
I also ordered tempura, and it was worse than what the part-timers made.

The roll was great, but the soups were rather bland....
I give only 3 stars due to the lack of service:
1. waiters insisted on sitting at only one exact table, however we were only the guests at the restaurant
2. we had finished and sat at the table full of empty plates for 15 minutes before and the waiters didn't care about it but they started cleaning the table immediately after the payment process and in a jiffy opened the door like inviting us to go go go...

NT$550
What a deal

Best sushi I've ever eaten. The freshest fish. The prices are good, we chose between the buffet and this pestle and it is much better. Firstly, we ate much cheaper than we would have paid at the buffet, and secondly, it’s a whole show, watching how the rolls are prepared for you.
So nice and fresh!!!
delicious

I could give this a 10, I would! Incredibly delicious, everything is so fresh. The sushi is mostly fish/seafood, not rice.

In my opinion, this is the best Japanese food in Da Nang. I'm from the Far East and know the taste of quality seafood, and this place is simply impeccable.

This will be the first place I visit when I return to Da Nang ♥️

Excellent Japanese sushi bar! Always fresh ingredients. The best rolls in Da Nang.
Please add all available sushi rolls to the Grab delivery menu. 🙏
If you like Japanise food you should definitely to come here 😋😋😋I like it!
Here you can see your food getting cooked in front of you. Delicious meals and friendly staff.
Cool space, delicious food.
Best meal I've had in my 5 weeks in Vietnam. I didn't want to leave this place. Service was also great. I got half salmon half salmon belly sashimi. Ended up ordering another portion.

This place is legit. The staff and the quality of the fish are a highlight. Great wasabi and the salmon belly was delightful. Also ordered the waygu—delightful and perfectly prepared. Truly so high-quality and the cuts were beautiful. I used to live in Japan and I feel like I am transported right back. The chef takes special care of the preparation of the fish. Everything is so thoughtfully prepared and hygienic. I really enjoyed our meal and will come back again soon.
Actually, this is my favorite place, but today the staff's attitude made me very disappointed when instead of apologizing, she spoke quite unpleasantly. Very sad about this experience
Very tasty! 10/10! I recommend it to everyone, you won't regret it! This is one of the best restaurants in the city!

This is the best Japanese food place we've seen in Da Nang! It's really cool that they cook the rolls right in front of you. The most delicious red fish is right here, you can also order takeaway and delivery, we've been there 3 times and everything is great🍱

The moment when one opens an iron suitcase with ice and fresh fish of different varieties, in another part seafood. Carefully wipes the table and wets his fingers. The products are all fresh and melt in your mouth. We went twice during the vacation and were very pleased.
Excellent sushi restaurant, delicious sashimi - so much to choose from. Read the reviews and were really glad we tried it. We will definitely come and visit again.

Salmon and tuna are delicious. Salmon belly is delicious on its own~ The roll is also deliciousㅎㅎㅎ It seems like there aren't many customers because they're afraid of raw fish in a hot country. However, it was as fresh as the sushi I eat in Korea. Very satisfied.

The owner should think about the number of cooks. One cook for the whole restaurant, at some point I even felt sorry for the cook, he could barely cope alone. The food is delicious. But I waited for my food for 40 minutes
Thank you, I had a good time.
The sushi was delicious, and the edamame, gyoza, and seaweed salad were also highly recommended. I'll be back.
cozy little eatery. the food is beyond my expectations. very fresh ingredients

I mean dammmmnnnnnm!!!! This is hands down the best sushi I have had so far in Danang! The salmon melted in my mouth like butter and the salmon belly melted in my mouth like butter with butter on top. The wide variety of rolls was good to see, as that is something not too many sushi restaurants in Vietnam excel at. Then the masterpiece of the night was the Wagyu A5 beef that was even more melty than the salmon belly and was seasoned perfectly.
Top notch!

Probably one of the best Japanese restaurant in Da Nang. I went here back in 2/9, and my experiences there was extremely pleasant. The staffs are friendly and polite, while the atmosphere and the ambience is just relaxing, fits for people who wants to have a meal in private like me. I ordered Gyoza (i forgot to take a picture of this), 2 sushi, a sashimi uni and a cup of orange juice, all for about less than 300k VND, which is really affordable. The sushi and sashimi are very fresh and delicious, while the Gyoza is a little crunchy on the bottom. Also another thing that i also like is that they put just enough wasabi for you to not feeling too much spicy, while also enough for you to taste the freshness of the fish.
I highly recommended this place. Definitely will comeback again in the future.

I and my husband had the Christmas dinner here. A boat of sashimi’s  and a bottle of hot sake lighted up the warmth of our heart for the holiday! And it stayed in our memories of Vietnam trip.

This sushi bar offers a variety of delicious sushi, from traditional sushi to creative and unique sushi dishes. Sushi is made on site and served directly, delicious. Professional and enthusiastic service staff. I am satisfied with my experience here.

Really delicious!

We come for dinner and the stuff was so kind a specially the chef. He was so nice and helpful and he gave us special bites to try in the house. Thank you very much!

Best sushi I had in Vietnam, I rarely write a review but this restaurant is worth a compliment here. Sushi melting in every bite and the miso soup is not as salty as other restaurants I have been to. 10/10 for quality and service. For sure quality is the best marketing:).
We will for sure return :).
Best Japanese restaurant in town. Highly recommended
Great place, HIGHLY recommend, went to other places in da nang. This us by far the best!! Great quality great atmosphere, def come again
Excellent sushi made fresh. Actually, on second thoughts, this is the best sushi I’ve ever eaten. Amazing.

Rare salmon sushi aka torched salmon nigiri with some sauce on top is delicious! Their eel texture and flavor is very good, their scallops are nice. I’m not a fan of the shrimp personally. Good sushi place where all of the fish had good texture and freshness. None were stringy. Does not stand out or have fatty tuna/salmon options.
Food was good and ambiance was very nice!
Very friendly staff and amazing food was a very good experience.

I keep coming back

NOT FRESH FOOD = FOOD POISONING
Reheated not freshly prepared, increases the bacteria content in food.  Have eaten there 3 times over the last 2 years and each time sick.  Stupid of me to try again, but invited by friends and I assumed the restaurant fixed things.
WARNING EVERYONE the flavors in overly seasoned foods such as Indian covers up many poor quality ingredients and spoilage, well after the food is no longer safe to eat.
Food handling in Vietnam is very poor.
Have eaten in other branches of this restaurant and never a problem.
Regularly eat Indian food, there are much better Indian restaurants in DaNang which are not risky to eat at.

I just had a superb dinner at Ganesh Da Nang. The Chicken tikka was succulent & soo flavourful & served with salad. I also ordered tandoori vegetables & again mouth-wateringly delicious & enough for 2 people easy. I said HOT & the waiter referred me to the cover of the menu which showed different numbers of red chilli’s- I chose the hottest & it was bang on. The heat complimented the flavours but didn’t drown them out or make me hiccup!  The staff were friendly, attentive & courteous. My meal was delivered without a long wait. This is the 5th Indian restaurant I’ve been to in Da Nang & I didn’t bother to review the others.

I wish I could give more stars!!!! Best Indian food I’ve ever had! We got the coconut chicken curry and a delicious fish dish. The garlic naan was massive. SO TASTY! Also Air conditioning inside. Definitely eat here!

I stumbled upon Ganesh Indian restaurent in Danang, and it was love at first bite! This Indian restaurant serves authentic, mouth-watering dishes that transported me back to the streets of India.

The food is incredibly delicious, with each dish prepared to perfection. From the chicken biryani to the rich, creamy palak paneer, every bite was a flavor explosion. The basmati rice, naan bread, and papadum were all cooked to perfection.

- Authentic Indian flavors, just like back home!
- Generous portion sizes and excellent value for money
- Friendly and attentive staff, happy to accommodate requests
- Cozy ambiance, perfect for a relaxing dinner

Good food and great service. Will revisit again.

The staff here are incredibly friendly, kind, and accommodating, providing excellent service that truly stands out. From the moment I arrived, they made me feel welcome and well taken care of. Their attentiveness was impressive, regularly checking in to ensure everything was to my liking.

The food was absolutely delicious, far exceeding my expectations. Each dish was not only flavorful but also beautifully presented. The portions were generous, leaving me feeling fully satisfied without breaking the bank. The atmosphere of the place added to the experience—tastefully decorated and inviting, it made my meal all the more enjoyable.

I have no complaints; everything was simply divine. The combination of great service, delicious food, and a charming setting makes this a place I highly recommend. I will definitely be returning for another visit when I want Indian food!

They also accept credit cards, including contactless tap and pay digital wallet payments via phone, without any annoying surcharges. That alone will keep me coming back! Only downside is the background noise -- whether nearby construction, employees on audible devices, kitchen bells ringing, etc. I will come back here again when in the mood for Indian food.

My recent dining experience at Indian Restaurant Ganesh Da Nang was truly exceptional. The food was outstanding, bursting with authentic Indian flavors that were both rich and satisfying. Each dish was meticulously prepared and wonderfully flavorful, showcasing the culinary expertise of the chefs.
The service at Ganesh was equally impressive. Our server was attentive, courteous, and ensured that our dining experience was enjoyable from start to finish. Their professionalism and friendly demeanor added a personal touch to our visit.
Even our 2-year-old child loved the food, which speaks volumes about the restaurant's ability to cater to diverse palates, including those of young children. It’s not every day that you find a place where both adults and children can enjoy their meals so thoroughly.

Overall, I highly recommend Indian Restaurant Ganesh Da Nang for anyone seeking delicious Indian cuisine in a welcoming environment. We look forward to returning and savoring more of their delightful dishes!

Update, Dec 2033.

I used to love this restaurant ever since it opened. It is now openly contemptuous and racist to non-Indian patrons.

The food is now average at best and totally lacks flavour and kick. Neither the manager nor the waiter could be bothered addressing my complaint that the food was tasteless. The waiter warmed it up - end of story. Regrettably, I will not be back.

If you're not Indian, you may wish to think twice before visiting. If you are Indian, the place is pretty good if you like bland food and racist company.

Because there are many Indians holidaying in Da Nang now, the Indian restaurants do not want non-Indian customers. Your wish is my command, Adieu.

----------

Previous update - Truly fabulous restaurant that cannot be faulted on its food. Now let's discuss the Indian diners... I accept that cultures are different and I've been to India several times. The problem here, and it's an enormous problem, is that the Indian diners and staff are out of control. Shocking manners, ridiculously loud and violent when intoxicated. I will only ever return for lunch. You've completely lost control of the behaviour in your restaurant. This isn't normal!!!

The naan is huge and the curry is always perfect. Some of the “fancier” and more expensive options have been lackluster. I can’t speak for the other dishes, but if you love butter chicken come here. My friend also said the tikka masala is one of the better ones he’s had in SEA as well.

Save your self. Do not go here.

The curry was delicious and the eggs were huge! It was also great value for money, and the drinks were made with freshly ground fruit, which was incredibly delicious💓 The owner was also very friendly.

The restaurant had 2 big tables empty and a sweet local lady working there welcomed us and asked us to take the table, but while entering itself I saw the Indian Man waving at us Saying No Leave, Leave no place. The girl was also confused. He called her and asked her to make us go. She was also quite confused and said sorry politely and we left. He probably wanted to save the tables for a bigger group. You can ask your guest to wait or inform them the waiting time and I guess should leave it upto them to decide if they want to wait up or leave. If the way you're treated is important please skip this restaurant in Da Nang.

First and foremost, thank you for your prompt response. During my recent visit to your restaurant, I was accompanied by four individuals, including two females (myself included) and three males. Considering the presence of CCTV cameras in your establishment, I kindly request you to review the footage. I am the individual who lodged a complaint regarding the presence of an insect in my mojito, although we did order approximately 8-9 other items from your menu.

Allow me to clarify that as adults, we possess the ability to discern between insects and lemon seeds, as the mojito contains lemons and mint leaves. It is possible that one of your staff members, perhaps due to inebriation, overlooked the presence of a lemon seed. However, your response leads me to question the level of professionalism and customer service they are being taught. I would like to bring to your attention that we were charged for the items we did not consume.

Rather than instructing your staff on proper customer treatment, it is disconcerting to observe that you referred to your patrons as "cheap" and advised against their travels. Similarly, I would like to extend the same suggestion to you; prioritize enhancing your communication skills before further engaging in the hospitality industry. Furthermore, I find it puzzling that you denied any knowledge of the belongings we left behind when we returned the following day. How can you assure the safety of such items if your staff claims they were not left behind? I personally witnessed the insect in my drink and insisted on examining the glass itself. However, the staff member presented two steel bowls and proceeded to separate the water and other components, which did not provide conclusive evidence of the insect's absence. Due to its small size, it could easily have become mixed with the contents, potentially originating from the mint leaves.

Regrettably, the situation escalated when the staff member became agitated and began shouting, resorting to derogatory comments, including referring to me as "cheap." I am uncertain as to the extent of your staff's inappropriate behavior and the threats made towards the females in our group. I find it alarming that they have not exceeded the boundaries of their misconduct, considering the behavior displayed thus far.

In light of these circumstances, I expect the owner of the establishment to exercise mindfulness and thoroughly investigate the entire situation before making decisions on resolving this issue. It appears that my initial expectations were set higher than the actual standards upheld by the owner. The unprofessional conduct of your inebriated staff members, who happened to be of Indian origin, has been disrespectful and intimidating, particularly towards the female members of our group. I question the severity of their actions and ponder whether they are capable of even more deplorable behavior.

Please provide a detailed response addressing the concerns I have raised, as I am eager to understand how you plan to rectify this matter and prevent similar incidents from occurring in the future.
Let me know as well how you are going to compensate for the toy car since you’re staff mentioned they don’t have the car and you mentioned it’s kept safely in your restaurant, that much safe that your staff could not return it to there owner.. and I am sure you are not cheap as you say about your customer…you will find a way to return it..and yeah we were tourists and cane back to our country.

However, during dinner I noticed something crawling up my foot and saw it was a cockroach which was really disgusting and just a few moment later after telling my husband what had happened another cockroach, even bigger than the one before, was crawling up the wall just behind him and then flew above our table. The waitress who we'd told saw it and grabbed it with a tissue, not sure if she's brave or just accostumed. With that we couldn't eat the rest of our food so we asked for the pot of tea to take away. The manager apologised but I think they should have had a small detail with us as it ruined our dinner, just a small detail like inviting the tea or bread would have been nice. It's a pity, maybe we had bad luck, but it's the first time this has happened to us during our stay in Vietnam. There are plenty of other Indians in the area that we have tried and the food was better, and no cockroaches...

Really felt like some good Indian Food and that’s what we got at Ganesh. We ordered the Ganesh Special Spicy and a Chicken Madras Spicy accompanied by a Chilli Garlic Naan and a Plain Paratha.
The meal started with the obligatory pappadums, chutneys and onions, all very nice. Then our mains arrived, WOW! Generous Portions of Curry, beautifully cooked Paratha with its layers of flaky whole-wheat goodness and a Naan to die for. The Ganesh Special with its egg on top was spiced perfectly, hot but not as hot as Vindaloo and the Chicken Madras was exceptional and just as spicy. Accompanied by the Chilli Garlic Naan these dishes were perfectly matched. The Paratha was good to have when you needed to calm the senses down in your mouth from the Chilli.
The staff were all very attentive and when I got the bill I was quietly surprised to see how small it was for such a big meal.

💕 to go thier, very good taste and price very good …

Very consistent! Which is the best compliment I can give any restaurant. I have ordered from here not less than 20 times in the past 2 months. Producing excellent quality food... consistently. I order regularly from Ganesh, and they have no "off/bad days". Each and every dish is prepared freshly and is served glistening with freshness and packed with flavour according to individual needs. The Biriyani is particularly delightful, and the meat is cooked with the dish, hence incredible tenderness. Too many other restaurants would fry the meat and add it separately, which can be easily identified. Ganesh is hand down, the vest Indian restaurant in Danang, and my personal favourite all in all. They have survived the lockdown and the pandemic (many others haven't) exactly because they are popular and awesome. If you like Indian food, look no further. Thank you for your consistent excellence!
Very good
Excellent cuisine, very much like actual Indian food, just right spice, best Indian restaurant chain in VN by far. Food keeps me coming back over and over.
it is delicious
Fresh food, nice coffee and a very cooperative staff. Hiep was very helpful.

Lucky Coffee inside the waiting room next to door number 4 needs to focus on cleaning the shop. There are few customers but there is a lot of trash, cups have not been cleared. Pho does not have corn like in Hanoi and Phu Quoc airports.

It is located in front of Gate 3 on the left end of the domestic departure gate at Danang Airport.
It is a good place to rest your body and legs tired from the heat and movement.
You can order simple snacks such as hamburgers and sandwiches along with drinks such as coffee.
I was able to receive my drink quickly because there was no backlog of orders, and the taste was just right.
80k for a cup of machine-made milk coffee, you know.

Good food here in airport.  Don’t skip here.

It’s next to souvenir shop and all the menu is good.

The restaurant is located in the departure terminal of Da Nang airport, the campus is airy, the tables and chairs are beautifully decorated and convenient.
The menu has fast food dishes such as: Pho, Quang noodles, Banh mi, ... and drinks such as coffee, juice, tea ... The price is a bit high compared to the area, but this is normal for restaurants in the airport.
Professional, enthusiastic staff.
Good service quality.
Clean
Food is not bad but the way they serve and the staff service is terrible.. they like a local street food restaurant lol. its a airport bruhh

Fast service, nice and comfortable seating area. Decent pho with chicken (2 times more expensive than in the city, but we’re at the airport so it’s understandable), we also got a complimentary drink.

The waitress with glasses was so rude never had this type of experience in Vietnam before, cafe is good food is also good the way she served us wasn’t good give this place a miss lot more cafes around

Away from the coffee and food, good and respectful service is important. When you ask the employee for permission to pray, he says it's okay, and when you pray, he says no, because I am a Muslim and I do not follow his religion. I came to Vietnam for tourism, but racism is a major reason for the failure of tourism. The bad employee in this place should understand that I am a tourist and should talk to me politely and not threateningly.
We ate at the cafe past security and it was good. Great service and food was nice. A bit pricey but that’s at every airport. It was nice that it was quiet and tucked away. It was also very clean.
This restaurant has delicious food and drinks. There is a cool smoking room here. Great for smokers and every table here has a place for you to charge your phone. I recommend everyone to come here.

Spacious space right inside Da Nang airport, located near gate 4. Today Vinh, on behalf of Tue Tam Feng Shui company, went to Saigon to attend an Offline program on how to Build People and Build Brands on Tiktok as well as learn more about AI to better serve the company and Tue Tam customers. Wherever Vinh goes, she carries Tue Tam's brainchild with her. This time, I will show you Nu Tue Tam Feng Shui, which I use to steam my house, my shop, my workplace, to purify my energy. In addition, Tue Tam buds are also used for Meditation & places that need purity.

All in all, if you have a flight to catch here, might as well choose this restaurant before your flight.

Surprised by a restaurant that does very well, looks hygienic, clean, tidy, spacious, airy space and delicious food. This Lucky restaurant is number 1 among the Lucky restaurants at the airport that I know. The staff wears ao dai, very beautiful and elegant. Da Nang is really different.

They've removed "dinner" and check "Beverage", take a look at the picture. I wanted to talk with the manager and they didn't understand English suddenly (incredible in an airport business). Using Google translator, they understood Vietnamese but "unfortunately" the managers were not there at that moment. Very suspicious. In summary, it's not a restaurant to trust.

There's also a separate smoking area, but unfortunately, the door to it was open. When we asked to close it, only half of the door was closed.

- The restaurant is located in the domestic airport departure terminal (2nd floor - Terminal T1). The restaurant is beautifully decorated, spacious, and has comfortable seating. The tables and chairs are at the right height, not too high or too low. There is a smoking room and an outlet to charge your phone. The space is the restaurant's strong point compared to surrounding restaurants.

- The price of the food is high because it is located in the airport, but it is on par with the general price of surrounding restaurants. The price is suitable for the space but expensive compared to the quality and service.

This spot is visually appealing; the restaurant itself is really cute and welcoming.

What I really liked about the Bún Bò here is that it includes beef tongue—a great addition that makes the dish stand out! Also, the pork knuckle (giò heo) is pre-sliced, which makes it incredibly easy and convenient to eat.

For me personally, the overall flavor of the Bún Bò was just okay, but my Korean friend absolutely loved it.

In fact, she said it was the best Vietnamese dish she had eaten during her entire trip. Based on her reaction, this place is a huge hit for first-time visitors to Vietnam!

If you're looking for a cute local spot with a unique Bún Bò experience, definitely check it out!

First Time in Da Nang — and This Bowl of Noodles Won My Heart

This was my very first trip to Da Nang, and I couldn’t have chosen a better introduction to the city than Bún Bò Bà Rơi.

From the moment the bowl landed on the table, I knew it was going to be special. The noodles are silky and springy, holding up beautifully in the rich, aromatic broth — a broth that’s both comforting and exciting, with just the right balance of spice and warmth. The toppings are generous: slices of tender beef, chewy tendon, crab meatballs, cubes of pig’s blood, and fresh scallions sprinkled on top. Every spoonful tells a story — of tradition, care, and authenticity.

The place has that bustling, down-to-earth Vietnamese vibe, packed with locals and travelers alike. I even noticed many Korean visitors, which says a lot — when a dish attracts food lovers across cultures, you know it’s the real deal.

And here’s the kicker: Bún Bò Bà Rơi is Michelin-recognized (2024 & 2025), and honestly, it deserves every bit of that honor.

If you’re looking for a taste of Vietnam that will linger in your memory long after you’ve left, this is the spot. For me, it wasn’t just lunch — it was the moment I fell in love with Da Nang.

👉 A must-visit for anyone setting foot in this city.

Cozy no-frills spot with great soup.
The broth was very rich and a bit sweet. I’m usually not into crab, but here it actually worked really well

They serve a delicious, spicy, and flavorful Bun Bo Ba that consisted of a rich umami flavored broth with some aromatic lemon grass, beef bones, shrimp paste, and a hint of chili. We went all out with the additional sides they provided including chili paste, pickled shallots, chili and carrots. We didn't forget the vegetables that added a touch of mint and lime to top it all off.

For foreigners concerned of safety, they serve drinks with large purified cylindrical ice cubes and we were completely safe. Highly recommend as this is also a Michelin Guide.

I am a regular customer who comes here often, this is not the first time, so I told the restaurant to pay attention, but even today the waiter forgot my vegetables, and worse, the vegetables were not washed properly and there was a strange animal under the stem. If you don't pay attention and just break it and eat it, isn't it dangerous? The restaurant is not easily rated by Mechelin, so sell food with your heart!

I ordered bun bo thap cam. I wouldn't say the beef noodle soup here is traditional as it's sweet. I'm used to a more of a salty taste with a strong lemongrass aroma. The lemongrass is very faint. Also, cha cua (crab meatball), is not traditionally in beef noodle soup. I think if you're traveling to Vietnam and haven't had this dish, you'll be pleasantly surprised as it is good. If you been eating bun bo or bun bo hue your entire life, you will be disappointed with this Michelin Guide recommended restaurant. There are condiments to make the beef noodle soup less sweet. I added more fish sauce, pickled onions, serano peppers and carrots, dry crushed peppers, and ate the beef noodle soup with a fresh cayenne pepper to make it less sweet. I noticed a lot of restaurants are cooking their noodle soups with more sugar than before, this place is no exception. The bun bo was "good", but I wouldn't come here again. The sweetness from bone broth vs sugar is distinctive and I would rather make my own bun bo hue than eat here again. Again, it's not bad, it's just not my taste.

Phở usually has a mild saltiness, which may feel a bit light for Japanese people, but this restaurant’s soup had a strong, well-balanced flavor that suits the Japanese palate.

If you're looking for an authentic taste of Đà Nẵng, Bún Bò Bà Rơi is the place to go. The broth is rich and flavorful, the beef is tender everything comes together for a truly local experience.

This place stays true to its traditional flavors, not adjusting to mainstream tastes. So, if you try it and find that it doesn’t suit your palate, that’s perfectly okay. After all, this is a local eatery, serving bún bò just the way Đà Nẵng people love it! Give it a try and experience the real taste of Đà Nẵng.

You can eat it. But the broth smells like ducks, maybe because of the liver, which caused a gag reflex (personally for me), so I stayed hungry, we also saw that they don't wash the tea glasses, they just pour out the tea and put them back on the table. Otherwise, a nice interior, if you want something specific, why not, but it's definitely not worth a Michelin recommendation, I've been to many places where it's much tastier.

The noodles were average, I saw the Michelin list but they weren't as good as some other restaurants I've been to. The restaurant took a long time to serve the food even though it wasn't crowded. I sat there for 5 minutes before a staff member came out to ask about the food.

Delicious Bun Bo Hue! The best I’ve ever had! Soup was not too oily or heavy. It was very clean and had a good amount of meat - the restaurant is clean and proper too with prices displayed properly.

The staff are so quick and kind. I accidentally gave two notes stuck together and they kindly chased me to return it!
Maybe what I tried was not the same dish that won the Michelin recommendation. Average taste to be honest, nice variety of protein but not of the best quality
The food is good, the cold weather before Tet is also interesting to eat hot food
We ordered the Special but I really didn't like it, sorry, it's a matter of taste.

Delicious! Clap hands and wave ears.
The food comes out quickly. I eat the special bowl, everything is great but it will be a bit small compared to my appetite. But it is great, rich in flavor, delicious.

The beef noodle soup is delicious. The broth is very light. The bowl is just right. The food feels just right. The vegetables are also fresh. The restaurant is clean and delicately decorated. I will come again next time.
Tasted miserable with giant lumps of fat instead of meat. Rats were running everywhere and the staff were not very friendly. On top of that they only took cash which was a big minus!
Delicious but the opening hours are incorrect. Too bad

Highly recommend!!

The beef noodle soup is very delicious. Today my wife and I went to this restaurant. 10/10.

The sweet and fragrant broth, with the perfect combination of tender beef, crispy pork leg, and typical spices, creates an irresistible dish. The fresh and delicious raw vegetables added to the dish add a refreshing taste, blending with the soft noodles. Every time you enjoy it, you will feel the rich, attractive flavor of Da Nang in every bite of beef noodle soup. Surely you will want to come back to experience this wonderful flavor again! 🍜🥩🌿
The broth has a unique, special flavor, the beef is tender and delicious, the crab cakes are delicious. The restaurant is clean, the space is airy, and the food is served quickly.

- The restaurant has a rather nostalgic space, clean high tables and chairs are very comfortable to sit on, the inside area is a bit dark due to the low ceiling but in return it is quite cool.
- The beef noodle soup has a clear and rich broth, not too strong of beef smell. The toppings are of good quality, the price is a bit higher than normal but still okay. Price 30-75k/bowl
- The staff is enthusiastic and gentle.
- The minus point is that the parking lot on the side of the road is quite narrow and does not have a roof to protect from the sun and rain.

Bún Bò Bà Rơi proudly displays its Michelin Award at the entrance, and I can see why. The restaurant is simply set up, but that’s part of the charm of many Vietnamese places. The service was incredibly friendly. Even though their English wasn’t perfect, I felt warmly welcomed, and they immediately introduced me to their best-selling dish.

I also appreciated the little guide on how to properly enjoy the meal. The dish itself was absolutely delicious. The broth was rich and flavorful, with a variety of meats, each one incredibly tender and packed with taste. I would have loved to order a second portion, but I was more than satisfied after finishing.

Highly recommended!
This is the privilege of being in the Michelin Guide. beef noodle mood
Bun Bo Ba Roi, rich broth is stewed from beef bones, combined with sour pickled shallots and spicy satay, all creating a very unique, authentic and delicious beef noodle dish.

I will never come back to Mu Roi restaurant at 05 Phan Thanh Tai and I will also tell my friends and relatives that this kind of stingy and stingy way of selling is never going to happen again. I am a regular customer here but after seeing the way of doing business and this terrible time, I say bye! Even if the restaurant does not need customers, they do not need that expensive and stingy way of selling. This morning, my husband bought a bowl of vermicelli with grilled pork but the restaurant forgot to put in the meat, only leaving out a piece of pork roll and a small blood clot. I am heavily pregnant and hungry but I still had to drag my huge pregnant body to the restaurant to talk and then what, still keeping the same way of doing business, only caring about profit and loss, the restaurant saw that I was wrong but did not compensate with any more meat, just left the same amount, apologizing vaguely. Doing business with such stinginess and pettyness will never develop, I am also a business person here. Too disappointed and angry.

Valentine's Day, an occasion inherently meant to find warmth and sincerity in love, does not necessarily have to be an elaborate meal. However, tonight, when I came to this bistro, I couldn't help but feel like I was falling in love with someone who had a charming appearance but lacked sincerity, and in the end there was only disappointment. The restaurant space is really beautiful, cozy and comfortable. The dim light and bustling holiday atmosphere made me feel sorry for the fact that this place was crowded. The drinks are well prepared, really fresh and relieve the tense atmosphere of the evening. However, those were the only things that could be praised. Dinner began with a strange emptiness: the appetizers were filled with nothing but anticipation. Next is Asian soup, but it can't be called soup. That thin, fishy broth made me want to forget it immediately. If love were a dish, it would certainly be like this, beautiful but lacking a rich feeling. The next Caesar salad lacks the fatty, salty, slightly sour taste of caecar sauce, a small but necessary detail for the dish to have its soul. Instead, it was simply neatly arranged vegetable leaves, but lacking a decisive flavor, just like a love affair lacking real emotions, leaving only pretense. And then the main dish: cold beef steak. Not cold in the usual sense, but cold from start to finish, as if it had been long forgotten in the kitchen. Side dishes are just "thrown on the table for show", without any sophistication. The accompanying sauce was thick, like an unsuccessful attempt to try to make the meal seem appetizing, but it made the dish even more heavy and difficult to eat. The spaghetti was no better, cold and sticky, the pasta sauce was sparse and dimpled, more like Quang noodles than a standard spaghetti dish. A complete failure in terms of taste and sophistication, like a love affair that doesn't put enough effort into sublimation, only remaining stagnant. Finally, tiiramisu, the dessert that I hoped would save the dinner. But no, it was frozen in the middle, making this dish no different from cold love, unable to ignite any emotions. I left the restaurant with a clear lesson: a beautiful space cannot save a bad experience, just as a perfect appearance cannot hide an inside full of irreparable things. A dinner where every dish was stuck in a state of indifference, not too bad to skip, but not good enough to be memorable either. And in relationships like that, there is only one outcome: there will never be a second time.

### 5 Star Rating: MeliOh Bistro Danang - "Nest of Love" on the banks of the Han River

**A Romantic Corner in the City**:

MeliOh Bistro Danang depicts a romantic picture in the heart of Hai Chau, Da Nang. Located at Lot 01-A4, Dao Xanh 4, Dao Xanh Villa Area, MeliOh is not only a restaurant but also a meeting place for souls who love peace, gentleness and sophistication.

**A Meeting Place of Unique Flavors and Architecture**:

With a design simulating a bird's nest on the banks of the Han River, MeliOh brings a cozy, close feeling right from the first sight. Decorated with chandeliers, bricks, and glass, the space here is both modern and classic, creating a romantic atmosphere for any couple's party.

**Creative Asian-European Fusion Cuisine**:

The menu at MeliOh Bistro offers a wonderful culinary experience, where traditional Vietnamese and Western flavors are skillfully combined, creating unique culinary works. From coffee to Asian-European dishes, each menu is carefully selected, ensuring to bring the best enjoyment experience to diners.

**Service Quality and Special Offers**:

The service at MeliOh Bistro is not only impressive for its professionalism and dedication, but also through special offers, from affordable prices for drinks and combo menus, to the ideal private space for couples who want to have anniversary parties, all provided wonderfully.

**Conclusion**:

MeliOh Bistro Danang is not only an ideal place to enjoy high-quality Asian-European cuisine, but also a destination that brings a sense of peace and relaxation on the banks of the splendid Han River. This is not just a restaurant, but a cozy "nest of love" for every couple, group of friends, and family. With plus points in space, cuisine and service, MeliOh Bistro deserves a 5-star rating. 
📸 Manh Nguyen Huu

During my month-long Asia tour, I decided to avoid Turkish restaurants and try local flavors. While exploring Da Nang, I decided to eat after being warmly approached by my Azerbaijani friend who had just started working there. The Adana kebab was mediocre, and the portion was small. The tzatziki was served warm. However, when I asked for the bill, I was disappointed to be charged 25k VND for the tea. The tea was also cold and extremely stale. This might be acceptable if restaurant prices were more reasonable, but that's not the case. You can eat on side streets in central Vietnam for 30k and enjoy unlimited Vietnamese tea. Tea is a treat in Turkish culture. Please don't make such small calculations.

My wife and I recently had dinner at Sultan Istanbul, and it was a truly delightful experience. The food was absolutely delicious — every dish was packed with rich, authentic flavor and presented beautifully. What made it even more special was the touch of Azerbaijani influence brought by the talented chef, whose passion for cooking really came through in every bite.

The atmosphere was warm, welcoming, and perfect for a relaxing evening together. The service was excellent — friendly, attentive, and made us feel right at home.

We left Sultan Istanbul full, happy, and already looking forward to coming back. Highly recommended for anyone who enjoys authentic cuisine with heart and soul behind it.

It's one of the most magnificent places to visit in Vietnam, a place I'll want to visit again and again, both in terms of atmosphere and overall appeal. I'd like to thank the staff who expertly served us Turkish cuisine on the other side of the world, and Chef Nejat, who made us experience it. For those who enjoy a peaceful, beautiful, and enjoyable holiday, Sultan Istanbul Kebab is the only address in Vietnam. ❤️❤️
Well done, Chef Nejat.

He's simple, genuine, and passionate about his work. It's hard to find people like him.

I was truly surprised and delighted to encounter such high-quality Turkish cuisine in Vietnam, especially in such a remote region. Both the presentation and the taste exceeded my expectations.
The restaurant's atmosphere is also very pleasant, warm, and clean. It's a popular choice for both locals and tourists.

Those familiar with Turkish cuisine can pretty much guess what to expect, but for those unfamiliar with it, it's a wonderful discovery. I highly recommend trying Chef Nejat's dishes. Great job!

☀️😊🙌🏻👍🏻
The food is amazing 👏👏

Unfortunately, I went to the restaurant and had shawarma and chicken pieces. Honestly, the shawarma smelled like it was stale and I had stomach cramps. I spent two days suffering from stomach pain and fever. I advise Arab tourists to bring cooking supplies with them and not to tire yourself out looking for clean restaurants.
The food is very delicious. The prices are reasonable. The staff is cooperative.

Honestly, the restaurant has nothing good except that the staff are very nice and respectful. Regarding the food, I ordered meat with dough and fries, and they were the only good ones. As for the shawarma, it was very bad and had a sauce I don't know what it tasted like, and the hummus wasn't good and tasted strange, and the bread I ordered looked like a wall, not bread, because it was so dry. It was an unsatisfactory experience for me, and most restaurants in Vietnam are, frankly, very bad.

We've been traveling through Vietnam for 20 days. We came here longing for Turkish food. The staff's attentiveness, the refreshments, and the orders we placed were all as good as those in Turkey. We were very pleased. If you ever go to Danang, you should definitely try it.

A delicious, beautiful, and halal restaurant. They have delicious shawarma. Their prices are excellent. The owner of the restaurant is a respectful, smiling, and cheerful Turkish young man. We will come back to him again and try other dishes. 🇹🇷❤️ 🇸🇦

If you're looking for authentic Turkish flavors in Da Nang, Sultan Kebap is definitely the place to visit! Their kebabs, döner kebabs, and especially their flatbreads are truly homegrown. The meat is meticulously marinated, the portions are generous, and the presentation is impeccably clean. The owner and staff are incredibly friendly and welcoming. Even though you're far away, they make you feel like you're in a restaurant in Turkey. We've satisfied our cravings, and our stomachs are happy. Thank you, Sultan Kebap!

Nijat is just super! Met from the doorway and immediately felt the hospitality of Turkey! Very tasty food, and most importantly everything is halal. And Nijat can also speak Kazakh and Russian, which is very nice. Who misses Eastern cuisine and who wants delicious meat in Da Nang, everyone is welcome to this place!

I stumbled upon this Turkish restaurant completely by chance, and it turned out to be such a lucky find. If you're unsure about trying Vietnamese food or you're looking for halal options, this place is an excellent choice. I had lahmacun and ayran, and I can confidently say the quality and cleanliness are on par with true Turkish standards👌🏻

The restaurant is an artist, we tried a mixed grill platter and it was amazing, the lamb iskender was okay and the hummus as well. Don't expect a taste like you're in Turkey, but the restaurant is wonderful and its atmosphere is calm and relaxing, the staff is friendly, helpful and smiling, and the young chef Nikat is an artist and classy. I wish him and his staff all the best. Don't forget to order coffee at the end 👌👍
We had a good meal, delicious food!

Great food and hospitality! Better than many Turkish restaurants that I have tried in Turkey itself.. I tried the Kabab Iskender platter, Adana shish kebab roll, turkish pizza mozarella cheese and turkish mix pizza and all were great.
The shawarma wasn't very good, and I ordered grilled chicken after it was cooked properly, but overall everything else was good.

The lentil soup is excellent, and the lahmacun and pita are also excellent. The lamb kebab is similar to our döner pilaf with yogurt added, and it looks great. I'll definitely try it next time. The place is clean, and the chef is very attentive and kind. The staff are trying to get used to the service industry; they're friendly and enthusiastic. I thank them for their service. Definitely come and experience this delicious meal. You won't regret it.

I very rarely do bad ratings. Even if I have a bad experience.
But this is a rare time. From the minute I walked in it was cold. Even though the owner was eating inside there was no welcome. I found my own seat. It wasn’t u til I finally made eye contact with the waitress was I served.
The entree could not be explained by the wait staff so I decided to just have a main despite being quite hungry.
The chicken dish came out which was mostly bread with tiny portions of chicken. It might have been ok if the bread was fresh. It had the texture of two day old bread. I ate half and decided to give up. I paid the bill. The worst 205,000vnd I have ever spent.
The owner was sitting outside smoking as I left and I asked him about it, I told him I paid, however reluctantly,  as the dish was mostly stale bread - he laughed.
This is a highly NOT recommended review - bad service, bad food and bad vibe.
The food is sweet and delicious. We ordered Alexander meat, hummus, and chicken joints, but there were small insects in the restaurant, which were very disgusting.

I recommend it to everyone from Central Asia. I searched for a long time for a halal cafe, restaurants similar to our dishes. They cook very tasty here, and on fire. The service is also excellent. You can pay by card.

We were very hungry, spontaneously decided to go to Sultan Kebab, ordered 2 portions of Lamb kebab platter (179,000 dong per portion) and a portion of baklava to try (99,000 dong). The portions are large, on a thin lavash they put juicy, soft lamb, long-grain basmati rice, red onion rings, sliced lettuce, sliced tomato and a delicious sour cream-garlic sauce. I haven't eaten such a delicious meal for a long time, it reminded me of an open shawarma. The baklava was also tasty, but not the freshest. Overall, the place is great, we were pleased with the dinner and the service.
Seriously the best kebab I have ever tried. The beef kebab is so juicy and delectable. The wrap itself is another level.
I ate lamb on a plate. Lots of meat, vegetables, tasty sauce. Delicious. Thank you

After a long time, we wanted to taste Turkish cuisine but we couldn't find what we were looking for. Lahmacun dough was like sugary, it had nothing to do with lahmacun. For the first time, we saw a different presentation on hummus, lamb meat with caramelized onions was sprinkled on hummus and it was very tasteless. The pita that came with it was stale, it was only slightly heated and placed in front of us. I think the prices are also high for these foods. Since we didn't like the food, we didn't want to try baklava and kunefe and Turkish coffee. It had nothing to do with Turkish flavors, it was really an insult to the beautiful atmosphere of the place and the reputation of Turkish food, unfortunately. The only good thing was ayran, even though it was made with ready-made yogurt, its taste was as it should be.

The staff is very attentive and kind, and I gave them 3 stars because the decoration also tells the story of Türkiye.

🆘 Sultan Istanbul Kebab Da Nang - Very Bad Experience🆘

I tried this restaurant, but it was the worst Turkish food I ever had in my life. I know Turkish food very well, and this was not it.

**The only good thing:**
- The staff were nice and friendly

**The bad things:**
- **Falafel:** Looked like meatballs, not like real falafel. Tasted bad.
- **Lamb platter:** Very little meat, mostly bread. Meat tasted old, like it was heated in a microwave. No flavor.
- **Pita (Turkish bread):** Not fresh. Tasted like reheated dough.  Not a Turkish pita bread from the grill.
- **Sauces:** No taste at all.

I didn’t finish my food, but nobody asked me why ? I think they knew.
This is not real Turkish food. The name says "Sultan Istanbul," but the food is not Turkish. The chef is Vietnamese, not Turkish.  A waste of your money.

In a city like Da Nang with so much good food, this was a big disappointment. I not often write bad reviews, but this place wasted my money.

The photo shows the little bit of tasteless meat on bit of microwave heated “Turkish” bread 😭

**My rating:** 0/5. Do not recommend.

I recently visited this fine dining Indian restaurant, and while the staff showed great attentiveness and seemed committed to providing high-quality service, there were a few aspects that left me underwhelmed.

To start, their signature dish, the butter chicken, was unfortunately disappointing due to the inedible quality of the chicken. My wife and I were unable to finish it, which was quite surprising for a fine dining establishment.

On a brighter note, the eggplant and potato curry was decent, although the cheese naan did not live up to our expectations given its premium price of 150,000 VND. For that price, we expected something more exceptional.

My wife went to the toilet on the second floor, where she washed her hands with soap. When I went I found only a closed door on the second floor, so I went to the third floor, where there is a room with a toilet next to the kitchen. However, there was no soap to wash my hands in the toilet next to the kitchen. I can't emphasise enough the kind of thoughts that a customer can have about the toilet nearest to the kitchen, where food is being prepared, lacking soap. This is something that needs immediate remediation

Another area that could use improvement is the clarity of pricing. The 10% VAT is billed separately, meaning a 100,000 VND dish will actually cost 110,000 VND. In addition, there's a 5% service charge added to the bill. Incorporating these charges into the menu prices would make things simpler and more transparent for customers, without the need for separate calculations.

In summary, I'm giving this restaurant 3 stars, as the overall experience was a mixed bag. While the service was commendable, the food and pricing could use some refinement. I hope the management takes these points into consideration for the benefit of future diners.

If you’re looking to experience authentic Northern Vietnamese cuisine in the heart of Da Nang, Chả Cá Hà Nội Ngư Phố is a must-visit. This spot brings the legendary chả cá Lã Vọng from Hanoi all the way to the Central coast—and they do it justice.

The moment you walk in, the place gives off a cozy, family-style vibe. Service is fast, friendly, and efficient. The staff takes time to explain the traditional way to enjoy the dish, which is part of the experience itself.

The star of the show is, of course, the chả cá—turmeric-marinated fish sizzling on a hot pan, cooked right at your table with fresh dill and green onions. It’s served with cold vermicelli noodles, roasted peanuts, fresh herbs, and a rich fermented shrimp paste (mắm tôm) or fish sauce if you’re not as adventurous. The fish is tender, flavorful, and beautifully balanced with the herbs and condiments.

They also offer a variety of Northern-style sides and beverages that complement the meal well.

💬 Highlights:
– Authentic flavor, just like in Hanoi
– Fresh ingredients and generous portions
– Great for small groups or a casual dinner

📍 Conveniently located and easy to find, it’s a perfect stop after a day exploring the city.

If you’re craving something different from the typical Central Vietnamese cuisine, Chả Cá Hà Nội Ngư Phố is a delicious detour worth taking. Highly recommended for foodies and anyone wanting a true taste of Hanoi in Da Nang.

I don't know who forced her to go to work so that she had to SHOW AN ATTITUDE to the CUSTOMER when I had not touched her. The owner can check the camera to verify, I am so disappointed.
1. When giving the bill, you had no POLITE at all when you shoved the bill in the customer's face like that (I only asked for politeness, not respect).

When my friend said to transfer money, you didn't even say "ac transfer to this code/ or something like that" but swiped the lighter straight and continued to show the code to the customer, without saying anything and showing a very contemptuous attitude. I have chosen to edit this review as the response of the owner is trying to blame “mắm tôm” for the reason that I found this experience disappointing. Let me elaborate.

I have lived in Vietnam for around 14-15 years, spending around a decade living in Hanoi.

Chả cá lã vọng is one of my favourite dishes and finding this place was really quite exciting for me.

The staff were very unprofessional and non attentive, upon paying my bill I found the girl wearing the red Áo Dài exceptionally impolite. I asked to pay with a QR code and was pointed to go to the counter. Sure.

She proceeded to shout at another employee across the restaurant right next to my ear.

The music is a terrible collection of what one would find if you were put on hold while trying to call a bank.

Prices, definitely not cheap, but what I would consider fair considering the overall feel of the restaurant.

The problems lie with the staff, their attitude and with the quality of the food that is being served.

I stopped by the restaurant at 9:15 pm today and met an employee who couldn't stand it. I stopped in front of the restaurant and saw only this guy. I only asked one question, which was probably the minimum politeness: Sir, is the restaurant still open? (Because I thought I was a bit late and even looking inside, I could still see tables eating). This guy stared at me without saying anything, slowly turned around and opened the door without saying a word. I stood there for 15 seconds, watching this guy's figure and saw him talking about something with the other employees. Another 15 seconds for me to figure out what the hell was going on and this guy was still acting like he had never seen me before. And so I turned away with 1000 questions. This person probably thinks that this city is the only place that sells Cha Ca La Vong so they don't need to serve customers, or this person is a relative of the owner, or this person has some kind of communication problem or... Last time I ate there was a fly in the shrimp, I thought I should just ignore it because the rate of 1 out of 4 times eating there was a fly in the fish sauce is acceptable. Well, I'll have to say goodbye to this restaurant and go eat Bun Dau Mam Tom, wait for another restaurant to open selling Cha Ca like this to compete, then I'll go eat there.

During my visit to Hanoi last year, I had discovered this Vietnamese dish known as cha ca. It's grilled fish dish, served with shrimp paste, chili peppers, fragrant herbs, roasted peanuts, and rice noodles. I loved it so much it surpassed my two long-standing favorites, pho and banh mi.

Fast forward to this month, during my trip to Da Nang, I wondered if I could find a place that serves this dish. My search led me to Ngu Pho. Their rendition of cha ca was not only authentic but also incredibly satisfying. For this dish, I paid VND 155,000 ($6.51).

Here are a few things to note about Ngu Pho:

* They offer free WiFi
* Unfortunately, there's no complimentary drinking water
* The staff takes care of cooking the cha ca for you
* Note that using the hand towel provided at your table will be added to your bill.

Overall, Ngu Pho exceeded my expectations and brought back cherished memories of Hanoi's culinary delights. If you're in Da Nang and craving an authentic cha ca experience, this is the place to be.

It is true that the taste is a little inferior compared to Hanoi's authentic Cha Cat Long, but the taste is still worth eating.  But what is really important is that there is no basic training in employee attitude.  It is basic etiquette to answer when a customer speaks, but I had to hold back from calling the boss to complain because the tall male employee stared at the customer while he was speaking and did not answer until the end.  Provide proper employee training

The restaurant's space is small and medium-sized, the security guard is enthusiastic and cute, but the wait staff is a bit slow and takes a long time to order anything while the restaurant is normally not crowded. The restaurant's shrimp paste taste is typical of Hanoi. But especially if Lang fish is not cleaned properly, it smells very fishy and tastes like mud in the mouth. I hope the restaurant will improve and my personal opinion is that the fish pieces should be small enough to eat, not too big

This is the first time I have tried La Vong fish cake. The first impression is probably that the restaurant is located on the front side of Tran Phu street and is easy to find. The second plus point is that the space is airy and clean. However, the air conditioner was a bit hot the day I went so I felt a bit uncomfortable eating. I ordered 3 of the shop's most signature dishes: 1 set of spring rolls + sweet and sour mixed lentils + braised lentils with banana and beans. Personally, I find sweet and sour mixed lentils to be okay, the fish is quite fresh but the sauce mixed with the salad is a bit bland. Braised lentils with banana and beans is the best for me. The braised fish is chewy and chewy and delicious when eaten with a piece of banana. As for the La Vong fish cake set, I think it's normal, a bit greasy, and not very suitable for the price. I brought my parents along, and both of them found the food to be okay, but not outstanding. But to reduce cravings, you can come back once in a while.

I recently visited Ish Indian Restaurant and had a really positive experience. The atmosphere was inviting and comfortable, with nice decor that felt authentically Indian without being overdone.
The food was delicious. Every dish I tried was well-prepared with rich, balanced flavors. You can tell they use fresh ingredients and know their spices. It felt like genuine Indian home cooking, elevated.
The service was also top-notch. The staff were friendly, attentive, and helpful, making sure everything was just right.
Overall, Ish Indian Restaurant is a solid choice for anyone looking for good Indian food in a pleasant setting. I'd definitely recommend it.

Location:
- Located only a few minutes walk from the Dragon bridge.

Service:
- The gentleman who served me was friendly, but needs a lot of training!!
- I asked for no salt in my curry, but there was a lot of salt
- I asked for my Vindaloo to be extra spicy, but there was no spice whatsoever
- A couple arrived after me, but he served their drinks before me.
- Rating: 1/5

Atmosphere:
- Lovely modern design
- Good lighting
- Very comfortable chairs
- No Music or Bollywood Videos
- Rating: 3/5

My Order:

- 1 x Chicken Vindaloo (Spicy, as Vindaloo should be)
- Price: 145K
- Feedback:
- It was Chicken on the bone and not breast.
- Unfortunately there was more bone and gristle than meat.
- It wasn’t spicy as requested & had too much salt.
- The portion size was very small
- Not worth 145K (Very Disappointing)
- Rating: 1/5

- 1 x Garlic Naan with Chilli:
- Feedback:
- The naan was cooked well, but it was a little too oily for me
- Like the Vindaloo, there was no chilli
- Very good portion size, which made up for the lack of curry.
- Price: 45K
- Rating: 2/5

- 1 x Tiger Beer:
- Price: 35K
- No cold Tiger
- Rating: 0/5

- 2 x Huda Beer
- Served Cold
- Price: 30K
- Rating: 5/5

Additional Note:
No complimentary was served

Overall Score: 2/5

The waiting staff are always smiling, in a hurry to serve you and apologetic if service takes longer than expected. The 2 ladies who speak better English are brilliant! We very much noticed this every evening, as the restaurant is quite popular and it gets quite busy. These ladies were always very professional, calm and friendly, despite some customers being very demanding, at times rude and causing a huge commotion when they arrived in big groups, impatient, always asking for various things left and right, no please and not a thank you!

I gave 3 stars for the atmosphere, but this is only due to some noisy and impolite customers, nothing to do with the restaurant, or its staff!

I saved my appetite all day since breakfast for this place. I had a meal here the other evening, and I ordered lamb curry with chicken kebab and a few other side orders with my guest.

The service was good, two Vietnamese young girls serving and what looks to be the boss sat in the corner of the restaurant.

Whilst eating the curry the food was nice, no questions asked very good.

Unfortunately later that night throughout the whole night I felt ill, nausea and diarrhoea. I was rough I spent the last two days in bed with no energy. I can only blame the food I had that evening and I’m so disappointed. I was nearly in hospital this afternoon but I seeked medical advice from a local chemist, they examined me and I was diagnosed with food poisoning, dehydrated and energy was so weak I was advised go back to the hotel to rest.

Just make sure the cleanliness of these places is ok, the front might look good but the back kitchen might not be.

Restaurant owners should put photos of their kitchens and have better hygiene standards.

Unfortunately, we were unable to assess the quality of the cuisine (we arrived early in the day, apparently they were just opening. The restaurant is staffed by Indians, so everything was very slow shanti-shanti. The chairs were on the tables, but we were seated at the only one prepared. The atmosphere in the restaurant is pleasant, the building is very beautiful and authentic. However, when the waiter, who had just woken up, came and we asked him what food we could order, we were told that there was not much on the menu. I am allergic to onions and I asked him to indicate which of these dishes could be prepared without onions. He pointed his finger at everything with onions, except potatoes. We asked the kitchen if something more like breakfast could be made without onions, to which we received a negative answer. Bottom line: if you have any food allergies, do not waste your time at this place. No one will understand your situation and you will be refused. Although maybe he was lazy. After all, it was 12 noon

Here’s a sample review:

A Must-Try Halal Gem in Danang!

Maxim Halal Restaurant is an absolute delight for anyone seeking delicious halal food in Danang. From the moment we walked in, the welcoming atmosphere and friendly service made us feel right at home.

The food is exceptional! The lentil soup is a must-try—comforting, flavorful, and absolutely perfect. The shawarma is hands down one of the best I’ve ever had—juicy, well-seasoned, and paired with fresh sides. Every dish we tried was outstanding, from the appetizers to the main courses.

The restaurant is clean, family-friendly, and offers a wide variety of options that cater to all tastes. Whether you’re craving Middle Eastern cuisine or simply looking for high-quality halal food, this place has it all.

Highly recommend Maxim Halal Restaurant for anyone visiting Danang. A perfect spot for both locals and tourists! Will definitely return!

Let me know if you’d like any adjustments!
