The food is delicious, ok, acceptable. I ate chicken with garlic sauce and spicy sauce, both were ok, but the spicy sauce was not spicy, I asked again and the kitchen changed the chicken wings with a spicier sauce but still not spicy, if you ask for more spicy, I think it will be saltier but not spicy. There are 2 things I don't like, 1 is the dining table is quite small, it's more comfortable for 2 people, because the table is small and because the restaurant takes care, they often clear away leftovers so it's okay. 2 is the panchan (pickled food) I ate for free everywhere and the panchan at other restaurants is much more diverse than at Bonchon, this is the first time charging so I was surprised even though the extra charge of 19k is not too expensive but it doesn't feel like it while the panchan is very easy to make and I didn't think I would have to charge for the smallest dish like that. Overall, I think the experience is okay so I rate it 4 stars. The bowl of panchan I took a picture of separately was an additional 19k order. There were 4 of us and I heard it was only 1 price. If there were 2 of us, it would seem too much.

The restaurant is spacious, with comfortable tables and chairs and cool air conditioning. The restaurant is located right in the center, so it's very close to eat. The staff is friendly and enthusiastic, 10 points for service 🥰

I really like the mala sauce chicken at the restaurant, it's so delicious that it's hard to describe. I'm also a fan of the chicken cartilage dish, only 69k, quite delicious compared to the price range ^^

Best fried chicken in Danang. It's juicy and succulent inside and crispy on the outside. The sauce is a burst of flavour, coated thinly on the chicken, making the fried chicken maintain its crispiness for a really long while. Original sauce is the GOAT, while mala has a nice kick of chilli. side dishes are also good with plenty of choice but i just go for tteokbokki everytime

I have only eaten Bonchon through Shopee Food and have not had a chance to visit the restaurant. But the chicken here is really delicious. The crispy skin does not separate when bitten, the seasoning is rich (a bit salty if you like it bland), the meat inside is not too mushy. Although it is a delivery, it is always hot, and they even put enough tissues and side dishes for me. When I have a chance, I will try other dishes besides chicken. 
Update 1: Today I went to eat directly at the store, the food is still delicious. However, the restaurant is a bit empty, maybe because the customer service is not good yet
Update 2: The Cheese Pasta dish is fatty and fragrant, the taste is a bit bland, so it is suitable for people who like Western-style spices. Mala sauce chicken is not for me at all, the spiciness is not too spicy but the salty and sweet parts are not evenly distributed

🏠 The restaurant is located on the front of Nguyen Van Linh Street, with a wide sidewalk for motorbikes, however, this street is currently prohibited from parking cars 🚫, so you can find parking on another street and walk there. 
🏠 The restaurant space is clean and bright, designed in the style of ordering and paying first, then serving food. The restaurant does not serve fast food, and there are still staff to serve at the table. 
🍗 I ordered a portion of Combo Chicken M (including 4 chicken wings and 2 chicken thighs + mixed salad + 1 glass of water, in addition to a small bowl of papaya, white cabbage, and pickled carrots to eat with), with this combo I chose 2 types of sauce: Spicy Sauce and Garlic Sauce. The general comment is that the skin is crispy, both flavors are delicious but quite sweet. The sweet taste is suitable for children but the elderly will not like it and eating too much will make them feel sick. 
💰 Such a combo is 149k, acceptable for the quality of food, service and space of the restaurant. 
🍽️ There is also a small bucket on the table to put chicken bones to help keep the dining table clean. However, the arrangement of knives, plates, spoons and paper towels on the same horizontal wooden tray is considered unreasonable, making it quite difficult to get knives and plates (if using a vertical wooden box and dividing it into 3 compartments, it would be more convenient). 
🌟 The restaurant is suitable for individuals, couples, families (especially families with small children) or groups.

The food surprised me because it was delicious and sophisticated, with many strange and fun dishes.

Why do customers wait so long? The tofu is cold. Asked the staff and they said the walkie-talkie was broken and they couldn't contact the kitchen. What, you're selling a restaurant and you talk like that and customers have to wait to eat? Asking questions? And the price isn't cheap.
A very comprehensive menu of Vietnamese, Thai, and even some Italian staples. If you like mushrooms you’re in for a treat!

We often come here for breakfast. They make incredibly tasty vegetarian soups here - large portions, rich, fresh, with mushrooms and soy products. Over the year, we have tried different places, but we still always come back here, because the recipe does not change, the taste is always consistently excellent, and the cafe is clean and pleasant.

Even living in another area, we are happy to come here specifically - the place is really decent and very atmospheric. I recommend it for breakfast, lunch and dinner🫶🏼

the experience was terrible. I arrived at the restaurant before 5pm, at that time the restaurant had few customers (only 2-3 tables) but the wait for food was very long.
I ordered fried rice and they added a lot of pepper, the accompanying soup was very cold, even though it was old food, they didn't bring it to be reheated
the grilled meat vermicelli was very tough, it was very tiring to chew
the spring rolls were all flour, heavy and disgusting

although I went to eat vegetarian food, I don't want to share too much negativity, but the experience at the restaurant was really bad, unacceptable. The wait for food was too long, the quality was not good, the service was superficial
I'm from Saigon. Vegetarian food is fine. Need to improve the seasoning. The dipping sauce for banh xeo is not rich. The stir-fried noodles are too salty, so I threw them away on the plate.

We made our way through the streets of Danang to eat at ANs in January 2025 after reading the reviews and salivating over the menu. We had the louts seed congee and the vegan meatballs. Hands down best vegan food in Vietnam! Not only is the food delicious, the service great but it also has a nice relaxing vibe to chill out amongst the hum of the city. Wish I had one in my home town to work my way through tasting their menu!
I don't eat vegetarian often, but the hot pot here makes me come back many times. The seasoning is very special, slightly spicy but fragrant, very addictive.
The food is delicious, rich in flavor and not bland like many other vegetarian places.
I am a vegetarian food lover and Ans is definitely one of the best vegetarian restaurants in Da Nang. The "Tomato Noodles" is simple yet sophisticated.
Happy staff, enthusiastic service, very satisfied

Went with a group of 5 friends, ordered everything from "Crispy fried noodles", "Grilled mushroom rice", to "Thai soup" - every dish was beautiful, flavorful, and everyone nodded in agreement after eating.
The restaurant is spacious, airy and clean, the hot pot is very suitable for 2 people but there is a lot of hot pot.

I ordered spring rolls with cabbage and fried sticky rice with corn and squid. After eating, I felt full but not too full. The fried spring rolls were crispy, not oily, the sticky rice was fragrant, the corn was sweet. Not as boring as the salty dishes. The restaurant is quiet, cool, suitable for going with relatives.
Very delicious meal, beautiful house, clean, beautifully decorated, cool space, very worth experiencing when coming to Da Nang!
Fast food, beautifully presented. Clean, luxurious space. Reasonable price, worth the experience. Very satisfied, will come back many times!

Came to Ans on the recommendation of friends and was completely captivated. The restaurant is beautifully decorated, close to nature. The vegetarian dishes are rich, tasty and artistically presented. I ordered vegetarian Quang noodles and mushroom salad – both were excellent. The staff were very gentle and hospitable. Very suitable for a light meal in the middle of a coastal city.

Delicious vegetarian restaurant. Excellent quality. Will come back.
Delicious food, will visit many more times, enthusiastic staff
waited 30 minutes and still no food
Nice restaurant with lovely green decor. The vegetarian chicken rice is delish! The dish portion is large so come here with a hungry tummy~
Everyone at my table praised the food after eating. We will come back!
Beautiful restaurant, attentive staff, food is not greasy, very delicious and good 👍 …

My friend from Hanoi came to Da Nang to visit and said he wanted to try vegetarian food from the Central region. I took him to the restaurant and ordered a bunch of dishes: Quang noodles, crab noodle soup, and Hu Tieu. After eating, he nodded and said, "If vegetarian food is this delicious, I'll probably skip meat when I go back to the North!" 😄
Vegetarian restaurant with 5 star quality!

I am a meat eater but went with a vegetarian friend so I tried a bowl of vegetarian chicken and bamboo shoot noodle soup. Unexpectedly delicious, crispy bamboo shoots, fragrant broth, rich flavor. First time but very impressed.
The restaurant is cool, very comfortable to sit and have breakfast, the staff is very attentive, this vegetarian restaurant must be given 5 stars!
First time coming here to eat and it was delicious. The price is reasonable. I will come back for a long time.
I tried vegetarian crab noodle soup as recommended by the staff. The broth was clear but still rich, fresh green vegetables, soft tofu. Attentive and friendly service.
A vegetarian restaurant worth experiencing in Da Nang - Ans Vegetarian Restaurant, delicious food, reasonable price.
Delicious, clean and extremely reasonable price. I ordered vegetarian noodles with vegetables and crispy bread, very unique taste. The restaurant serves quickly and is friendly.
I find the price quite reasonable, the food is presented neatly. Very satisfied!

Visited Ans this morning with a close friend, both of us ordered Quang noodles and vegetarian cao lau - two "best sellers" here. I have to admit that the toppings are rich, the flavor is hard to fault, the raw vegetables are fresh and clean. 
Cozy space, delicate decor, very comfortable and delicious to sit and eat!
One of the vegetarian restaurants that keeps me coming back the longest in Da Nang! Every time I travel, I stop by here to eat because it's so delicious.
Delicious food, clean space, lovely service.
Every dish is delicious, beautifully presented and fills you up until noon. It's both economical and healthy. A restaurant worth staying at for a long time!
The restaurant is easy to find, clean, and the staff greets customers with a smile at the door – a big plus!
cheerful and enthusiastic staff, delicious food, reasonable price

I am a tourist from Saigon, found ANs when searching for "delicious vegetarian restaurant in Da Nang". When I got there, I ordered the food and tried it. Unexpectedly, it was more delicious than I imagined. The spices were just right and very suitable for my taste. 10/10
The best vegetarian restaurant in Da Nang I've ever been to, clean and fresh food, very polite conversation with customers, 5 stars for the restaurant.

The first time I ate here was because of a friend's recommendation. I didn't expect the vegetarian food to be so diverse and delicious. The space is cozy, the food is served quickly and is still hot, not greasy. I really like this type of vegetarian restaurant.
I knew the restaurant through google map so I went to try it and it was ok, delicious food, cheap price
I have eaten here 3 times, every dish is delicious, especially Kimchi soup and Thai stir-fried pho. Reasonable price, clean and comfortable space. Worth coming back.

The restaurant space is very beautiful. I ordered Pumpkin Sauce Noodles and Thai Curry, both dishes were very delicious, rich in flavor, beautifully presented. The staff is lovely, fast service. The restaurant is suitable for both long-time vegetarians and beginners.
This is my first time eating here, but it's very delicious. Out of 3 people at my table, 2 people praised it and the other person was busy eating.
Very delicious, if you come to Da Nang and are hungry, stop here to eat, it's delicious and the price is very cheap.
The owner is cute and funny, the food is delicious, I will come back if I have the chance!
I like the vegetarian pork vermicelli the most, it suits my taste very well, the staff is friendly, the restaurant is beautifully decorated and airy, very cool, you should try it!
The best vegetarian restaurant I've ever been to in Da Nang! From service to food, everything is very good 👍 …
Delicious, one dish has a lot of servings so everyone should consider it.

This is a slightly more upscale vegan restaurant in Da Nang — and it’s absolutely worth it!
The portions are generous, the presentation is lovely, and the flavors are well-balanced and satisfying.
I especially loved their signature rice dish — it was full of flavor, beautifully cooked, and really generous in size. A truly enjoyable meal!
The staff don’t speak much English, but they’re incredibly warm and friendly, using smiles and gestures to make you feel right at home.
Those who love vegetarian cuisine should not miss this restaurant, dishes are made from fresh ingredients, lovely staff, attentive to customers.
I really like the traditional spring rolls and fried vegetarian dishes, not too greasy, plus points for the restaurant and the other dishes are also very delicious 😊 …
We loved this place and had a really good experience. the vegetarian dishes were beautiful and delicious and the prices were quite reasonable.
The dishes are very tasty, each plate of food is very suitable for our group's taste. Very delicious, can't complain.
First time here but very satisfied, beautiful restaurant selling delicious vegetarian food. Staff is very attentive and cheerful.
The restaurant has a cozy atmosphere. The food is delicious and varied. The drinks are also delicious and reasonably priced.
quiet, comfortable space. Delicious food, suitable for the taste, will come back because the quality is very good from food to staff

My best friend is a foodie and picky person, but after trying Thai-style stir-fried pho and vegetarian rice vermicelli/grilled meat at Ans, he had to nod and admit: "I can't believe vegetarian food can be this delicious."
I chose Crispy Fried Noodles and Tomato Spaghetti – both were excellent, beautifully presented and with fresh ingredients, well worth coming back for.
This is truly the number 1 vegetarian restaurant in Da Nang!
Clean restaurant, quick service, delicious food, an ideal place for those looking for healthy yet delicious food!
Everyone in our group was satisfied because the food was delicious and suited their individual tastes. The staff was extremely cute and enthusiastic!
Visited the restaurant at noon on a weekday, quite crowded but the service was still very fast and friendly. The restaurant's food is very suitable for my taste.
Delicious, fast service, big selection to choose from and reasonably priced!  Highly recommended vegan restaurant.
Delicious hotpot, great vegan food overall. The employees are nice
Tasty food with huge quantities. Would definitely recommend for vegans

When he said he was allergic to peanuts the staff brought out a plate of tofu full of nuts and said it wasn't peanuts when another staff said it was. so we had two plates of tofu with no rancid peanuts. Delicious in a choking way.
The meal was delicious! Highly recommended!
Large selection of local options. Loved everything

This is hands down one of my favorite vegetarian/vegan restaurants! The menu is packed with variety and flavor — from delicious Vietnamese specialties to other creative plant-based dishes, there's so much to choose from and everything tastes amazing. It's 100% vegetarian and vegan, which is such a treat. The team is absolutely lovely, and the place itself is beautiful and has such a cool, welcoming vibe. Love it! 100% Recommend
A must try for true vegetarian lovers.
The best udon of my life ! And the portions are big. I highly recommend!
Service was fast and the food was served in huge portions. The food tasted delicious and the atmosphere was cheerful.
Excellent restaurant, I would take it to Chile!!
Amazing papaya salad and springrolls, a very busy local vegetarian restaurant, they bring out the dishes fast and you get big portions for a fair price.

The food is quite good but the staff is too noisy

I’m not a vegetarian but I’ve eaten here multiple times. That should tell you how good it is.

Really good vegetarian food. Must try: spring rolls. Jackfruit salad is good, (a but spicy for those who cannot handle spicy food) but tasty. There are lots of other dishes which are not spicy, just ask the staff.

The dishes are very tasty, each plate has a lot of food. Very delicious, can't complain. Excellent

Overwhelmed by the massive menu and the prices offered by the restaurant.

The space is a bit cramped but the decor details are also numerous

The hot pot here is also a pretty good choice in terms of price and taste

I have eaten here 4 times, 4 time points quite far apart. The staff on the most recent visit served the food faster than the other times, but I found the staff a bit indifferent. Regarding the food, there were some dishes that I found okay. Some dishes tasted too normal, almost bland, not leaving any impression after finishing the meal. The worst dish that my whole family has ever tried here is the Sichuan Tofu Rice. Although it is a vegetarian dish inspired by Sichuan Ma Po Tofu, the dish did not taste any spicy. The smell and flavor of the dish were both strong with turmeric powder and five-spice powder. These two flavors completely overpowered the other flavors in the rice dish. Overall, I found the quality of the food to be getting worse and worse. Since it is a restaurant, I have no opinion on whether the price is expensive or cheap. But I am not satisfied with the quality of service compared to the amount of money I spent.
Food is great, fabulous! But the service is kinda slow, atmosphere is pretty chill too.
Everything we ordered was so delish!!

We loved this place and had a really good experience. The portion sizes are big (for us at least) and there is a good variety of spice/non-spicy, fried and fresh dishes. Thank you for really nice food 🤗
The restaurant space is quite ok. The service is okay. The dishes are ok but the menu has too many dishes made with cooking oil.

Veggo eats near my hotel

Mango smoothie yum
Staff lovely
Save for lady on register grumpy
Wouldn't return

good food, but hot restaurant
Slow service

1. Ordered wet rice noodles but the staff brought out rice noodles, asked and was confused and said to call the manager. When it was finished, they said everything from the beginning, even dragging the manager out just to deal with a small problem. 

2. The food was too expensive compared to the quality, ordered 3 dishes and all of them were bad, I don't understand pho with bean sprouts, coriander and a few pieces of sausage but charged 100k. Because Sangha closed, this price made Sangha run away. 

3. The price was high but the restaurant was hot, cramped, couldn't turn on the air conditioner even though the customers were sitting close together. 

4. If the table didn't have chopsticks and spoons, the staff had to bring them out themselves, not wait to be reminded, when reminded, the chopsticks and spoons were wet as if they had just been washed. 

Next time I give money, I won't come back to this horrible restaurant, giving 2* for its existence.

Great setting for big groups! Spacious, air-conditioned sitting space with nature backdrop. Serves a wide variety of vegetarian food , ranging from pastas to hotpot. Pumpkin soup is a must try! We enjoyed the traditional spring roll and fried vegetarian platter 😊

Those who love vegetarian cuisine and like to experience vegetarian restaurants in Da Nang should not miss this vegetarian restaurant. This place will bring you a wonderful culinary experience with diverse and rich plant-based dishes. It is an ideal destination for those who love vegetarian cuisine.

This vegetarian restaurant in Da Nang offers customers a diverse culinary experience with dishes made from fresh ingredients. This is an ideal place for those who love vegetarian cuisine and want to explore the unique delicacies in this city.
Restaurant has a burgeoning vegan da nang scene that offers a delicious variety of plant-based dishes, making it a great destination for those seeking vegetarian and vegan-friendly options.
Explore vegetarian Da Nang, whose vegetarian restaurant scene offers an exciting range of dishes showcasing local flavors and ingredients, making it a rewarding destination for vegetarians.

For vegan Da Nang, this restaurant offers a satisfying selection of plant-based dishes. With a menu featuring creative and wholesome vegan options, it's an excellent choice for both ethical eaters and those curious about vegan cuisine in the city.
I was really surprised by the dishes of this vegetarian restaurant in Danang, the quality and taste of the dishes are amazing.

Amazing tradition Vietnamese food with a vegetarian twist! Highly recommend one of the best meals I’ve had in my 4 months of traveling!
I have eaten at many vegetarian restaurants in Danang but this is the place that I feel is most suitable for my taste.

There were four members of staff that I could see working, and all of them were too busy looking at their phones and joking around to pay attention to the customers. They need to realize that working time means it's time to work, and keep their eyes on their customers. The manager either needs to retrain the employees, or hire new ones.
After 2 years living in Vietnam and traveling to all major cities within, this is my favorite vegan restaurant. Every time I am in Da Nang I make it a mission to go at least once. Try the banh xeo!

Excellent!

Upon my arrival at the restaurant at 10:30 AM, I was relieved to discover that it was still within their breakfast hours (07:00 AM - 11:00 AM), granting me the opportunity to savour the dry version of Hu Tieu Noodles.

The culinary offerings at ANs are bursting with bold flavours. My bowl of dried noodles resembled a symphony of enticing tastes, thanks to the inclusion of shiitake mushrooms, oyster mushrooms, wood ear mushrooms, tofu skin, and vegan spring rolls. However, it was the vegan spring rolls that truly left a lasting impression. The deep-fried rolls were irresistibly hot and crispy, boasting an amazing blend of nutty taro and the natural sweetness of sweet potato.

Notably, the restaurant is equipped with air conditioning, creating a comfortable environment. While the decor may be somewhat extravagant, the overall space exudes a cosy atmosphere. Additionally, the staff members demonstrate remarkable agility in attending to diners' needs.
My first meal in danang all the food amazing I’ll come back to eat again

Sadly, this was hands down the worst meal I’ve had across Vietnam between 2020 and 2023.
I’ve ordered the fried rice, which in fairness wasn’t even rice (some different grain maybe?), which was a tasteless soggy mess I couldn’t eat - also came cold. My partner had a Thai curry that didn’t have the slightest resemblance with any sort of curry. Prices are VERY high compared to any veg restaurants - even the ones that are actually nice. On the opposite, the  restaurant is quite ropy, cramped and extremely hot and the staff didn’t bother switching on a fan near us - wouldn’t recommend using the bathroom either.

The menu is very diverse, ranging from Asian to European dishes. Each portion is very large, so an adult may not be able to finish it all, so the price is quite high. The quantity and price can be reduced so that customers can choose more dishes and avoid waste.

Being vegetarians , we were very happy to see a highly rated vegan/vegetarian restaurant rated so highly. But the food was not at all upto mark. The dumplings were reheated stale and not at all chewable. The pad thai noodles were made again from left over veggies from a couple of days back. The only saving grace was their coffee and Sprite . Btw we paid three times the bill as our cab fare so you can understand our disappointment.

Quang noodles are a specialty of Quang Nam - Da Nang, applying the variation of vegetables and fruits to Quang noodles, we have vegetarian Quang noodles cooked from: Mi can, carrots, potatoes, taro, tofu..., Not inferior to the original Quang noodles, vegetarian Quang noodles are also very rich because of the natural sweetness of vegetables, mixed with sweet crispy tripe and fragrant tofu, plus the crispy taste of roasted peanuts and rice paper served with it. The refreshing taste of mushroom broth and large, chewy noodles will bring a very different and delicious vegetarian dining experience.

Cơm Tấm Ba Lang serves up broken rice with charcoal-grilled pork ribs. The menu isn’t fancy—pork, eggs, morning glory, a few sides—but what it lacks in sophistication it makes up for in authenticity and price. Two pieces of meat will fill a light eater; bigger appetites will need double. Portions are modest, the rice a little dry, and yes, the morning glory can be salty. But the pork is smoky, slightly sweet, perfectly seasoned, and grilled over coals with just the right char.

The space is simple. The first floor is hot, with no air conditioning, just fans doing their best. The second floor has AC, barely enough to escape the tropical heat, but it’s a relief for those who don’t want to melt mid-meal. Staff are kind and fast, and the owners are a cheerful husband-and-wife team who make you feel welcome even if you can’t speak a word of Vietnamese.

Drinks aren’t always cold, ice melts fast, and hygiene is local standard—not perfect, but not alarming. It’s a tourist magnet now, thanks to YouTube and Google Maps, but mostly it’s a neighbourhood spot where locals pick up takeout or settle in for a quick lunch. Spring rolls are serviceable, soups are simple, but the core dish—pork rib rice—is consistent, cheap, and genuinely satisfying. The sweet-and-salty sauce on the table elevates every bite, and yes, the morning glory is worth ordering.

If you’re craving a genuine Vietnamese pork rib rice bowl that hits the sweet spot of smoky, salty, and comforting, this small shop on Yên Bái Street is worth a stop. Forget expectations, embrace the heat, and order two pieces of pork. Then thank yourself for discovering Da Nang’s simple, smoky, undeniable flavour.

If you’re craving a hearty and flavorful Vietnamese meal, Cơm Tấm Ba Lang on Yên Bái Street in Đà Nẵng is a spot worth checking out. Specializing in cơm tấm—broken rice typically served with grilled meats, pickled vegetables, and a side of fish sauce—this place delivers both quality and value.

The grilled pork chop is the star of the show: tender, juicy, and charred just right for that authentic smoky flavor. Their egg meatloaf (chả trứng) and shredded pork skin (bì) are also solid choices, full of texture and traditional taste. The broken rice itself is fluffy and perfectly cooked, soaking up the savory, slightly sweet nước mắm like a sponge.

Portions are generous, prices are affordable, and the service is fast and friendly. The dining area is clean and casual, great for a quick lunch or dinner. Locals frequent this spot, which is always a good sign.

Whether you’re a local or a traveler looking for a true taste of southern-style Vietnamese comfort food, Cơm Tấm Ba Lang won’t disappoint.

Overall, a tasty meal with minor weaknesses in the portion size and the side dishes. The main course was very tasty, the meat was well seasoned - although the amount of meat was rather small compared to other restaurants. Nevertheless, the portion was enough for me. The complimentary side soup was very pleasing, as it had a strong taste and complemented the dish successfully. The pickled vegetables as a side dish also tasted good. The spring rolls, on the other hand, weren't entirely convincing: although they were cheap, they were very small, thin and barely filled with meat. Okay for a small appetite, but the taste is unspectacular. Overall, a solid meal with good taste and small compromises in the overall package.

1. I gave the atmosphere a low score, but considering the locals, I didn't see any issues, so I rated it low based solely on the ambiance.
2. I was going to give the service a 5-star rating considering the Vietnamese staff, but since I'm a Korean, I lowered it by one point.
3. The food was excellent, giving it a 5-star rating for its value.
I had a rice bowl called "Com Tam" and morning glory, which were slightly lower than the more expensive places I've had in Hoi An. The stems were larger, so the taste was a bit chewy. Those who prefer a crisper texture might enjoy it. Of the three morning glory I had during my three-day trip, this was the best, considering the value.
It was my first time eating "Com Tam," so I can't compare, but the taste was good, and considering the value, I was very satisfied. They also have tea, which is a nice alternative to water. At other restaurants, I had to buy a glass of water, so I thought it was a plus.

It's delicious. I ate it so often that I ate it once a day during my trip. It tastes exactly like Pocheon Idong Galbi. However, due to the nature of gumttam, the rice grains are broken apart when served, so this may vary depending on your taste.

A cheap and delicious local restaurant. The portions may be a little small, so I recommend the two-meat menu. Morning Glory is also cheap and delicious. It is a place that is better in terms of cost-effectiveness and taste than the expensive restaurants along the Han River.

Charcoal-grilled pork and rice is a Vietnamese nostalgic food. It is now a traditional delicacy. It is very delicious.

The restaurant sells sweet rib rice like Saigon style. There are many toppings to choose from. I saw many Korean customers coming to eat. The space is simple, the rice is filling. A plate of ribs alone is 35K. The rest with full toppings is more expensive. A place worth trying for lunch.

I lived in Da Nang for a month, and there was a place called "Com Tam Barang" near my accommodation, so I started eating there. The taste and value were so good that I ordered takeout almost every morning. When I return to Korea, I'll remember this place more than any other famous restaurant. I'm leaving for Korea today, so I'm writing a review while eating takeout.

Vietnamese charcoal grilled pork rice (a small roadside restaurant). The food is delicious and the portion is just right for girls, but not enough for boys. However, the CP value is very high. If you are tired of Vietnamese noodles and Vietnamese sandwiches, you can try it.
First off, the pork ribs taste familiar to Koreans. The food is a bit salty overall. If you order two pieces, you won't have enough rice. The morning glory is also a bit salty.
Love this place!
Local restaurant. Pork rib rice bowl familiar to Koreans. Good value for money.
I stumbled upon this local restaurant while walking down the street looking for a quick bite to eat. I can't pass it up, even just because of the smell. Haha, it's delicious.
A cost-effective local restaurant.
It suits the Korean palate and is great value for money!!!
The price was cheap, the owner was kind, and the food was delicious. It was the best!!

Although their grilled pork rice is really nice. But want to try the alternative dish.

Recommended among local restaurants. Order cola in cans. If you order it in bottles, it's a cold cola + ice glass, but Vietnamese ice is sour and a bit weird.. Chinese sausages were surprisingly tasty.

This was the restaurant I stopped by on my last day in Da Nang. I went there without any expectations, but it was so delicious that I decided to go back again. Good value for money

Since it is a local restaurant, English is not widely spoken, but there is a Korean menu, and I felt that they were trying their best to serve me with care.

The owner has a kind face.. and the price is really reasonable but the food is really delicious!!!! I ate everything. It's even better when you come here when you're a little tired of rice noodles or bun cha... My boyfriend and I both really enjoyed the food. We'll go again next year. Keep up the good work.

I visited this restaurant after searching because it was close to my accommodation. It was a cheap local restaurant, but it was air-conditioned on the second floor and the food was excellent. In Vietnamese, Dac biet means special. If you want to eat all the menus in the restaurant, you can order something that says dac biet, and that's what I ordered here. The pork was delicious, of course, and the steamed eggs were delicious, and the vegetables like cabbage kimchi were spicy and perfect for Korean tastes. I was curious about what it would taste like, so I ordered the assorted platter.
5 dishes...
It has pros and cons. First, it's not cooked to order, but rather pre-cooked ribs, sausages, fried eggs, etc., and they're served to you when you order.
The advantage is that it comes out quickly. The disadvantage is that it's not hot and cold.
The ribs have a familiar sweet and sour taste.
The jjajangmyeon looks delicious, but it was cold, which was disappointing.
The omelet is the same omelet with meat! Haha
There's also something called Chinese sausage,
but if you think of it as typical Korean sausage, it might not suit your taste.
The kimchi... I'll just call it pickled vegetables! Haha.

If you think it's a famous restaurant in Da Nang, you might be a little disappointed...
If you're staying at a hotel without breakfast, it seems like a good breakfast.

What to eat for lunch today 😶
🏡 Ba Lang broken rice - 120 Yen Bai ⏰ 9am - 8pm
💰 25k - 50k
🌟 4/5
-------------------------------------------------
🌸 Broken rice is a very popular dish 💪 I went at noon, the restaurant was quite crowded, suitable for eating with family 🙆
🌸 I ordered 2 plates of ribs + fried egg 35k/plate. A plate includes rice, 1 piece of ribs, 1 fried egg, cabbage, cucumber. The rice is loose, a bit dry in some places. The ribs are marinated with rich flavor, soft. The fried egg is cooked without being fried 😂 The dipping sauce is delicious, eating with rice is delicious. Overall, I think it's delicious 💪
🌸 Prices range from 25 - 50k. The vendors are also friendly 😊
If you want to change the taste every now and then, eat Southern-style broken rice, you guys 🤣! This restaurant is quite crowded, so I was curious to try it. The sweet taste is quite similar to Saigon. A normal plate of grilled ribs is 25k, the plate I ate was ribs - egg rolls - fried egg for 35k. The ribs here are grilled directly when eaten, they are also quite large, not dry at all so the meat is sweet, as for the rice, it is real broken rice, so I quite like it. What I like most here is the sweet and sour fish sauce. Every time I eat broken rice, I often ask for an extra bowl of scallion oil to mix with the fish sauce, when poured over the rice, it has a sweet and sour taste mixed with the fatty taste of the scallion, eating rice alone is also enjoyable 🤣🤣🤣 that's how Fin eats broken rice
It was a new experience lol It was fun but the taste was so-so
The food is okay, the price is a bit high compared to the general level, the seating is cramped
A local restaurant near Han Market. Pork rib set (Gumtam) 70,000 dong (for two pieces of meat and a fried egg. 40,000 dong for one piece of meat). Additional meat 30,000 dong.
I went there twice with my kids. It wasn't amazing, but I think it suits the Korean palate. It was okay.

There were too many people to go to the restaurant, so I went to Plan B here. I am very satisfied. 8 people ordered 8 pieces and ate 3 more. I ate 5.6.7.8 times, but I highly recommended 6.7 times. The 8th set meal was somewhat disappointing. I only ordered 3 additional pieces of meat and ate it.
A total of 8 people serve for 11 people, with only meat added and 6 colas for 3 people. I'm very satisfied. If you're nearby, check it out.

I ordered something like braised mackerel, and my girlfriend ordered something with Kum Tam and a fried egg. We also had fried spring rolls. The fried spring rolls were the most filling and delicious I've had in Da Nang. The pork rib set that I had and my girlfriend had was also delicious. It's not a fancy restaurant, but it's a local restaurant, so it was cheap and delicious. The best.

I do breakfast here at least once a week. This place is very clean, from the dining tables right down to the silverware.  The pork chop grilled over charcoal is on point every single time. The pickled veggies go really well with the grilled pork chop.  The complimentary ice tea is really good. It has a hint of sweetness in an after taste.  Pretty sure it has something else in there other than tea, and definitely not sugar. The service is prompt and the price is right.

I am a person who has been living in Vietnam for 4 years.
As someone who has tried almost all Vietnamese food, when I was tired of the neatly plated Vietnamese restaurants in Da Nang, this place was like an oasis to me.

As someone who only lives in one area, I was so happy to be able to eat the famous Ho Chi Minh pork rib rice bowl, Gumsun, in Da Nang. The price was the same as the local price, and the taste was so good that I felt purified.
If you are concerned about cleanliness, freshness, hygiene, and Instagram photos, don't go.. If you want to try the real local style pork rib rice bowl, you should definitely go. The taste is guaranteed. There is also a Korean menu.
However, if you don't like rice that flies around, don't go~~

It was past 7 p.m. It's a bit odd because they don't cook the meat right after you order it. It seems like the meat will be warm during peak hours. The other side dishes were just so-so. Some of the seasoning wasn't quite right, so I'm not sure if it's a particularly good restaurant.
I spent six days in Dalat, a month in Nha Trang, and then moved to Da Nang.

My mom wanted to eat, so I looked it up and visited. I ordered a menu with two ribs because she said the Google Maps review said the mixed meal was not good. It seemed like three generations, including a boy who looked about 10 years old, were running the business together. I was drawn in by the charcoal smell of marinated ribs wafting from the street. It was just our Korean BBQ, nothing special. I ordered three ribs, and the total cost was about 6,000 won. The grandmother understood English vaguely, and her son could speak some English, and the son's son had a great sense. The taste was ordinary, but I was satisfied with the meal.
